 16426                                  ;**	Search.asm
 16427                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16428                                  ;	Directory search system calls.
 16429                                  ;	These will be passed direct text of the pathname from the user. 
 16430                                  ;	They will need to be passed through the macro expander prior to
 16431                                  ;	being sent through the low-level stuff. 
 16432                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH. The system calls are:
 16433                                  ;
 16434                                  ;	$Dir_Search_First	  written
 16435                                  ;	$Dir_Search_Next	  written
 16436                                  ;	$Find_First	  written
 16437                                  ;	$Find_Next		  written
 16438                                  ;	PackName		  written
 16439                                  ;
 16440                                  ;	Modification history:
 16441                                  ;
 16442                                  ;	  Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 16443                                  
 16444                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16445                                  ; Procedure Name : $DIR_SEARCH_FIRST
 16446                                  ;
 16447                                  ; Inputs:
 16448                                  ;	DS:DX Points to unopenned FCB
 16449                                  ; Function:
 16450                                  ;	Directory is searched for first matching entry and the directory
 16451                                  ;	entry is loaded at the disk transfer address
 16452                                  ; Returns:
 16453                                  ;	AL = -1 if no entries matched, otherwise 0
 16454                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16455                                  
 16456                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 2B88h
 16457                                  	
 16458                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16459                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5DCBh
 16460                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5DDFh
 16461                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:647Bh
 16462                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:61E5h
 16463                                  
 16464                                  _$DIR_SEARCH_FIRST:
 16465 000024DE 368916[A605]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB],DX
 16466 000024E3 368C1E[A805]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB+2],DS
 16467 000024E8 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX
 16468 000024EA 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0FFH
 16469 000024ED 7503                    	JNZ	short NORMFCB4
 16470 000024EF 83C607                  	ADD	SI,7			; Point to drive select byte
 16471                                  NORMFCB4:
 16472 000024F2 FF34                    	push	word [SI]		; Save original drive byte for later
 16473                                  
 16474 000024F4 16                      	push	ss
 16475 000024F5 07                      	pop	es			; get es to address DOSGroup
 16476                                  
 16477 000024F6 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 16478 000024F9 E82F53                  	call	TransFCB		; convert the FCB, set SATTRIB EXTFCB
 16479 000024FC 7304                    	JNC	short SearchIt		; no error, go and look
 16480 000024FE 5B                      	pop	bx			; Clean stack
 16481                                  
 16482                                  ; Error code is in AX
 16483                                  
 16484                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16485                                  dcf_errj:
 16486 000024FF E99CE1                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR		; error
 16487                                  
 16488                                  SearchIt:
 16489 00002502 16                      	push	ss
 16490 00002503 1F                      	pop	ds			; get ready for search
 16491                                  	;push	word [DMAADD]
 16492                                  	;push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16493                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16494 00002504 C43E[2C03]              	les	di,[DMAADD]
 16495 00002508 57                      	push	di
 16496 00002509 06                      	push	es
 16497 0000250A C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16498 00002510 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16499                                  	; 03/03/2025 (MiniDOS)
 16500                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 16501 00002514 E83A0F                  	call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 16502                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 16503                                  	;call	GET_FAST_SEARCH		; search
 16504 00002517 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16505 0000251B 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16506 0000251F 735A                    	JNC	short SearchSet		; no error, transfer info
 16507 00002521 5B                      	pop	bx			; Clean stack
 16508                                  
 16509                                  ; Error code is in AX
 16510                                  
 16511                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16512                                  	;jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 16513 00002522 EBDB                    	jmp	short dcf_errj
 16514                                  
 16515                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16516                                  ;
 16517                                  ; Procedure Name : $DIR_SEARCH_NEXT
 16518                                  ;
 16519                                  ; Inputs:
 16520                                  ;	DS:DX points to unopenned FCB returned by $DIR_SEARCH_FIRST
 16521                                  ; Function:
 16522                                  ;	Directory is searched for the next matching entry and the directory
 16523                                  ;	entry is loaded at the disk transfer address
 16524                                  ; Returns:
 16525                                  ;	AL = -1 if no entries matched, otherwise 0
 16526                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16527                                  
 16528                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16529                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5E5Fh
 16530                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5E73h
 16531                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6517h
 16532                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:6273h
 16533                                  
 16534                                  _$DIR_SEARCH_NEXT:
 16535 00002524 368916[A605]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB],DX
 16536 00002529 368C1E[A805]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB+2],DS
 16537                                  	; 24/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 16538                                  	;MOV	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0
 16539                                  	;MOV	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0
 16540 0000252E B000                    	mov	al,0
 16541 00002530 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],al ; 0
 16542 00002534 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],al ; 0
 16543                                  
 16544 00002538 16                      	push	ss
 16545 00002539 07                      	pop	es
 16546                                  
 16547 0000253A BF[BE04]                	MOV	DI,SEARCHBUF
 16548                                  
 16549 0000253D 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX
 16550 0000253F 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0FFh
 16551 00002542 750D                    	JNZ	short NORMFCB6
 16552 00002544 83C606                  	ADD	SI,6
 16553 00002547 AC                      	LODSB
 16554                                  
 16555 00002548 36A2[6D05]              	MOV	[SS:SATTRIB],AL
 16556 0000254C 36FE0E[6C05]            	DEC	byte [SS:EXTFCB]
 16557                                  NORMFCB6:
 16558 00002551 AC                      	LODSB				; Get original user drive byte
 16559 00002552 50                      	push	ax			; Put it on stack
 16560 00002553 8A4414                  	MOV	AL,[SI+20]		; Get correct search contin drive byte
 16561 00002556 AA                      	STOSB				; Put in correct place
 16562 00002557 B90A00                  	MOV	CX,20/2
 16563 0000255A F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW			; Transfer in rest of search contin info
 16564                                  
 16565 0000255C 16                      	push	ss
 16566 0000255D 1F                      	pop	ds
 16567                                  
 16568                                  	;push	word [DMAADD]
 16569                                  	;push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16570                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16571 0000255E C43E[2C03]              	les	di,[DMAADD]
 16572 00002562 57                      	push	di
 16573 00002563 06                      	push	es
 16574 00002564 C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16575 0000256A 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16576 0000256E E8910F                  	call	DOS_SEARCH_NEXT 	; Find it
 16577 00002571 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16578 00002575 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16579 00002579 7249                    	JC	short SearchNoMore
 16580                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16581                                  	;JMP	SearchSet		; Ok set return
 16582                                  
 16583                                  ;;;	; 24/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16584                                  
 16585                                  ; The search was successful (or the search-next). We store the information
 16586                                  ; into the user's FCB for continuation.
 16587                                  
 16588                                  SearchSet:
 16589 0000257B BE[BE04]                	MOV	SI,SEARCHBUF
 16590 0000257E C43E[A605]              	LES	DI,[THISFCB]		; point to the FCB
 16591 00002582 F606[6C05]FF            	TEST	byte [EXTFCB],0FFh
 16592 00002587 7403                    	JZ	short NORMFCB1
 16593 00002589 83C707                  	ADD	DI,7			; Point past the extension
 16594                                  NORMFCB1:
 16595 0000258C 5B                      	pop	bx			; Get original drive byte
 16596 0000258D 08DB                    	OR	BL,BL
 16597 0000258F 7506                    	JNZ	short SearchDrv
 16598 00002591 8A1E[3603]              	MOV	BL,[CURDRV]
 16599 00002595 FEC3                    	INC	BL
 16600                                  SearchDrv:
 16601 00002597 AC                      	LODSB				; Get correct search contin drive byte
 16602 00002598 86C3                    	XCHG	AL,BL			; Search byte to BL, user byte to AL
 16603 0000259A 47                      	INC	DI
 16604                                  	;STOSB				; Store the correct "user" drive byte
 16605                                  					;  at the start of the search info
 16606 0000259B B90A00                  	MOV	CX,20/2
 16607 0000259E F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW			; Rest of search cont info, SI -> entry
 16608 000025A0 86C3                    	XCHG	AL,BL			; User drive byte back to BL, search
 16609                                  					;   byte to AL
 16610 000025A2 AA                      	STOSB				; Search contin drive byte at end of
 16611                                  					;   contin info
 16612 000025A3 C43E[2C03]              	LES	DI,[DMAADD]
 16613 000025A7 F606[6C05]FF            	TEST	byte [EXTFCB],0FFh
 16614 000025AC 740C                    	JZ	short NORMFCB2
 16615 000025AE B0FF                    	MOV	AL,0FFh
 16616 000025B0 AA                      	STOSB
 16617 000025B1 FEC0                    	INC	AL
 16618                                  	;MOV	CX,5
 16619                                  	; 17/12/2022
 16620                                  	;mov	cl,5
 16621                                  	;REP	STOSB
 16622                                  	; 03/07/2024
 16623 000025B3 AB                      	stosw
 16624 000025B4 AB                      	stosw
 16625 000025B5 AA                      	stosb
 16626 000025B6 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 16627 000025B9 AA                      	STOSB
 16628                                  NORMFCB2:
 16629 000025BA 88D8                    	MOV	AL,BL			; User Drive byte
 16630 000025BC AA                      	STOSB
 16631                                  	;MOV	CX,16			; 32 / 2 words of dir entry
 16632                                  	; 17/12/2022
 16633 000025BD B110                    	mov	cl,16
 16634 000025BF F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW
 16635 000025C1 E9D7E0                  	jmp	FCB_RET_OK
 16636                                  ;;;
 16637                                  
 16638                                  SearchNoMore:
 16639 000025C4 C43E[A605]              	LES	DI,[THISFCB]
 16640 000025C8 F606[6C05]FF            	TEST	byte [EXTFCB],0FFh
 16641 000025CD 7403                    	JZ	short NORMFCB8
 16642 000025CF 83C707                  	ADD	DI,7			; Point past the extension
 16643                                  NORMFCB8:
 16644 000025D2 5B                      	pop	bx			; Get original drive byte
 16645 000025D3 26881D                  	MOV	[ES:DI],BL		; Store the correct "user" drive byte
 16646                                  					;  at the right spot
 16647                                  ; error code is in AX
 16648                                  
 16649 000025D6 E9C5E0                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 16650

 16652                                  
 16653                                  ; DOSCODE:5EE6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)

 16655                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16656                                  ;
 16657                                  ;   Procedure Name : $FIND_FIRST
 16658                                  ; 
 16659                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 16660                                  ;	    MOV AH, FindFirst
 16661                                  ;	    LDS DX, name
 16662                                  ;	    MOV CX, attr
 16663                                  ;	    INT 21h
 16664                                  ;	; DMA address has datablock
 16665                                  ;
 16666                                  ;   Error Returns:
 16667                                  ;	    AX = error_path_not_found
 16668                                  ;	       = error_no_more_files
 16669                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16670                                  
 16671                                  	; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 16672                                  	; DOSCODE:5ED2h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 16673                                  
 16674                                  	; 24/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 16675                                  	; DOSCODE:6594h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 16676                                  
 16677                                  _$FIND_FIRST:
 16678 000025D9 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get name in appropriate place
 16679 000025DB 36880E[6D05]            	MOV	[SS:SATTRIB],CL		; Search attribute to correct loc
 16680                                  
 16681 000025E0 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 16682                                  
 16683 000025E3 E8AB52                  	call	TransPathSet		; convert the path
 16684 000025E6 7305                    	JNC	short Find_it 		; no error, go and look
 16685                                  FindError:
 16686                                  	;mov	al,3
 16687 000025E8 B003                    	mov	al,error_path_not_found	; error and map into one.
 16688                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16689                                  FF_errj:
 16690 000025EA E99CE0                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 16691                                  Find_it:
 16692 000025ED 16                      	push	ss
 16693 000025EE 1F                      	pop	ds
 16694                                  
 16695                                  	;push	word [DMAADD]
 16696                                  	;push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16697                                  	; 24/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 16698 000025EF C43E[2C03]              	les	di,[DMAADD]
 16699 000025F3 57                      	push	di
 16700 000025F4 06                      	push	es
 16701                                  	
 16702 000025F5 C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16703 000025FB 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16704                                  	; 03/03/2025 (MiniDOS)
 16705                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 16706 000025FF E84F0E                  	call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 16707                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 16708                                  	;call	GET_FAST_SEARCH 	; search
 16709 00002602 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16710 00002606 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16711                                  	
 16712                                  	; 16/12/2022
 16713                                  	;JNC	short FindSet 		; no error, transfer info
 16714 0000260A 72DE                    	jc	short FF_errj	; jmp SYS_RET_ERR
 16715                                  	;
 16716                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 16717                                  	; 09/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 16718                                  ;FFF_errj:
 16719                                  	;jmp	short FF_errj	; jmp SYS_RET_ERR
 16720                                  
 16721                                  FindSet:
 16722 0000260C BE[BE04]                	MOV	SI,SEARCHBUF
 16723 0000260F C43E[2C03]              	LES	DI,[DMAADD]
 16724 00002613 B91500                  	MOV	CX,21
 16725 00002616 F3A4                    	REP	MOVSB
 16726 00002618 56                      	PUSH	SI			; Save pointer to start of entry
 16727                                  	;mov	al,[si+0Bh]

 16729 0000261C AA                      	STOSB
 16730                                  	;add	si,16h ; 22
 16731 0000261D 83C616                  	ADD	SI,dir_entry.dir_time
 16732 00002620 A5                      	MOVSW				; dir_time
 16733 00002621 A5                      	MOVSW				; dir_date

 16794                                  ;**	PackName - Convert file names from FCB to ASCIZ format.
 16795                                  ;
 16796                                  ;	PackName transfers a file name from DS:SI to ES:DI and converts it to
 16797                                  ;	the ASCIZ format.
 16798                                  ;

 17136                                  ; DOSCODE:6065h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 17137                                  
 17138                                  ;BREAK <$ChDir -- Change current directory on a drive>
 17139                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17140                                  ;
 17141                                  ; $ChDir - Top-level change directory system call.  This call is responsible
 17142                                  ; for setting up the CDS for the specified drive appropriately.  There are
 17143                                  ; several cases to consider:
 17144                                  ;
 17145                                  ;   o	Local, simple CDS.  In this case, we take the input path and convert
 17146                                  ;	it into a WFP.	We verify the existance of this directory and then
 17147                                  ;	copy the WFP into the CDS and set up the ID field to point to the
 17148                                  ;	directory cluster.
 17149                                  ;   o	Net CDS.  We form the path from the root (including network prefix)
 17150                                  ;	and verify its existance (via DOS_Chdir).  If successful, we copy the
 17151                                  ;	WFP back into the CDS.
 17152                                  ;   o	SUBST'ed CDS.  This is no different than the local, simple CDS.
 17153                                  ;   o	JOIN'ed CDS.  This is trouble as there are two CDS's at work.  If we
 17154                                  ;	call TransPath, we will get the PHYSICAL CDS that the path refers to
 17155                                  ;	and the PHYSICAL WFP that the input path refers to.  This is perfectly
 17156                                  ;	good for the validation but not for currency.  We call TransPathNoSet
 17157                                  ;	to process the path but to return the logical CDS and the logical
 17158                                  ;	path.  We then copy the logical path into the logical CDS.
 17159                                  ;
 17160                                  ; Inputs:
 17161                                  ;	DS:DX Points to asciz name
 17162                                  ; Returns:
 17163                                  ;	STD XENIX Return
 17164                                  ;	AX = chdir_path_not_found if error
 17165                                  ;
 17166                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17167                                  	
 17168                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17169                                  	
 17170                                  _$CHDIR:
 17171                                  	; 25/01/2024
 17172                                  	;;;
 17173 00002742 36C606[0C11]43          	mov	byte [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; Retro DOS v5.0
 17174                                  	;mov	word [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; DIRSTRLEN = 67
 17175                                  	;;;
 17176 00002748 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; spot for translated name
 17177 0000274B 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get source
 17178 0000274D E83D51                  	call	TransPath		; go munge the path and get real CDS
 17179 00002750 7304                    	JNC	short ChDirCrack	; no errors, try path
 17180                                  ChDirErrP:
 17181                                  	;mov	al,3
 17182 00002752 B003                    	MOV	AL,error_path_not_found
 17183                                  ChDirErr:
 17184                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR 	; oops!
 17185                                  	; 10/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 17186 00002754 EBAF                    	jmp	short chdir_errj
 17187                                  
 17188                                  ChDirCrack:
 17189 00002756 803E[7A05]FF            	CMP	byte [CMETA],-1		; No meta chars allowed.
 17190 0000275B 75F5                    	JNZ	short ChDirErrP
 17191                                  
 17192                                  ; We cannot do a ChDir (yet) on a raw CDS. This is treated as a path not
 17193                                  ; found.
 17194                                  
 17195 0000275D C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 17196 00002761 83FFFF                  	CMP	DI,-1			; if (ThisCDS == NULL)
 17197 00002764 74EC                    	JZ	short ChDirErrP		;    error ();
 17198                                  
 17199                                  ; Find out if the directory exists.
 17200                                  
 17201 00002766 E86111                  	call	DOS_CHDIR
 17202                                  	;Jc	short ChDirErr
 17203                                  	; 16/12/2022
 17204 00002769 729A                    	jc	short chdir_errj
 17205                                  ;
 17206                                  ; Get back CDS to see if a join as seen. Set the currency pointer (only if
 17207                                  ; not network). If one was seen, all we need to do is copy in the text
 17208                                  ;

 17430                                  ;============================================================================
 17431                                  ; IOCTL.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 17432                                  ;============================================================================
 17433                                  ; 07/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17434                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17435                                  
 17436                                  ;**	IOCTL system call.
 17437                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17438                                  ;	$IOCTL
 17439                                  ;
 17440                                  ;	  Revision history:
 17441                                  ;
 17442                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 17443                                  ;
 17444                                  ;		GenericIOCTL added:		KGS	22 April 1985
 17445                                  ;
 17446                                  ;		A000	version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 17447                                  ;
 17448                                  ;		Used jump table to dispatch IOCTL functions. HKN 3/12/90
 17449                                  ;
 17450                                  
 17451                                  ;BREAK <IOCTL - munge on a handle to do device specific stuff>
 17452                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17453                                  ;
 17454                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 17455                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 17456                                  ;	    MOV     DX, Data
 17457                                  ;
 17458                                  ;	(or LDS     DX,BUF
 17459                                  ;	    MOV     CX,COUNT)
 17460                                  ;
 17461                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Ioctl
 17462                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 17463                                  ;	    INT     21h
 17464                                  ;
 17465                                  ;   AH = 0  Return a combination of low byte of sf_flags and device driver
 17466                                  ;	    attribute word in DX, handle in BX:
 17467                                  ;	    DH = high word of device driver attributes
 17468                                  ;	    DL = low byte of sf_flags
 17469                                  ;	 1  Set the bits contained in DX to sf_flags.  DH MUST be 0.  Handle
 17470                                  ;	    in BX.
 17471                                  ;	 2  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for handle in BX
 17472                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 17473                                  ;	 3  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for handle in BX from
 17474                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 17475                                  ;	 4  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for drive in BX
 17476                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 17477                                  ;	 5  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for drive in BX from
 17478                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 17479                                  ;	 6  Return input status of handle in BX. If a read will go to the
 17480                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 17481                                  ;	 7  Return output status of handle in BX. If a write will go to the
 17482                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 17483                                  ;	 8  Given a drive in BX, return 1 if the device contains non-
 17484                                  ;	    removable media, 0 otherwise.
 17485                                  ;	 9  Return the contents of the device attribute word in DX for the
 17486                                  ;	    drive in BX.  0200h is the bit for shared.	1000h is the bit for
 17487                                  ;	    network. 8000h is the bit for local use.
 17488                                  ;	 A  Return 8000h if the handle in BX is for the network or not.
 17489                                  ;	 B  Change the retry delay and the retry count for the system. BX is
 17490                                  ;	    the count and CX is the delay.
 17491                                  ;
 17492                                  ;   Error returns:
 17493                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 17494                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 17495                                  ;	       = error_invalid_data
 17496                                  ;
 17497                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17498                                  ;
 17499                                  ;   This is the documentation copied from DOS 4.0 it is much better
 17500                                  ;   than the above
 17501                                  ;
 17502                                  ;	There are several basic forms of IOCTL calls:
 17503                                  ;
 17504                                  ;
 17505                                  ;	** Get/Set device information:	**
 17506                                  ;
 17507                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17508                                  ;		  0 - Get device information
 17509                                  ;		  1 - Set device information
 17510                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17511                                  ;		(DX) = info for "Set Device Information"
 17512                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17513                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17514                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17515                                  ;		  (DX) = info for "Get Device Information"
 17516                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17517                                  ;
 17518                                  ;
 17519                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Handle  **
 17520                                  ;
 17521                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17522                                  ;		  2 - Read device control info
 17523                                  ;		  3 - Write device control info
 17524                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17525                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 17526                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 17527                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17528                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17529                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17530                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 17531                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17532                                  ;
 17533                                  ;
 17534                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Block Device  **
 17535                                  ;
 17536                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17537                                  ;		  4 - Read device control info
 17538                                  ;		  5 - Write device control info
 17539                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 17540                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 17541                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 17542                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17543                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17544                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17545                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 17546                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17547                                  ;
 17548                                  ;
 17549                                  ;	**  Get Input/Output Status  **
 17550                                  ;
 17551                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17552                                  ;		  6 - Get Input status
 17553                                  ;		  7 - Get Output Status
 17554                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17555                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17556                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17557                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17558                                  ;		  (AL) = 00 if not ready
 17559                                  ;		  (AL) = FF if ready
 17560                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17561                                  ;
 17562                                  ;
 17563                                  ;	**  Get Drive Information  **
 17564                                  ;
 17565                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17566                                  ;		  8 - Check for removable media
 17567                                  ;		  9 - Get device attributes
 17568                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 17569                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17570                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17571                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17572                                  ;		  (AX) = 0/1 media is removable/fixed (func. 8)
 17573                                  ;		  (DX) = device attribute word (func. 9)
 17574                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17575                                  ;
 17576                                  ;
 17577                                  ;	**  Get Redirected bit	**
 17578                                  ;
 17579                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17580                                  ;		  0Ah - Network stuff
 17581                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17582                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17583                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17584                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17585                                  ;		  (DX) = SFT flags word, 8000h set if network file
 17586                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17587                                  ;
 17588                                  ;
 17589                                  ;	**  Change sharer retry parameters  **
 17590                                  ;
 17591                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17592                                  ;		  0Bh - Set retry parameters
 17593                                  ;		(CX) = retry loop count
 17594                                  ;		(DX) = number of retries
 17595                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17596                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17597                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17598                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17599                                  ;
 17600                                  ;
 17601                                  ;   =================================================================
 17602                                  ;
 17603                                  ;	**  New Standard Control  **
 17604                                  ;
 17605                                  ;	ALL NEW IOCTL FACILITIES SHOULD USE THIS FORM.	THE OTHER
 17606                                  ;	FORMS ARE OBSOLETE.
 17607                                  ;
 17608                                  ;   =================================================================
 17609                                  ;
 17610                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17611                                  ;		  0Ch - Control Function subcode
 17612                                  ;		(BX) = File Handle
 17613                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 17614                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 17615                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 17616                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17617                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17618                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17619                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17620                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17621                                  ;		  (SI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 17622                                  ;		  (DI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 17623                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 17624                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17625                                  ;
 17626                                  ;    ============== Generic IOCTL Definitions for DOS 3.2 ============
 17627                                  ;     (See inc\ioctl.inc for more info)
 17628                                  ;
 17629                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17630                                  ;		  0Dh - Control Function subcode
 17631                                  ;		(BL) = Drive Number (0 = Default, 1= 'A')
 17632                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 17633                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 17634                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 17635                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17636                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17637                                  ;
 17638                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17639                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17640                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17641                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 17642                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17643                                  ;
 17644                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17645                                  	
 17646                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17647                                  	; DOSCODE:611Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 17648                                  
 17649                                  	; 11/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 17650                                  	; DOSCODE:610Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 17651                                  
 17652                                  	; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17653                                  	; DOSCODE:67F7h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 17654

 17679                                  _$IOCTL:
 17680 0000283A 8CDE                    	MOV	SI,DS			; Stash DS for calls 2,3,4 and 5
 17681 0000283C 16                      	push	ss
 17682 0000283D 1F                      	pop	ds			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 17683                                  
 17684                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 17685                                  	;cmp	al,0Fh 
 17686                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17687 0000283E 3C11                    	cmp	al,11h			; al must be between 0 & 11h
 17688 00002840 770D                    	ja	short ioctl_bad_funj2	; if not bad function #
 17689                                  
 17690                                  	; 14/01/2024
 17691                                  	; 28/05/2019
 17692                                  	;push	AX	; 14/01/2024	; Need to save AL for generic IOCTL
 17693 00002842 89C7                    	mov	di,ax			; di NOT a PARM
 17694 00002844 81E7FF00                	and	di,0FFh			; di = al
 17695 00002848 D1E7                    	shl	di,1			; di = index into jmp table
 17696                                  	;pop	AX			; Restore AL for generic IOCTL
 17697

 17847                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17848                                  ;
 17849                                  ; Generic IOCTL entry point. AL = C, D, 10h, 11h
 17850                                  ;
 17851                                  ;	here we invoke the Generic IOCTL using the IOCTL_Req structure.
 17852                                  ;	SI:DX -> Users Device Parameter Table
 17853                                  ;	IOCALL -> IOCTL_Req structure
 17854                                  ;
 17855                                  ; 	If on entry AL >= IOCTL_QUERY_HANDLE the function is a
 17856                                  ;	QueryIOCtlSupport call ELSE it's a standard generic IOCtl
 17857                                  ;	call.
 17858                                  ;
 17859                                  ; BUGBUG: Don't push anything on the stack between GENERIOCTL: and 
 17860                                  ;         the call to Check_If_Net because Check_If_Net gets our
 17861                                  ;         return address off the stack if the drive is invalid.
 17862                                  ;
 17863                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17864                                  
 17865                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17866

 18146                                  			; NOTE: 'jnz' condition is correct for Windows ME
 18147                                  			; 'Get_Driver_BL ' because it tests bit 0 of [drive_flags]
 18148                                  			; but in PCDOS 7.1 'Get_Driver_BL', this flag
 18149                                  			;	 (remote or removable? disk flag) is not tested

 18151                                  	;;;;

 18158 000029EC 88C3                    	MOV	BL,AL		; Phys letter to BL (A=0)
 18159

 18161                                  	; 30/01/2024

 18196 000029FF 80C341                  	ADD	BL,"A"	; 41h

 18199 00002A09 B80003                  	MOV	AX,0300h

 18203                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ disk device name 
 18204                                  			; (may be full path or only drive
 18205                                  			; specifier--must include the colon)

 18291 00002A39 E91AFF                  	JMP	ioctl_bad_fun

 18294                                  	;test	word [es:di+4],4000h

 18299                                  					; assume IOCTL read
 18300 00002A43 C606[7E03]03            	MOV	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],DEVRDIOCTL ; 3
 18301                                  
 18302 00002A48 A801                    	TEST	AL,1			; is it func. 4/5 or 2/3
 18303 00002A4A 7405                    	JZ	short ioctl_control_call ; it is read. goto ioctl_control_call
 18304                                  
 18305                                  					; it is an IOCTL write
 18306 00002A4C C606[7E03]0C            	MOV	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],DEVWRIOCTL ; 12
 18307                                  
 18308                                  ioctl_control_call:
 18309                                  	; 30/01/2024
 18310                                  	;MOV	AL,DRDWRHL ; 22	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS, Windows ME IO.SYS
 18311                                  	; 26/06/2024
 18312 00002A51 B014                    	mov	al,20 ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 18313                                  ioctl_setup_pkt:
 18314 00002A53 88DC                    	MOV	AH,BL			; Unit number
 18315 00002A55 A3[7C03]                	MOV	[IOCALL_REQLEN],AX
 18316 00002A58 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 18317 00002A5A A3[7F03]                	MOV	[IOCALL_REQSTAT],AX ; 0
 18318 00002A5D A2[8903]                	MOV	[IOMED],AL
 18319 00002A60 890E[8E03]              	MOV	[IOSCNT],CX
 18320 00002A64 8916[8A03]              	MOV	[IOXAD],DX

 18323 00002A6D 1F                      	POP	DS

 18338

 18341                                  	; 16/12/2022

 18344                                  	;jmp	short ioctl_gd_ok_j

 18348                                  device_err:

 18350 00002A90 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI
 18351 00002A92 E84C34                  	call	SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 18352

 18358 00002A99 EB88                    	jmp	short ioctl_gd_err_j

 18362                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18363                                  ; Proc name : Get_Driver_BL
 18364                                  ;
 18365                                  ;	DS is DOSDATA
 18366                                  ;	BL is drive number (0=default)
 18367                                  ;	Returns pointer to device in ES:DI, unit number in BL if carry clear
 18368                                  ;	No regs modified
 18369                                  ;
 18370                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18371                                  
 18372                                  	; 30/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18373                                  
 18374                                  Get_Driver_BL:
 18375 00002A9B 50                      	PUSH	AX
 18376 00002A9C 88D8                    	MOV	AL,BL			; Drive
 18377 00002A9E E81B4D                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 18378 00002AA1 7221                    	jc	short ioctl_bad_drv
 18379 00002AA3 30DB                    	XOR	BL,BL			; Unit zero on Net device
 18380 00002AA5 C606[2303]03            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Net ; 3
 18381 00002AAA C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 18382                                  	;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 18383                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 18384                                  	;test	byte [es:di+44h],80h
 18385 00002AAE 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 18386                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 18387 00002AB3 26C47D45                	LES	DI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; ES:DI -> Dpb or net dev
 18388 00002AB7 750B                    	JNZ	short got_dev_ptr	 ; Is net
 18389                                  	;;;
 18390                                  	; 30/01/2024 - PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 18391                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk ; 2
 18392 00002AB9 E81BE8                  	call	set_exerr_locus_disk
 18393                                  	;;;
 18394                                  	;mov	bl,[es:di+1]
 18395 00002ABC 268A5D01                	MOV	BL,[ES:DI+DPB.UNIT]	; Unit number
 18396                                  	;les	di,[es:di+13h]
 18397 00002AC0 26C47D13                	LES	DI,[ES:DI+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR] ; Driver addr
 18398                                  got_dev_ptr:
 18399                                  	; 30/01/2024
 18400                                  	; cf=0
 18401                                  	;CLC
 18402                                  ioctl_bad_drv:
 18403 00002AC4 58                      	POP	AX
 18404 00002AC5 C3                      	retn

 18406                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18407                                  ; Proc Name : Check_If_Net:
 18408                                  ;
 18409                                  ;
 18410                                  ; Checks if the device is over the net or not. Returns result in ZERO flag.
 18411                                  ; If no device is found, the return address is popped off the stack, and a
 18412                                  ; jump is made to ioctl_drv_err.
 18413                                  ;
 18414                                  ; On Entry:
 18415                                  ; Registers same as those for Get_Driver_BL
 18416                                  ;
 18417                                  ; On Exit:
 18418                                  ; ZERO flag	- set if not a net device
 18419                                  ;		- reset if net device
 18420                                  ; ES:DI -> the device
 18421                                  ;
 18422                                  ;
 18423                                  ; BUGBUG: This function assumes the following stack setup on entry
 18424                                  ;
 18425                                  ;	  SP+2 -> Error return address
 18426                                  ;	  SP   -> Normal return address
 18427                                  ;
 18428                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18429                                  
 18430                                  	; 30/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18431                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:639Ch
 18432                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6A91h
 18433                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:68E1h
 18434                                  
 18435                                  Check_If_Net:
 18436                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 18437 00002AC6 E8D2FF                  	CALL	Get_Driver_BL
 18438 00002AC9 7201                    	JC	short ioctl_drv_err_pop	; invalid drive letter
 18439                                  
 18440                                  ; 30/01/2024 ('Get_Driver_BL' returns with
 18441                                  ;	      'curdir_isnet' condition/ZF, no need to a second test)
 18442                                  %if 0
 18443                                  	;;;
 18444                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM, Windows ME IO.SYS)
 18445                                  	PUSH	ES
 18446                                  	PUSH	DI
 18447                                  	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 18448                                  	;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 18449                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 18450                                  	;test	byte [es:di+44h],80h
 18451                                  	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 18452                                  	POP	DI
 18453                                  	POP	ES
 18454                                  	;;;
 18455                                  %endif
 18456 00002ACB C3                      	retn
 18457                                  
 18458                                  ioctl_drv_err_pop:
 18459 00002ACC 58                      	pop	ax			; pop off return address
 18460 00002ACD E951FF                  	jmp	ioctl_drv_err
 18461                                  
 18462                                  ioctl_bad_funj3:
 18463 00002AD0 E983FE                  	jmp	ioctl_bad_fun
 18464                                  
 18465                                  ioctl_string_errj:
 18466 00002AD3 EBB2                    	jmp	short ioctl_string_err  ; 25/05/2019
 18467                                  
 18468                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18469                                  ;
 18470                                  ; IOCTL: AL = E, F
 18471                                  ;
 18472                                  ; ENTRY: DS = DOSDATA
 18473                                  ;
 18474                                  ;
 18475                                  ; BUGBUG: Don't push anything on the stack between ioctl_drive_owner: and 
 18476                                  ;         the call to Check_If_Net because Check_If_Net gets our
 18477                                  ;         return address off the stack if the drive is invalid.
 18478                                  ;
 18479                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18480                                  
 18481                                  ioctl_drive_owner:
 18482                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 18483 00002AD5 E8EEFF                  	Call	Check_If_Net
 18484 00002AD8 75F6                    	JNZ	short ioctl_bad_funj3 	; There are no "net devices", and they
 18485                                  					;   certainly don't know how to do this
 18486                                  					;   call.
 18487                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEV320	; See if device can handle this
 18488                                  	; 09/09/2018
 18489                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],40h
 18490 00002ADA 26F6450440              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEV320 ; 0040h
 18491 00002ADF 74EF                    	JZ	short ioctl_bad_funj3 	; NO
 18492                                  	;mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],23
 18493 00002AE1 C606[7E03]17            	mov	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],DEVGETOWN	; default to get owner
 18494 00002AE6 3C0E                    	cmp	al,0Eh			; Get Owner ?
 18495 00002AE8 7405                    	jz	short GetOwner
 18496                                  SetOwner:
 18497 00002AEA C606[7E03]18            	MOV	byte [IOCALL_REQFUNC],DEVSETOWN ; 24
 18498                                  GetOwner:
 18499 00002AEF B00D                    	MOV	AL,OWNHL ; 13
 18500 00002AF1 88DC                    	MOV	AH,BL			; Unit number
 18501 00002AF3 A3[7C03]                	MOV	[IOCALL_REQLEN],AX
 18502 00002AF6 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 18503 00002AF8 A3[7F03]                	MOV	[IOCALL_REQSTAT],AX
 18504 00002AFB 06                      	PUSH	ES
 18505 00002AFC 1F                      	POP	DS
 18506 00002AFD 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; DS:SI -> driver
 18507 00002AFF 16                      	PUSH	SS
 18508 00002B00 07                      	POP	ES
 18509 00002B01 BB[7C03]                	MOV	BX,IOCALL		; ES:BX -> Call header
 18510 00002B04 1E                      	push	ds
 18511 00002B05 56                      	push	si
 18512 00002B06 E81924                  	call	DEVIOCALL2
 18513 00002B09 5E                      	pop	si
 18514 00002B0A 1F                      	pop	ds
 18515                                  ;hkn; SS override
 18516                                  	;TEST	word [SS:IOCALL_REQSTAT],STERR ;Error?
 18517                                  	;test	byte [SS:IOCALL_REQSTAT+1],80h
 18518 00002B0B 36F606[8003]80          	TEST	byte [SS:IOCALL_REQSTAT+1],(STERR>>8)
 18519 00002B11 75C0                    	jnz	short ioctl_string_errj
 18520 00002B13 36A0[7D03]              	MOV	AL,[SS:IOCALL_REQUNIT]	; Get owner returned by device
 18521                                  					; owner returned is 1-based.
 18522 00002B17 E965DB                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK

 18530                                  ;	TITLE	DOS_DELETE - Internal DELETE call for MS-DOS
 18531                                  ;	NAME	DOS_DELETE
 18532                                  
 18533                                  ;
 18534                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 18535                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 18536                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 18537                                  ;
 18538                                  
 18539                                  ;**	DELETE.ASM - Low level routine for deleting files
 18540                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18541                                  ;		DOS_DELETE
 18542                                  ;		REN_DEL_Check
 18543                                  ;		FastOpen_Delete	       ; DOS 3.3
 18544                                  ;		FastOpen_Update	       ; DOS 3.3
 18545                                  
 18546                                  ;   Revision history:
 18547                                  ;
 18548                                  ;   A000  version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 18549                                  ;   A001  Fastopen Rename fix	April 1989
 18550                                  
 18551                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 18552                                  
 18553                                  ;	i_need	NoSetDir,BYTE
 18554                                  ;	i_need	Creating,BYTE
 18555                                  ;	i_need	DELALL,BYTE
 18556                                  ;	i_need	THISDPB,DWORD
 18557                                  ;	i_need	THISSFT,DWORD
 18558                                  ;	i_need	THISCDS,DWORD
 18559                                  ;	i_need	CURBUF,DWORD
 18560                                  ;	i_need	ATTRIB,BYTE
 18561                                  ;	i_need	SATTRIB,BYTE
 18562                                  ;	i_need	WFP_START,WORD
 18563                                  ;	i_need	REN_WFP,WORD			 ;BN001
 18564                                  ;	i_need	NAME1,BYTE			 ;BN001
 18565                                  ;	i_need	FoundDel,BYTE
 18566                                  ;	i_need	AUXSTACK,BYTE
 18567                                  ;	i_need	VOLCHNG_FLAG,BYTE
 18568                                  ;	i_need	JShare,DWORD
 18569                                  ;	i_need	FastOpenTable,BYTE		  ; DOS 3.3
 18570                                  ;	i_need	FastTable,BYTE			  ; DOS 4.00
 18571                                  ;
 18572                                  ;	i_need	Del_ExtCluster,WORD		  ; DOS 4.00
 18573                                  ;
 18574                                  ;	i_need	SAVE_BX,WORD			  ; DOS 4.00
 18575                                  ;	i_need	DMAADD,DWORD
 18576                                  ;	i_need	RENAMEDMA,BYTE
 18577                                  
 18578                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18579                                  ;
 18580                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_DELETE
 18581                                  ;
 18582                                  ; Inputs:
 18583                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 18584                                  ;		terminated)
 18585                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 18586                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 18587                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 18588                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 18589                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 18590                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 18591                                  ; Function:
 18592                                  ;	Delete the specified file(s)
 18593                                  ; Outputs:
 18594                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 18595                                  ;		OK
 18596                                  ;	CARRY SET
 18597                                  ;	    AX is error code
 18598                                  ;		error_file_not_found
 18599                                  ;			Last element of path not found
 18600                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 18601                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 18602                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 18603                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 18604                                  ;		error_access_denied
 18605                                  ;			Attempt to delete device or directory
 18606                                  ;		***error_sharing_violation***
 18607                                  ;			Deny both access required, generates an INT 24.
 18608                                  ;			This error is NOT returned. The INT 24H is generated,
 18609                                  ;			  and the file is ignored (not deleted). Delete will
 18610                                  ;			  simply continue on looking for more files.
 18611                                  ;			  Carry will NOT be set in this case.
 18612                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 18613                                  ;
 18614                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18615

 18865 00002C38 7234                    	JC	short No_fileJ
 18866                                  ;

 18868                                  ;

 18913                                  ;Break	<REN_DEL_Check - check for access for rename and delete>
 18914                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18915                                  ; Procedure Name : REN_DEL_Check
 18916                                  ;
 18917                                  ; Inputs:
 18918                                  ;	[THISDPB] set
 18919                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX points to entry
 18920                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:SI points to firclus field of entry
 18921                                  ;	[WFP_Start] points to name
 18922                                  ; Function:
 18923                                  ;	Check for Exclusive access on given file.
 18924                                  ;	  Used by RENAME, SET_FILE_INFO, and DELETE.
 18925                                  ; Outputs:
 18926                                  ;	ES:BP = [THISDPB]
 18927                                  ;	NOTE: The WFP string pointed to by [WFP_Start] Will be Modified. The
 18928                                  ;		last element will be loaded from the directory entry. This is
 18929                                  ;		so the name given to the sharer doesn't have any meta chars in
 18930                                  ;		it.
 18931                                  ;	Carry set if sharing violation, INT 24H generated
 18932                                  ;	    NOTE THAT AX IS NOT error_sharing_violation.
 18933                                  ;		This is because input AX is preserved.
 18934                                  ;		Caller must set the error if needed.
 18935                                  ;	Carry clear
 18936                                  ;		OK
 18937                                  ; AX,DS,BX,SI,DI preserved
 18938                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18939                                  
 18940                                  	; 31/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 18941                                  	
 18942                                  REN_DEL_Check:
 18943                                  
 18944 00002C74 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 18945 00002C75 57                      	PUSH	DI
 18946 00002C76 50                      	PUSH	AX
 18947 00002C77 53                      	PUSH	BX
 18948 00002C78 56                      	PUSH	SI		; Save CURBUF pointers
 18949                                  	
 18950 00002C79 16                      	push	ss
 18951 00002C7A 07                      	pop	es
 18952                                  
 18953                                  ;hkn; context ES will assume ES to DOSDATA
 18954                                  ;hkn; ASSUME	ES:DOSGROUP
 18955                                  
 18956                                  ;hkn; SS override
 18957 00002C7B 368B3E[B205]            	MOV	DI,[SS:WFP_START] ; ES:DI -> WFP
 18958 00002C80 89DE                    	MOV	SI,BX
 18959                                  
 18960                                  ;hkn; SS override
 18961 00002C82 368E1E[E405]            	MOV	DS,[SS:CURBUF+2] ; DS:SI -> entry (FCB style name)
 18962 00002C87 89FB                    	MOV	BX,DI		; Set backup limit for skipback
 18963                                  	;ADD	BX,2		; Skip over d: to point to leading '\'
 18964                                  	; 31/01/2024
 18965 00002C89 43                      	inc	bx
 18966 00002C8A 43                      	inc	bx
 18967 00002C8B E82CEB                  	call	StrLen		; CX is length of ES:DI including NUL
 18968 00002C8E 49                      	DEC	CX		; Don't include nul in count
 18969 00002C8F 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX		; Point to NUL at end of string
 18970 00002C91 E8DA4D                  	call	SkipBack	; Back up one element
 18971 00002C94 47                      	INC	DI		; Point to start of last element
 18972                                  
 18973                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18974                                  ;hkn; SS override
 18975                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 18976 00002C95 36893E[0106]            	MOV	[SS:SAVE_BX],DI	;IFS. save for DOS_RENAME   ;AN000;
 18977                                  	;
 18978 00002C9A E8C0F9                  	call	PackName	; Transfer name from entry to ASCIZ tail.
 18979 00002C9D 5E                      	POP	SI		; Get back entry pointers
 18980 00002C9E 5B                      	POP	BX
 18981 00002C9F 53                      	PUSH	BX
 18982 00002CA0 56                      	PUSH	SI		; Back on stack
 18983                                  	
 18984 00002CA1 16                      	push	ss
 18985 00002CA2 1F                      	pop	ds
 18986                                  
 18987                                  ;hkn; context DS will assume ES to DOSDATA
 18988                                  ;hkn; ASSUME	DS:DOSGROUP
 18989                                  
 18990                                  	; 07/07/2024
 18991                                  	;push	es              ; (not necessary) ; 31/01/2024
 18992                                  	;push	di
 18993                                  
 18994                                  ; Close the file if possible by us.
 18995                                  ;
 18996                                  ;if installed
 18997 00002CA3 FF1E[C400]              	Call	far [JShare+(13*4)] ; 13 = ShCloseFile
 18998                                  ;else
 18999                                  ;	Call	ShCloseFile
 19000                                  ;endif
 19001                                  	;;;
 19002                                  	; 31/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 19003                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 19004 00002CA7 803E[0303]FF            	cmp	byte [fShare],0FFh
 19005 00002CAC 750A                    	jne	short rdc_1
 19006 00002CAE 8C06[A005]              	mov	[THISSFT+2],es
 19007 00002CB2 893E[9E05]              	mov	[THISSFT],di
 19008 00002CB6 EB0A                    	jmp	short rdc_2
 19009                                  rdc_1:
 19010                                  	;;;
 19011 00002CB8 8C1E[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],DS
 19012                                  
 19013                                  ;hkn; AUXSTACK is in DOSDATA
 19014 00002CBC C706[9E05][6507]        	MOV	word [THISSFT],AUXSTACK-SF_ENTRY.size  ; RENAMEDMA+(384-59)
 19015                                  				; Scratch space
 19016                                  rdc_2:		; 30/01/2024
 19017                                  	; 07/07/2024
 19018                                  	;pop	di
 19019                                  	;pop	es
 19020                                  	;
 19021 00002CC2 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH		; Indicate file to DOOPEN (high bit off)
 19022 00002CC4 E8B825                  	call	DOOPEN		; Fill in SFT for share check
 19023 00002CC7 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 19024                                  	;mov	word [es:di+2],10h
 19025 00002CCB 26C745021000            	MOV	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],SHARING_DENY_BOTH ; 10h
 19026                                  				; requires exclusive access
 19027                                  	;MOV	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1 ; Pretend open
 19028 00002CD1 26C7050100              	mov	word [ES:DI],1
 19029 00002CD6 E8DF53                  	call	ShareEnter
 19030 00002CD9 720D                    	jc	short CheckDone
 19031 00002CDB C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 19032                                  	;MOV	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0
 19033 00002CDF 26C7050000              	mov	word [ES:DI],0	; Pretend closed and free
 19034                                  	
 19035 00002CE4 E8CC53                  	call	ShareEnd	; Tell sharer we're done with THISSFT
 19036 00002CE7 F8                      	CLC
 19037                                  CheckDone:
 19038 00002CE8 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 19039 00002CEC 5E                      	POP	SI
 19040 00002CED 5B                      	POP	BX
 19041 00002CEE 58                      	POP	AX
 19042 00002CEF 5F                      	POP	DI
 19043 00002CF0 1F                      	POP	DS
 19044 00002CF1 C3                      	retn
