 21359                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 21360                                  
 21361                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21362                                  
 21363                                  modify_spc:
 21364 00003373 50                      	push	ax			; ax = sectors per cluster
 21365 00003374 52                      	push	dx
 21366 00003375 F7E1                    	mul	cx			; bytes per sector
 21367                                  	;cmp	dx,0
 21368 00003377 21D2                    	and	dx,dx
 21369 00003379 7503                    	jnz	short mspc_1
 21370 0000337B 3D0040                  	cmp	ax,16384		; 16 kilobytes (per cluster)
 21371                                  					; ***
 21372                                  					; actual disk size limit
 21373                                  					; without invalidating cluster counts is
 21374                                  					; 2 GB (512K clusters * 8 sectors per cluster)
 21375                                  					;      (128K clusters * 32 sectors per cluster)
 21376                                  mspc_1:
 21377 0000337E 5A                      	pop	dx
 21378 0000337F 58                      	pop	ax
 21379 00003380 760E                    	jbe	short mspc_3		; bytes per cluster <= 16 KB
 21380                                                                          ; ***
 21381                                                                          ; bytes per cluster > 16 KB
 21382 00003382 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; 0
 21383 00003384 BBFEFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFEh		; (invalidated)
 21384 00003387 09F6                    	or	si,si			; hw of free cluster count
 21385 00003389 7404                    	jz	short mspc_2		; si = 0
 21386 0000338B 89FE                    	mov	si,di			; si = 0
 21387 0000338D 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx			; dx = bx = 0FFFEh (invalidated)
 21388                                  mspc_2:
 21389 0000338F C3                      	retn
 21390                                  
 21391                                  mspc_3:
 21392 00003390 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1			; sectors per clust = sectors per clust * 2
 21393                                  					; (ax <= 32768) -modified spc limit-
 21394 00003392 D1EF                    	shr	di,1			; cluster count = cluster count /2
 21395                                  					; di:bx = modified value of total clusters
 21396                                  mspc_4:
 21397 00003394 D1DB                    	rcr	bx,1
 21398 00003396 D1EE                    	shr	si,1			; free clusters = free clusters / 2
 21399 00003398 D1DA                    	rcr	dx,1			; si:dx = modified value of free clusters
 21400                                  
 21401                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21402                                  
 21403                                  	; 03/02/2024
 21404                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7431h
 21405                                  
 21406                                  modify_cluster_count:
 21407 0000339A 09FF                    	or	di,di			; hw of cluster count
 21408 0000339C 75D5                    	jnz	short modify_spc
 21409 0000339E C3                      	retn
 21410                                  
 21411                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 21412                                  
 21413                                  ; write FSINFO sector onto disk
 21414                                  
 21415                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21416                                  ; --------------------------------
 21417                                  ; FAT32 FSInfo Sector Structure
 21418                                  ; --------------------------------
 21419                                  ; ref: Microsoft FAT32 File System Specification (2000)
 21420                                  
 21421                                  struc FSINFO		; Offset ;
 21422 00000000 ????????                .LeadSig:	resb 4	  ; 0		; Value 0x41615252. Lead Signature.
 21423 00000004 <res 1E0h>              .Reserved1:	resb 480  ; 4		; Reserved. Must be 0. Never be used.
 21424 000001E4 ????????                .StrucSig:	resb 4	  ; 484		; Value 0x61417272. Fields Signature.
 21425 000001E8 ????????                .Free_Count:	resb 4	  ; 488		; Last known free cluster count. (*) 
 21426 000001EC ????????                .Nxt_Free:	resb 4	  ; 492		; Start clus for free clus srch. (**)
 21427 000001F0 <res Ch>                .Reserved2:	resb 12	  ; 496		; Reserved. Must be 0. Never be used.
 21428 000001FC ????????                .TrailSig:	resb 4	  ; 508		; Value 0xAA550000. Trail Signature.
 21429                                  .size:
 21430                                  endstruc
 21431                                  
 21432                                  ; (*) If the value is 0xFFFFFFFF, then the free count is unknown
 21433                                  ;     and must be computed.
 21434                                  ; (**) If the value is 0xFFFFFFFF, then free cluster search must be started
 21435                                  ;     from cluster 2.
 21436                                  ; Lead Signature, Fields (Structure) Signature and Trail Signature
 21437                                  ; are used to validate FSInfo sector.
 21438                                  
 21439                                  ; --------------------------------
 21440                                  
 21441                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21442                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7436h
 21443                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7227h)
 21444                                  
 21445                                  update_fat32_fsinfo:
 21446 0000339F 51                      	push	cx
 21447 000033A0 52                      	push	dx
 21448 000033A1 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21449                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+25h]
 21450 000033A3 268B5625                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FSINFO_SECTOR]
 21451                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],cx
 21452 000033A7 26394E0F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],cx ; 0
 21453                                  				; (16bit FAT size field = 0 for FAT32 fs)
 21454 000033AB 7505                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_1
 21455 000033AD 83FAFF                  	cmp	dx,0FFFFh ; -1
 21456 000033B0 7508                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_2
 21457                                  
 21458                                  u_fat32_inf_1:
 21459 000033B2 5A                      	pop	dx
 21460 000033B3 59                      	pop	cx
 21461                                  	;and	byte [es:bp+18h],0F4h
 21462 000033B4 26806618F4              	and	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],0F4h ; clear bit 0,1 and 3
 21463                                  					; bit 0 - FSINFO update (dirty) bit
 21464                                  					; bit 1 - BPB_RootClus update bit
 21465                                  					; bit 3 - BPB_ExtFlags update bit
 21466 000033B9 C3                      	retn
 21467                                  
 21468                                  u_fat32_inf_2:
 21469 000033BA 50                      	push	ax
 21470 000033BB 53                      	push	bx
 21471 000033BC 57                      	push	di
 21472 000033BD 56                      	push	si
 21473 000033BE 1E                      	push	ds
 21474 000033BF 36803E[7900]00          	cmp	byte [ss:BuffInHMA],0	; is buffers in HMA?
 21475 000033C5 740A                    	jz	short u_fat32_inf_3	; no
 21476 000033C7 36C53E[7A00]            	lds	di,[ss:LoMemBuff]	; read it into scratch buffer
 21477                                  	;sub	di,24
 21478 000033CC 83EF18                  	sub	di,BUFINSIZ		; space for buffer header
 21479                                  					; (buffer header size = 24)
 21480                                  	;clc
 21481 000033CF EB0E                    	jmp	short u_fat32_inf_4
 21482                                  
 21483                                  u_fat32_inf_3:
 21484 000033D1 06                      	push	es
 21485 000033D2 55                      	push	bp
 21486 000033D3 E83331                  	call	GETCURHEAD		; ds:di = first buffer in queue
 21487 000033D6 52                      	push	dx
 21488 000033D7 E89233                  	call	BUFWRITE		; BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk,
 21489                                  					;  if it's dirty.
 21490 000033DA 5A                      	pop	dx
 21491 000033DB 5D                      	pop	bp
 21492 000033DC 07                      	pop	es
 21493                                  ;u_fat32_inf_4:
 21494 000033DD 726A                    	jc	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21495                                  u_fat32_inf_4:
 21496 000033DF 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21497                                  	;lea	bx,[di+24]
 21498 000033E1 8D5D18                  	lea	bx,[di+BUFINSIZ]	; buffer data address
 21499                                  	;mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],18h
 21500 000033E4 36C606[4B03]18          	mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 21501 000033EA 36890E[0706]            	mov	[ss:HIGH_SECTOR],cx ; 0
 21502 000033EF 41                      	inc	cx			; cx = sector count = 1
 21503                                  					; es:bp = DPB
 21504 000033F0 53                      	push	bx			; ds:bx = buffer (data) address
 21505 000033F1 52                      	push	dx			; HIGH_SECTOR:dx = disk sector address
 21506 000033F2 E87E0A                  	call	DREAD		 	; read fs info sector
 21507 000033F5 5A                      	pop	dx
 21508 000033F6 5B                      	pop	bx
 21509 000033F7 7250                    	jc	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21510                                  
 21511                                  	;cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.LeadSig],5252h	
 21512 000033F9 813F5252                	cmp	word [bx],5252h		; 'RR'
 21513 000033FD 754A                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21514                                  	;cmp	word [bx+2],4161h	; 'aA' ; (NASM syntax)
 21515 000033FF 817F026141              	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.LeadSig+2],4161h
 21516 00003404 7543                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21517                                  	
 21518                                  	;cmp	word [bx+1E4h],7272h	; 'rr' at offset 484
 21519 00003406 81BFE4017272            	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.StrucSig],7272h
 21520 0000340C 753B                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21521                                  
 21522                                  	;cmp	word [bx+1E6h],6141h	; 'Aa' at offset 486
 21523 0000340E 81BFE6014161            	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.StrucSig+2],6141h
 21524 00003414 7533                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21525                                  
 21526                                  	;cmp	word [bx+1FEh],0AA55h	; boot signature at offset 510
 21527 00003416 81BFFE0155AA            	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.TrailSig+2],0AA55h
 21528 0000341C 752B                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21529                                  	
 21530                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+1Fh]
 21531 0000341E 268B461F                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT]
 21532                                  	;mov	[bx+1E8h],ax 
 21533 00003422 8987E801                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Free_Count],ax ; at offset 488
 21534                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+21h]
 21535 00003426 268B4621                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2]
 21536                                  	;mov	[bx+1EAh],ax
 21537 0000342A 8987EA01                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Free_Count+2],ax
 21538                                  
 21539                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+39h]
 21540 0000342E 268B4639                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE]
 21541                                  	;mov	[bx+1ECh],ax
 21542 00003432 8987EC01                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Nxt_Free],ax	; at offset 492
 21543                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+3Bh]
 21544 00003436 268B463B                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE+2]
 21545                                  	;mov	[bx+1EEh],ax
 21546 0000343A 8987EE01                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Nxt_Free+2],ax
 21547                                  
 21548 0000343E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21549 00003440 36890E[0706]            	mov	[ss:HIGH_SECTOR],cx ; 0
 21550 00003445 41                      	inc	cx	; 1
 21551 00003446 E88F0A                  	call	DWRITE
 21552                                  
 21553                                  u_fat32_inf_5:
 21554 00003449 1F                      	pop	ds
 21555 0000344A 5E                      	pop	si
 21556 0000344B 5F                      	pop	di
 21557 0000344C 5B                      	pop	bx
 21558 0000344D 58                      	pop	ax
 21559 0000344E E961FF                  	jmp	u_fat32_inf_1

 21561                                  ;============================================================================
 21562                                  ; ISEARCH.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 21563                                  ;============================================================================
 21564                                  ; 22/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 21565                                  
 21566                                  ;	TITLE	DOS_SEARCH - Internal SEARCH calls for MS-DOS
 21567                                  ;	NAME	DOS_SEARCH
 21568                                  
 21569                                  ;**	Low level routines for doing local and NET directory searches
 21570                                  ;
 21571                                  ;	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21572                                  ;	DOS_SEARCH_NEXT
 21573                                  ;	RENAME_NEXT
 21574                                  ;
 21575                                  ;	Revision history:
 21576                                  ;
 21577                                  ;	    Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 21578                                  ;	    A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 21579                                  ;	    A001	PTM 3564 -- search for fastopen
 21580                                  
 21581                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 21582                                  
 21583                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21584                                  ;
 21585                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21586                                  ;
 21587                                  ; Inputs:
 21588                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 21589                                  ;		terminated)
 21590                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 21591                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 21592                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 21593                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 21594                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 21595                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 21596                                  ;	[DMAADD] Points to 53 byte buffer
 21597                                  ; Function:
 21598                                  ;	Initiate a search for the given file spec
 21599                                  ; Outputs:
 21600                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 21601                                  ;	    The 53 bytes ot DMAADD are filled in as follows:
 21602                                  ;
 21603                                  ;	LOCAL
 21604                                  ;	    Drive Byte (A=1, B=2, ...) High bit clear
 21605                                  ;		NEVER STORE DRIVE BYTE AFTER  found_it
 21606                                  ;	    11 byte search name with Meta chars in it
 21607                                  ;	    Search Attribute Byte, attribute of search
 21608                                  ;	    WORD LastEnt value
 21609                                  ;	    WORD DirStart
 21610                                  ;	    4 byte pad
 21611                                  ;	    32 bytes of the directory entry found
 21612                                  ;	NET
 21613                                  ;	    21 bytes First byte has high bit set
 21614                                  ;	    32 bytes of the directory entry found
 21615                                  ;
 21616                                  ;	CARRY SET
 21617                                  ;	    AX = error code
 21618                                  ;		error_no_more_files
 21619                                  ;			No match for this file
 21620                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 21621                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 21622                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 21623                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 21624                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 21625                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21626                                  
 21627                                  ; 11/05/2025
 21628                                  ; 03/03/2025 (MiniDOS)
 21629                                  ; 24/01/2024
 21630                                  %if 0
 21631                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21632                                  GET_FAST_SEARCH:
 21633                                  	; 22/07/2018
 21634                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21635                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21636                                  	OR	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],(SEARCH_FASTOPEN>>8)  ; 04h
 21637                                  	;OR	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],SEARCH_FASTOPEN  ; 400h
 21638                                  					;FO.trigger fastopen ;AN000;
 21639                                  	;call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21640                                  	;retn
 21641                                  	; 24/01/2024
 21642                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21643                                  	;jmp	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21644                                  %endif
 21645                                  
 21646                                  	; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 21647                                  	; DOSCODE:6C22h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 21648                                  
 21649                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 21650                                  	; DOSCODE:74E9h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)

 21676

 21679                                  ;ELSE

 21681 00003467 B81B11                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|27
 21682 0000346A CD2F                    	INT	2FH
 21683 0000346C C3                      	retn
 21684                                  ;ENDIF

 21686                                  LOCAL_SEARCH_FIRST:
 21687 0000346D E828E4                  	call	ECritDisk
 21688

 21690                                  	;; MSDOS 6.0
 21691                                  	;;;test	word [DOS34_FLAG],400h

 21697                                  	;;or	byte [FastOpenFlg],1

 21699

 21702

 21705                                  %if 0

 21717                                  	or	al,al			;AN000;;FO. is it null
 21718                                  	jz	short NO_Question	;AN000;;FO. yes

 22084                                  ;============================================================================
 22085                                  ; ABORT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 22086                                  ;============================================================================
 22087                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 22088                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22089                                  
 22090                                  ;**
 22091                                  ;
 22092                                  ; Internal Abort call closes all handles and FCBs associated with a process.
 22093                                  ;  If process has NET resources a close all is sent out over the net.
 22094                                  ;
 22095                                  ;   DOS_ABORT
 22096                                  ;
 22097                                  ;   Modification history:
 22098                                  ;
 22099                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 22100                                  ;
 22101                                  ;	M038	SR	10/16/90	Free SFT with the PSP of the process
 22102                                  ;				being terminated only if it is busy.
 22103                                  ;
 22104                                  
 22105                                  ;Break   <DOS_ABORT -- CLOSE all files for process>
 22106                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22107                                  ;
 22108                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_ABORT
 22109                                  ;
 22110                                  ; Inputs:
 22111                                  ;       [CurrentPDB] set to PID of process aborting
 22112                                  ; Function:
 22113                                  ;       Close all files and free all SFTs for this PID
 22114                                  ; Returns:
 22115                                  ;       None
 22116                                  ; All destroyed except stack
 22117                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22118                                  
 22119                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22120                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7685h
 22121                                  	; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:74F4h) 
 22122                                  
 22123                                  DOS_ABORT:
 22124 0000359A 368E06[3003]            	MOV     ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]	; SS override
 22125 0000359F 268B0E3200              	MOV     CX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]  ; Number of JFNs
 22126                                  reset_free_jfn:
 22127 000035A4 89CB                    	MOV     BX,CX
 22128 000035A6 51                      	PUSH    CX
 22129 000035A7 4B                      	DEC     BX                      ; get jfn (start with last one)
 22130                                  
 22131 000035A8 E8F13D                  	CALL	_$CLOSE
 22132 000035AB 59                      	POP     CX
 22133 000035AC E2F6                    	LOOP    reset_free_jfn          ; and do 'em all
 22134                                  
 22135                                  ; Note: We do need to explicitly close FCBs. Reasons are as follows: If we
 22136                                  ; are running in the no-sharing no-network environment, we are simulating the
 22137                                  ; 2.0 world and thus if the user doesn't close the file, that is his problem
 22138                                  ; BUT... the cache remains in a state with garbage that may be reused by the
 22139                                  ; next process. We scan the set and blast the ref counts of the FCBs we own.
 22140                                  ;
 22141                                  ; If sharing is loaded, then the following call to close process will
 22142                                  ; correctly close all FCBs. We will then need to walk the list AFTER here.
 22143                                  ;
 22144                                  ; Finally, the following call to NET_Abort will cause an EOP to be sent to all
 22145                                  ; known network resources. These resources are then responsible for cleaning
 22146                                  ; up after this process.
 22147                                  ;
 22148                                  ; Sleazy, eh?
 22149                                  
 22150                                  	;context DS			; SS is DOSDATA
 22151 000035AE 16                      	push	ss
 22152 000035AF 1F                      	pop	ds  ; 09/09/2018
 22153                                  
 22154                                  	;CallInstall Net_Abort, MultNET, 29
 22155 000035B0 B81D11                  	mov	ax,111Dh
 22156 000035B3 CD2F                    	int     2Fh 	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR 
 22157                                  			;	    - CLOSE ALL REMOTE FILES FOR PROCESS
 22158                                  			; DS???, SS = DOS CS
 22159                                  ;if installed
 22160 000035B5 FF1E[A000]              	call	far [JShare+(4*4)]	; 4 = MFTCloseP
 22161                                  ;else
 22162                                  ;	call 	MFTCloseP
 22163                                  ;endif
 22164                                  
 22165                                  ; Scan the FCB cache for guys that belong to this process and zap their ref
 22166                                  ; counts.
 22167                                  					; SS override
 22168 000035B9 36C43E[4000]            	les     di,[ss:SFTFCB]		; grab the pointer to the table
 22169                                  
 22170                                  	;;;
 22171                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22172                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22173                                  SFTFCB_check:
 22174 000035BE 8CC1                    	mov	cx,es
 22175 000035C0 09F9                    	or	cx,di
 22176 000035C2 E325                    	jcxz	FCBScanDone
 22177 000035C4 57                      	push	di
 22178                                  SFTFCB_OK:
 22179                                  	;;;
 22180                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 22181 000035C5 268B4D04                	mov     cx,[es:di+SFT.SFCount]
 22182                                  	;jcxz	FCBScanDone
 22183                                  	; 27/06/2024
 22184                                  	;;;
 22185 000035C9 E315                    	jcxz    SFTFCB_check2	
 22186                                  	;;;
 22187                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 22188 000035CB 8D7D06                  	LEA     DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable]	; point at table
 22189 000035CE 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 22190                                  FCBTest:
 22191                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 22192 000035D2 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax ; is this one of ours
 22193 000035D6 7503                    	jnz	short FCBNext		; no, skip it
 22194                                  
 22195                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22196                                  %if 0
 22197                                  	mov	word [es:di],0
 22198                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ; yes, blast ref count
 22199                                  %else
 22200                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22201                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22202 000035D8 E87513                  	call    SFT_FREE
 22203                                  %endif
 22204                                  
 22205                                  FCBNext:
 22206 000035DB 83C73B                  	add     di,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59 (for MSDOS 6.0)
 22207 000035DE E2F2                    	loop    FCBTest
 22208                                  
 22209                                  	; 27/06/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 22210                                  	;;;
 22211                                  SFTFCB_check2:
 22212 000035E0 5F                      	pop	di
 22213 000035E1 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di]
 22214 000035E4 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22215 000035E7 75D5                    	jne	short SFTFCB_check
 22216                                  	;;;
 22217                                  
 22218                                  FCBScanDone:
 22219                                  
 22220                                  ; Walk the SFT to eliminate all busy SFT's for this process.
 22221                                  
 22222 000035E9 31DB                    	XOR     BX,BX
 22223                                  Scan:
 22224 000035EB 53                      	push    bx
 22225 000035EC E8293D                  	call	SFFromSFN
 22226 000035EF 5B                      	pop     bx
 22227                                  	;jnc	short Scan1
 22228                                  	;retn
 22229                                  
 22230                                  	; 18/12/2022
 22231                                  	;jc	short NO_Question ; retn
 22232                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22233 000035F0 7232                    	jc	short RET2
 22234                                  
 22235                                  ;M038
 22236                                  ; Do what the comment above says, check for busy state
 22237                                  
 22238                                  Scan1:
 22239                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0
 22240                                  	;jz	short scan_next  ; MSDOS 3.3
 22241                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22242 000035F2 26833DFF                	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy ; -1
 22243                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 22244                                  				; Is Sft busy? ;M038
 22245 000035F6 7517                    	jnz	short scan_next ; no
 22246                                  ;
 22247                                  ; we have a SFT that is busy. See if it is for the current process
 22248                                  ;
 22249 000035F8 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 22250                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 22251 000035FC 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 22252 00003600 750D                    	jnz	short scan_next
 22253 00003602 36A1[3E03]              	mov     ax,[SS:USER_ID]		; SS override
 22254                                  	;sub	ax,[es:di+2Fh] ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM ; 03/02/2024
 22255                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 22256 00003606 2639452F                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 22257 0000360A 7503                    	jnz	short scan_next
 22258                                  
 22259                                  ; This SFT is labelled as ours.
 22260                                  
 22261                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22262                                  %if 0
 22263                                  	mov	word [es:di],0
 22264                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0
 22265                                  %else
 22266                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22267                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22268 0000360C E84113                  	call    SFT_FREE
 22269                                  %endif
 22270                                  
 22271                                  scan_next:
 22272 0000360F 43                      	inc     bx
 22273 00003610 EBD9                    	jmp     short Scan
 22274                                  
 22275                                  ;============================================================================
 22276                                  ; CLOSE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 22277                                  ;============================================================================
 22278                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 22279                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22280                                  
 22281                                  ;**	Internal Close and Commit calls to close a local or NET SFT.
 22282                                  ;
 22283                                  ;	DOS_CLOSE
 22284                                  ;	DOS_COMMIT
 22285                                  ;	FREE_SFT
 22286                                  ;	SetSFTTimes
 22287                                  ;
 22288                                  ;	Revision history:
 22289                                  ;
 22290                                  ;	   AN000  version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 22291                                  ;	   A005   PTM 3718 --- lost clusters when fastopen installed
 22292                                  ;	   A011   PTM 4766 --- C2 fastopen problem
 22293                                  
 22294                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 22295                                  
 22296                                  ;Break <DOS_CLOSE -- CLOSE FILE from SFT>
 22297                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22298                                  ;
 22299                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_CLOSE
 22300                                  ;
 22301                                  ; Inputs:
 22302                                  ;	[THISSFT] set to the SFT for the file being used
 22303                                  ; Function:
 22304                                  ;	Close the indicated file via the SFT
 22305                                  ; Returns:
 22306                                  ;	sf_ref_count decremented otherwise
 22307                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 22308                                  ;	Carry set if error
 22309                                  ;	    AX has error code
 22310                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 22311                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22312                                  
 22313                                  ;hkn; DOS_CLOSE called from fcbio.asm and handle.asm. DS alreday set up.
 22314                                  
 22315                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22316                                  ; DOSCODE:6E2Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22317                                  
 22318                                  ; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 22319                                  ; DOSCODE:6E1Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 22320                                  
 22321                                  ; 23/07/2018 - IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987 - Offset 39D0h
 22322                                  
 22323                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22324                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:76FEh
 22325                                  	; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7579h) 
 22326                                  
 22327                                  DOS_CLOSE:
 22328 00003612 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 22329                                  	;mov	bx,[ES:DI+5]
 22330 00003616 268B5D05                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 22331                                  
 22332                                  ; Network closes are handled entirely by the net code.
 22333                                  
 22334                                  	;;test	bx,8000h
 22335                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_isnet
 22336                                  	; 17/12/2022
 22337                                  	;test	bh,80h
 22338 0000361A F6C780                  	test	bh,(sf_isnet>>8)
 22339 0000361D 7406                    	JZ	short LocalClose
 22340                                  
 22341                                  	;CallInstall Net_Close,MultNET,6
 22342 0000361F B80611                  	mov     ax,1106h
 22343 00003622 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - CLOSE REMOTE FILE
 22344                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 22345                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 22346                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 22347                                  			; CF clear if successful
 22348                                  RET2:		; 03/02/2024
 22349 00003624 C3                      	retn
 22350                                  
 22351                                  ; All closes release the sharing information.
 22352                                  ; No commit releases sharing information
 22353                                  ;
 22354                                  ; All closes decrement the ref count.
 22355                                  ; No commit decrements the ref count.
 22356                                  
 22357                                  LocalClose:
 22358 00003625 E870E2                  	call	ECritDisk
 22359 00003628 E86E01                  	CALL	SetSFTTimes
 22360 0000362B E8F600                  	CALL	FREE_SFT		; dec ref count or mark as busy
 22361                                  
 22362                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 22363                                  	;Context DS
 22364 0000362E 16                      	push	ss
 22365 0000362F 1F                      	pop	ds
 22366                                  
 22367 00003630 50                      	push	ax
 22368 00003631 53                      	push	bx
 22369 00003632 E87E4A                  	call	ShareEnd
 22370 00003635 5B                      	pop	bx

 22770                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22771                                  ;
 22772                                  ; Procedure Name : FREE_SFT
 22773                                  ;
 22774                                  ; ES:DI -> SFT. Decs sft_ref_count. If the count goes to 0, mark it as busy.
 22775                                  ; Flags preserved. Return old ref count in AX
 22776                                  ;
 22777                                  ; Note that busy is indicated by the SFT ref count being -1.
 22778                                  ;
 22779                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 22781                                  FREE_SFT:

 22791 0000372F 9D                      	POPF

 22796                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22797                                  ;
 22798                                  ; Procedure Name : DirFromSFT
 22799                                  ;
 22800                                  ;   DirFromSFT - locate a directory entry given an SFT.
 22801                                  ;
 22802                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:DI point to SFT
 22803                                  ;		DS = DOSDATA
 22804                                  ;   Outputs:
 22805                                  ;		EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Disk
 22806                                  ;		CurBuf points to buffer
 22807                                  ;		Carry Clear -> operation OK
 22808                                  ;		    ES:DI point to entry
 22809                                  ;		    ES:BX point to buffer
 22810                                  ;		    DS:SI point to SFT
 22811                                  ;		Carry SET   -> operation failed
 22812                                  ;		    registers trashified
 22813                                  ;   Registers modified: ALL
 22814                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22815

 22883                                  ;**	DOS_Commit - UPdate Directory Entries
 22884                                  ;

 22886                                  ;		(DS) = DOSGROUP

 22894

 22898                                  DOS_COMMIT:
 22899                                  	;hkn; called from srvcall. DS already set up.
 22900 0000376F C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 22901                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+5]
 22902 00003773 268B5D05                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 22903                                  	;test	bx,0C0h
 22904                                  	; 17/12/2022

 22906                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device ;Clears carry

 22908                                  	;test	bx,8000h
 22909                                  	; 17/12/2022

 22917                                  ;ELSE
 22918                                  	;mov	ax,1107h
 22919 00003781 B80711                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|7
 22920 00003784 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - COMMIT REMOTE FILE
 22921                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 22922                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 22923                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 22924                                  			; CF clear if successful
 22925                                  localcommit_retn: ; 18/12/2022	
 22926 00003786 C3                      	retn
 22927                                  ;ENDIF
 22928                                  
 22929                                  ; Perform local commit operation by doing a close but not releaseing the SFT.
 22930                                  ; There are three ways we can do this. One is to enter a critical section to
 22931                                  ; protect a potential free. The second is to increment the ref count to mask
 22932                                  ; the close decrementing.
 22933                                  ;
 22934                                  ; The proper way is to let the caller's of close decide if a decrement should
 22935                                  ; be done. We do this by providing another entry into close after the
 22936                                  ; decrement and after the share information release.
 22937                                  
 22938                                  ; DOSCODE:6FA0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22939                                  ; DOSCODE:6F8Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 22940                                  ; 06/08/2025
 22941                                  ; DOSCODE:78D0h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 22942                                  
 22943                                  LOCAL_COMMIT:
 22944                                  	; 06/08/2025
 22945                                  	;call	ECritDisk
 22946                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22947 00003787 E80EE1                  	call	ECritDisk	;PTM.
 22948 0000378A E80C00                  	call	SetSFTTimes
 22949 0000378D B8FFFF                  	MOV	AX,-1 ; 0FFFFh
 22950 00003790 E8A4FE                  	call	CloseEntry
 22951                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22952 00003793 9C                      	PUSHF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 22953 00003794 E80A17                  	call	DEV_OPEN_SFT	;PTM.  increment device count	;AN000;
 22954                                  	; 06/08/2025
 22955                                  	;POPF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 22956                                  	;call	LCritDisk	;PTM.				;AN000;
 22957                                  	; 18/12/2022
 22958                                  	;jmp	LCritDisk
 22959                                  	; 06/08/2025
 22960 00003797 EB86                    	jmp	NoFree
 22961                                  ;localcommit_retn:
 22962                                  ;	retn
 22963                                  
 22964                                  ;Break	<SetSFTTimes - signal a change in the times for an SFT>
 22965                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22966                                  ;
 22967                                  ; Procedure Name : SetSFTTimes
 22968                                  ;
 22969                                  ;   SetSFTTimes - Examine the flags for a SFT and set the time appropriately.
 22970                                  ;   Reflect these times in other SFT's for the same file.
 22971                                  ;
 22972                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:DI point to SFT
 22973                                  ;		BX = sf_flags set appropriately
 22974                                  ;   Outputs:	Set sft times to current time if File & dirty & !nodate
 22975                                  ;   Registers modified: All except ES:DI, BX, AX
 22976                                  ;
 22977                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22978                                  
 22979                                  	; 04/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22980                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM

 22983                                  
 22984                                  ; 04/02/2024
 22985                                  %if 0
 22986                                  ;	File clean or device does not get stamped nor disk looked at.

 22991                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 22992                                  	;retnz				; clean or device => no timestamp
 22993                                  	jnz	short localcommit_retn

 23009 0000379D 75E7                    	jnz	short localcommit_retn
 23010                                  %endif
 23011                                  
 23012 0000379F 50                      	push	ax
 23013 000037A0 53                      	push	bx
 23014 000037A1 E8ADD3                  	call	DATE16			; Date/Time to AX/DX
 23015                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Fh],ax

 23052                                  ;BREAK <DOS_MkDir - Make a directory entry>
 23053                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23054                                  ;
 23055                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_MkDir
 23056                                  ;
 23057                                  ; Inputs:
 23058                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 23059                                  ;		terminated)
 23060                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 23061                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 23062                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 23063                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 23064                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 23065                                  ; Function:
 23066                                  ;	Make a new directory
 23067                                  ; Returns:
 23068                                  ;	Carry Clear
 23069                                  ;		No error
 23070                                  ;	Carry Set
 23071                                  ;	    AX is error code
 23072                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 23073                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 23074                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 23075                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 23076                                  ;		error_access_denied
 23077                                  ;			Already exists, device name
 23078                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 23079                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23080                                  
 23081                                  ;hkn; called from path.asm. DS already set up.
 23082                                  
 23083                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23084                                  ; DOSCODE:6FC6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23085                                  
 23086                                  ; 04/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 23087                                  ; DOSCODE:78FFh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)

 23701                                  ;	TITLE	DISK - Disk utility routines
 23702                                  ;	NAME	Disk
 23703                                  
 23704                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 23705                                  ;
 23706                                  ;	SWAPCON
 23707                                  ;	SWAPBACK
 23708                                  ;	DOS_READ
 23709                                  ;	DOS_WRITE
 23710                                  ;	get_io_sft
 23711                                  ;	DirRead
 23712                                  ;	FIRSTCLUSTER
 23713                                  ;	SET_BUF_AS_DIR
 23714                                  ;	FATSecRd
 23715                                  ;	DREAD
 23716                                  ;	CHECK_WRITE_LOCK
 23717                                  ;	CHECK_READ_LOCK
 23718                                  ;
 23719                                  ;	Revision history:
 23720                                  ;
 23721                                  ;		A000   version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 23722                                  ;
 23723                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23724                                  ;
 23725                                  ; M065 : B#5276. On raw read/write of a block of characters if a critical
 23726                                  ;		error happens, DOS retries the entire block assuming that
 23727                                  ;		zero characters were transferred. Modified the code to take
 23728                                  ;		into account the number of characters transfered before
 23729                                  ;		retrying the operation.
 23730                                  ;
 23731                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23732                                  ;
 23733                                  
 23734                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 23735                                  
 23736                                  ;Break	<SwapCon, Swap Back - Old-style I/O to files>
 23737                                  
 23738                                  ; **** Drivers for file input from devices ****
 23739                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23740                                  ;   Indicate that there is no more I/O occurring through another SFT outside
 23741                                  ;   of handles 0 and 1
 23742                                  ;
 23743                                  ;   Inputs:	DS is DOSDATA
 23744                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set to false.
 23745                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 23746                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23747                                  
 23748                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 3CF8h
 23749                                  
 23750                                  ; DOSCODE:71E3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23751                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23752                                  
 23753                                  ; DOSCODE:71CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23754                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23755                                  
 23756                                  SWAPBACK:
 23757 000039E2 C606[5703]00            	MOV	BYTE [CONSWAP],0	; signal no conswaps
 23758 000039E7 C3                      	retn
 23759                                  
 23760                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23761                                  ;
 23762                                  ; Procedure Name : SWAPCON
 23763                                  ;
 23764                                  ;   Copy ThisSFT to CONSFT for use by the 1-12 primitives.
 23765                                  ;
 23766                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisSFT as the sft of the desired file
 23767                                  ;		DS is DOSDATA
 23768                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set.  CONSFT = ThisSFT.
 23769                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 23770                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23771                                  
 23772                                  SWAPCON:
 23773                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 23774                                  	;push	es
 23775                                  	;push	di
 23776                                  	;mov	byte [CONSWAP],1
 23777                                  	;les	di,[THISSFT]
 23778                                  	;mov	word [CONSFT],di
 23779                                  	;mov	word [CONSFT+2],es
 23780                                  	;pop	di
 23781                                  	;pop	es
 23782                                  	;retn
 23783                                  
 23784                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23785 000039E8 C606[5703]01            	mov	byte [CONSWAP],1	; ConSwap = TRUE
 23786 000039ED 50                      	push	ax
 23787 000039EE A1[9E05]                	mov	ax,[THISSFT]
 23788 000039F1 A3[E605]                	mov	[CONSFT],ax
 23789 000039F4 A1[A005]                	mov	ax,[THISSFT+2]
 23790 000039F7 A3[E805]                	mov	[CONSFT+2],ax
 23791 000039FA 58                      	pop	ax
 23792 000039FB C3                      	retn
 23793                                  
 23794                                  ; DOSCODE:71FDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23795                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23796                                  
 23797                                  ;Break	<DOS_READ -- MAIN READ ROUTINE AND DEVICE IN ROUTINES>
 23798                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23799                                  ;
 23800                                  ; Inputs:
 23801                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 23802                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 23803                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to read
 23804                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 23805                                  ; Function:
 23806                                  ;	Perform read operation
 23807                                  ; Outputs:
 23808                                  ;    Carry clear
 23809                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 23810                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes read
 23811                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 23812                                  ;    Carry set
 23813                                  ;	AX is error code
 23814                                  ;	CX = 0
 23815                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 23816                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 23817                                  ;

 23865                                  			; Return: CF set on error, CX = bytes read

 24021                                  ; We are going to do a cooked read on some character device. There is a
 24022                                  ; problem here, what does the data look like? Is it a terminal device, line
 24023                                  ; CR line CR line CR, or is it file data, line CR LF line CR LF? Does it have
 24024                                  ; a ^Z at the end which is data, or is the ^Z not data?  In any event we're
 24025                                  ; going to do this: Read in pieces up to CR (CRs included in data) or ^z (^z
 24026                                  ; included in data). this "simulates" the way con works in cooked mode
 24027                                  ; reading one line at a time. With file data, however, the lines will look
 24028                                  ; like, LF line CR. This is a little weird.
 24029

 24362                                  ;Break	<DOS_WRITE -- MAIN WRITE ROUTINE AND DEVICE OUT ROUTINES>
 24363                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24364                                  ;
 24365                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_WRITE
 24366                                  ;
 24367                                  ; Inputs:
 24368                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 24369                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 24370                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to write
 24371                                  ; Function:
 24372                                  ;	Perform write operation
 24373                                  ;	NOTE: If CX = 0 on input, file is truncated or grown
 24374                                  ;		to current sf_position
 24375                                  ; Outputs:
 24376                                  ;    Carry clear
 24377                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 24378                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes written
 24379                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24380                                  ;    Carry set
 24381                                  ;	AX is error code
 24382                                  ;	CX = 0
 24383                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24384                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 24385                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24386                                  	
 24387                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24388                                  ; DOSCODE:742Ch (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24389                                  
 24390                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24391                                  ; DOSCODE:7418h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24392                                  
 24393                                  ; 08/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 24394                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7D8Fh
 24395                                  
 24396                                  DOS_WRITE:
 24397 00003BFD C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 24398                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]

 24400                                  	;;and	al,0Fh
 24401                                  	;AND	AL,access_mask

 24409 00003C0B E96304                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR
 24410                                  
 24411                                  ; NOTE: The following check for writting to a Read Only File is performed
 24412                                  ;	    ONLY on FCBs!!!!
 24413                                  ;	We ALLOW writes to Read Only files via handles to allow a CREATE
 24414                                  ;	    of a read only file which can then be written to.
 24415                                  ;	This is OK because we are NOT ALLOWED to OPEN a RO file via handles
 24416                                  ;	    for writting, or RE-CREATE an EXISTING RO file via handles. Thus,
 24417                                  ;	    CREATing a NEW RO file, or RE-CREATing an existing file which
 24418                                  ;	    is NOT RO to be RO, via handles are the only times we can write
 24419                                  ;	    to a read-only file.
 24420                                  
 24421                                  Check_FCB_RO:
 24422                                  	;;test	word [es:di+2],8000h
 24423                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],sf_isFCB
 24424                                  	;JZ	short WRITE_NO_MODE	; Not an FCB
 24425                                  	
 24426                                  	;test	byte [es:di+3],80h

 24428 00003C13 7407                    	JZ	short WRITE_NO_MODE	; Not an FCB

 24437                                  
 24438                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 24439                                  ;	transfer NET_WRITE
 24440                                  ;ELSE
 24441                                  	;mov	ax,1109h
 24442 00003C24 B80911                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|9
 24443 00003C27 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - WRITE TO REMOTE FILE
 24444                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 24445                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 24446                                  			; CX = number of bytes, SS = DOS CS, SDA DTA field -> user buffer
 24447                                  			; Return: CF set on error, CX = bytes written
 24448 00003C29 C3                      	retn
 24449                                  ;ENDIF

 24691                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24692                                  ;
 24693                                  ; Procedure Name : get_io_sft
 24694                                  ;
 24695                                  ;   Convert JFN number in BX to sf_entry in DS:SI We get the normal SFT if
 24696                                  ;   CONSWAP is FALSE or if the handle desired is 2 or more. Otherwise, we
 24697                                  ;   retrieve the sft from ConSFT which is set by SwapCon.
 24698                                  ;
 24699                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24700                                  
 24701                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24702                                  ; DOSCODE:7583h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24703                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24704                                  ; DOSCODE:756Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24705                                  
 24706                                  GET_IO_SFT:
 24707                                  	;test	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0FFh
 24708 00003D4E 36803E[5703]00          	cmp	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0			;smr;SS Override
 24709 00003D54 7512                    	JNZ	short GetRedir
 24710                                  GetNormal:
 24711 00003D56 16                      	push	ss
 24712 00003D57 1F                      	pop	ds
 24713 00003D58 06                      	PUSH	ES
 24714 00003D59 57                      	PUSH	DI
 24715 00003D5A E8A535                  	call	SFFromHandle
 24716 00003D5D 7206                    	JC	short RET44P
 24717 00003D5F 8CC6                    	MOV	SI,ES
 24718 00003D61 8EDE                    	MOV	DS,SI
 24719 00003D63 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 24720                                  RET44P:
 24721 00003D65 5F                      	POP	DI
 24722 00003D66 07                      	POP	ES
 24723 00003D67 C3                      	retn
 24724                                  GetRedir:
 24725 00003D68 83FB01                  	CMP	BX,1
 24726 00003D6B 77E9                    	JA	short GetNormal
 24727 00003D6D 36C536[E605]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CONSFT]
 24728 00003D72 F8                      	CLC
 24729                                  get_io_sft_retn:
 24730 00003D73 C3                      	retn

 24732                                  ;Break	<DIRREAD -- READ A DIRECTORY SECTOR>
 24733                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24734                                  ;
 24735                                  ; Procedure Name : DIRREAD
 24736                                  ;
 24737                                  ; Inputs:
 24738                                  ;	AX = Directory block number (relative to first block of directory)
 24739                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 24740                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = First sector of first cluster of directory
 24741                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster
 24742                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 24743                                  ; Function:
 24744                                  ;	Read the directory block into [CURBUF].
 24745                                  ; Outputs:
 24746                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM] = Next cluster (after the one skipped to)
 24747                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] Set
 24748                                  ;	ES:BP unchanged
 24749                                  ;	[CURBUF] Points to Buffer with dir sector
 24750                                  ;	Carry set if error (user said FAIL to I 24)
 24751                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed.
 24752                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24753                                  
 24754                                  ;hkn; called from dir.asm. DS already set up to DOSDATA.
 24755                                  
 24756                                  ; 08/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 24757                                  
 24758                                  DIRREAD:
 24759                                  
 24760                                  ; Note that ClusFac is the sectors per cluster. This is NOT necessarily
 24761                                  ; the same as what is in the DPB! In the case of the root directory, we have
 24762                                  ; ClusFac = # sectors in the root directory. The root directory is detected
 24763                                  ; by DIRStart = 0.
 24764                                  
 24765 00003D74 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX
 24766                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 24767 00003D76 3916[DC0A]              	cmp	[DIRSTART_HW],dx
 24768 00003D7A 7509                    	jnz	short SubDir
 24769                                  	;CMP	word [DIRSTART],0
 24770                                  	; 21/09/2023
 24771 00003D7C 3916[C205]              	cmp	[DIRSTART],dx ; 0
 24772 00003D80 7503                    	jnz	short SubDir
 24773 00003D82 92                      	XCHG	AX,DX
 24774 00003D83 EB0C                    	JMP	short DoRead
 24775                                  
 24776                                  ; Convert the sector number in AX into cluster and sector-within-cluster pair
 24777                                  
 24778                                  SubDir:
 24779 00003D85 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 24780                                  	;and	dl,[es:bp+4]
 24781 00003D87 26225604                	AND	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 24782                                  
 24783                                  ;	(DX) = sector-in-cluster
 24784                                  
 24785                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 24786 00003D8B 268A4E05                	MOV	CL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 24787 00003D8F D3E8                    	SHR	AX,CL
 24788                                  
 24789                                  ;	(DX) = position in cluster
 24790                                  ;	(AX) = number of clusters to skip
 24791                                  
 24792                                  DoRead:
 24793 00003D91 8816[7305]              	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],DL
 24794 00003D95 89C1                    	MOV	CX,AX
 24795 00003D97 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 24796                                  
 24797                                  ;	(CX) = number of clusters to skip.
 24798                                  ;	(AH) = remainder
 24799                                  
 24800                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24801                                  
 24802                                  ; 08/02/2024
 24803                                  %if 0
 24804                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24805                                  	;MOV	DX,[DIRSEC+2]	     	  ;>32mb
 24806                                  	;MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	  ;>32mb
 24807                                  	;MOV	DX,[DIRSEC]
 24808                                  	;ADD	DL,AH
 24809                                  	;ADC	DH,0
 24810                                  	;ADC	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0	  ;>32mb
 24811                                  	; 21/09/2023
 24812                                  	xor	bx,bx ; 0
 24813                                  	mov	dx,[DIRSEC]
 24814                                  	add	dl,ah
 24815                                  	adc	dh,bl ; 0
 24816                                  	adc	bx,[DIRSEC+2]
 24817                                  	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],bx
 24818                                  
 24819                                  	MOV	BX,[CLUSNUM]
 24820                                  	MOV	[NXTCLUSNUM],BX
 24821                                  	JCXZ	FIRSTCLUSTER
 24822                                  %else
 24823                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 24824 00003D99 8B1E[DE0A]              	mov	bx,[CLUSNUM_HW]
 24825 00003D9D 891E[E00A]              	mov	[NXTCLUSNUM_HW],bx
 24826 00003DA1 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 24827 00003DA5 8B16[C005]              	mov	dx,[DIRSEC+2]
 24828 00003DA9 8916[0706]              	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],dx
 24829 00003DAD 8B16[BE05]              	mov	dx,[DIRSEC]
 24830 00003DB1 00E2                    	add	dl,ah
 24831 00003DB3 80D600                  	adc	dh,0
 24832 00003DB6 8316[0706]00            	adc	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0
 24833 00003DBB 8B1E[BC05]              	mov	bx,[CLUSNUM]
 24834 00003DBF 891E[DC05]              	mov	[NXTCLUSNUM],bx
 24835 00003DC3 E339                    	jcxz	FIRSTCLUSTER
 24836                                  %endif
 24837                                  
 24838                                  SKPCLLP:
 24839 00003DC5 E86921                  	call	UNPACK
 24840 00003DC8 72A9                    	jc	short get_io_sft_retn
 24841                                  	;;;
 24842                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 24843 00003DCA FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 24844 00003DCE 8F06[F20A]              	pop	word [CLUSTERS_HW]
 24845 00003DD2 FF36[EC0A]              	push	word [CCONTENT_HW]
 24846 00003DD6 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 24847                                  	;;;
 24848 00003DDA 87DF                    	XCHG	BX,DI
 24849 00003DDC E82921                  	call	IsEOF			; test for eof based on fat size
 24850 00003DDF 7302                    	JAE	short HAVESKIPPED
 24851 00003DE1 E2E2                    	LOOP	SKPCLLP
 24852                                  HAVESKIPPED:
 24853 00003DE3 891E[DC05]              	MOV	[NXTCLUSNUM],BX
 24854                                  	;;;
 24855                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 24856 00003DE7 8B1E[E80A]              	mov	bx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 24857 00003DEB 891E[E00A]              	mov	[NXTCLUSNUM_HW],bx
 24858                                  	;
 24859 00003DEF 8B1E[F20A]              	mov	bx,[CLUSTERS_HW]
 24860 00003DF3 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 24861                                  	;;;
 24862 00003DF7 89FA                    	MOV	DX,DI
 24863 00003DF9 88E3                    	MOV	BL,AH
 24864 00003DFB E8FA17                  	call	FIGREC
 24865                                  
 24866                                  	;entry	FIRSTCLUSTER
 24867                                  
 24868                                  FIRSTCLUSTER:
 24869                                  	; 22/09/2023
 24870                                  	;;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 24871                                  	;MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_FAIL ; *
 24872                                  	;XOR	AL,AL ; *	; Indicate pre-read
 24873                                  	;call	GETBUFFR
 24874 00003DFE E87827                  	call	GETBUFFER ; *	; pre-read
 24875                                  	;jc	short get_io_sft_retn
 24876                                  	; 08/02/2024
 24877 00003E01 720C                    	jc	short dirread_retn
 24878                                  
 24879                                  	;entry	SET_BUF_AS_DIR
 24880                                  
 24881                                  SET_BUF_AS_DIR:
 24882                                  
 24883                                  ;	Set the type of CURBUF to be a directory sector.
 24884                                  ;	Only flags are modified.
 24885                                  
 24886 00003E03 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 24887 00003E04 56                      	PUSH	SI
 24888 00003E05 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 24889                                  	;or	byte [si+5],4
 24890 00003E09 804C0504                	OR	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_isDIR	; Clears carry
 24891 00003E0D 5E                      	POP	SI
 24892 00003E0E 1F                      	POP	DS
 24893                                  dirread_retn:
 24894 00003E0F C3                      	retn

 24896                                  ;Break	<FATSECRD -- READ A FAT SECTOR>
 24897                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24898                                  ;
 24899                                  ; Procedure Name : FATSECRD
 24900                                  ; Inputs:
 24901                                  ;	Same as DREAD
 24902                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 24903                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 24904                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number
 24905                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 24906                                  ; Function:
 24907                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform FAT read.
 24908                                  ; Outputs:
 24909                                  ;	Same as DREAD
 24910                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24911                                  
 24912                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24913                                  	; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24914

 24916                                  
 24917                                  FATSECRD:
 24918                                  ;hkn; SS override
 24919                                  	;mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],18h
 24920 00003E10 36C606[4B03]18          	MOV	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_FAIL
 24921 00003E16 89CF                    	MOV	DI,CX
 24922                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+8]
 24923 00003E18 268A4E08                	MOV	CL,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_COUNT]
 24924                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 24925                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0Fh]
 24926                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 24927                                  	;XOR	AH,AH

 24929                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+0Fh]
 24930 00003E1C 268B460F                	MOV	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE] ;>32mb
 24931 00003E20 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH
 24932                                  	;;;
 24933                                  	; 09/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 24934 00003E22 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 24935 00003E24 7509                    	jnz	short FATSECRD_cont	; not FAT32
 24936                                  	;test	byte [es:bp+23h],80h
