 24939                                  	;mov	cx,1           		; only one FAT is active
 24940 00003E2D B101                    	mov	cl,1
 24941                                  FATSECRD_cont:
 24942 00003E2F 36FF36[0706]            	push	word [ss:HIGH_SECTOR]
 24943                                  	;;;
 24944 00003E34 52                      	PUSH	DX
 24945                                  NXTFAT:

 24947                                  ;hkn; SS override

 24951 00003E36 50                      	PUSH	AX
 24952                                  	;;;

 24997                                  ;Break	<DREAD -- DO A DISK READ>
 24998                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24999                                  ;
 25000                                  ; Procedure Name : DREAD
 25001                                  ;
 25002                                  ; Inputs:
 25003                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 25004                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25005                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	      (LOW)
 25006                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25007                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25008                                  ;	[ALLOWED] must be set in case call to HARDERR needed
 25009                                  ; Function:
 25010                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform disk read. If BIOS reports
 25011                                  ;	errors, will call HARDERRRW for further action.
 25012                                  ; Outputs:
 25013                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILED to INT 24)
 25014                                  ; DS,ES:BP preserved. All other registers destroyed.
 25015                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25016

 25018                                  DREAD:
 25019 00003E73 E85200                  	call	DSKREAD
 25020 00003E76 7497                    	jz	short dirread_retn	; Carry clear
 25021                                  ;hkn; SS override
 25022 00003E78 36C606[7505]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:READOP],0	; Read
 25023 00003E7E E89A00                  	call	HARDERRRW
 25024 00003E81 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1			; Check for retry
 25025 00003E83 74EE                    	JZ	short DREAD
 25026                                  
 25027                                  fail_ignore:	; 09/02/2024
 25028 00003E85 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3			; Check for FAIL
 25029 00003E87 F8                      	CLC
 25030 00003E88 7501                    	JNZ	short NO_CAR		; Ignore
 25031 00003E8A F9                      	STC
 25032                                  NO_CAR:

 25067                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],8
 25068 00003E93 26F6450408              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_attr],attr_volume_id ;volume id
 25069                                  	;JZ	short write_cont			     ;no
 25070                                  	;;call	SET_ACC_ERR_DS

 25079                                  	;retn

 25081 00003E9A E9D201                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25082                                  
 25083                                  write_cont:				;
 25084 00003E9D 51                      	PUSH	CX			;save reg
 25085 00003E9E 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;
 25086 00003EA0 7501                    	JNZ	short Not_Truncate	;
 25087 00003EA2 49                      	dec	cx			;(cx) = -1; check for lock on whole file
 25088                                  Not_Truncate:				;
 25089 00003EA3 B080                    	MOV	AL,80H			;check write access
 25090 00003EA5 E86B41                  	call	LOCK_CHECK		;check lock
 25091 00003EA8 59                      	POP	CX			;restore reg
 25092 00003EA9 7305                    	JNC	short WRITE_OK		;lock ok
 25093 00003EAB E87301                  	call	WRITE_LOCK_VIOLATION	;issue I24
 25094 00003EAE 73ED                    	JNC	short write_cont	;retry
 25095                                  WRITE_OK:				;
 25096 00003EB0 C3                      	retn				;

 25145                                  ;	TITLE	DISK2 - Disk utility routines
 25146                                  ;	NAME	Disk2
 25147                                  
 25148                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 25149                                  ;
 25150                                  ;	DskRead
 25151                                  ;	DWRITE
 25152                                  ;	DSKWRITE
 25153                                  ;	HarderrRW
 25154                                  ;	SETUP
 25155                                  ;	BREAKDOWN
 25156                                  ;	READ_LOCK_VIOLATION
 25157                                  ;	WRITE_LOCK_VIOLATION
 25158                                  ;	DISKREAD
 25159                                  ;	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25160                                  ;	SET_ACC_ERR
 25161                                  ;	SETSFT
 25162                                  ;	SETCLUS
 25163                                  ;	AddRec
 25164                                  ;
 25165                                  ;	Revision history:
 25166                                  ;
 25167                                  ;		AN000 version 4.00 Jan. 1988
 25168                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk read/write optimization
 25169                                  
 25170                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25171                                  ; DOSCODE:7699h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 25172                                  ; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 25173                                  ; DOSCODE:7685h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 25174                                  
 25175                                  ;Break	<DSKREAD -- PHYSICAL DISK READ>
 25176                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25177                                  ;
 25178                                  ; Procedure Name : DSKREAD
 25179                                  ;
 25180                                  ; Inputs:
 25181                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer addr
 25182                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25183                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25184                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 25185                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25186                                  ; Function:
 25187                                  ;	Call BIOS to perform disk read
 25188                                  ; Outputs:
 25189                                  ;	DI = CX on entry
 25190                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors unsuccessfully transfered
 25191                                  ;	AX = Status word as returned by BIOS (error code in AL if error)
 25192                                  ;	Zero set if OK (from BIOS) (carry clear)
 25193                                  ;	Zero clear if error (carry clear)
 25194                                  ; SI Destroyed, others preserved
 25195                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25196                                  
 25197                                  DSKREAD:
 25198 00003EC8 51                      	PUSH	CX
 25199                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; 04/05/2019
 25200 00003EC9 268A6617                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 25201                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+1]
 25202 00003ECD 268A4601                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 25203 00003ED1 53                      	PUSH	BX
 25204 00003ED2 06                      	PUSH	ES
 25205 00003ED3 E8CD10                  	call	SETREAD
 25206 00003ED6 EB22                    	JMP	short DODSKOP
 25207                                  
 25208                                  ;Break	<DWRITE -- SEE ABOUT WRITING>
 25209                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25210                                  ;
 25211                                  ; Procedure Name : DWRITE
 25212                                  ;
 25213                                  ; Inputs:
 25214                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 25215                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25216                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25217                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 25218                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25219                                  ;	[ALLOWED] must be set in case HARDERR called
 25220                                  ; Function:
 25221                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform disk write. If BIOS reports
 25222                                  ;	errors, will call HARDERRRW for further action.
 25223                                  ; Output:
 25224                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently, user FAILed to I 24)
 25225                                  ; BP preserved. All other registers destroyed.
 25226                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25227                                  
 25228                                  	;entry	DWRITE
 25229                                  DWRITE:
 25230 00003ED8 E81100                  	CALL	DSKWRITE
 25231 00003EDB 74EA                    	jz	short dw_ret_label	; Carry clear (retz)
 25232                                  
 25233                                  ;hkn; SS override
 25234 00003EDD 36C606[7505]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:READOP],1	; Write
 25235 00003EE3 E83500                  	call	HARDERRRW
 25236 00003EE6 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1			; Check for retry
 25237 00003EE8 74EE                    	JZ	short DWRITE
 25238                                  
 25239                                  ; 09/02/2024
 25240                                  %if 0
 25241                                  	CMP	AL,3			; Check for FAIL
 25242                                  	CLC
 25243                                  	JNZ	short NO_CAR2 		; Ignore
 25244                                  	STC
 25245                                  NO_CAR2:
 25246                                  dw_ret_label:
 25247                                  	retn
 25248                                  %else
 25249                                  	; 09/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 25250 00003EEA EB99                    	jmp	short fail_ignore
 25251                                  %endif
 25252                                  
 25253                                  ;Break	<DSKWRITE -- PHYSICAL DISK WRITE>
 25254                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25255                                  ;
 25256                                  ; Procedure Name : DSKWRITE
 25257                                  ;
 25258                                  ; Inputs:
 25259                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer addr
 25260                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25261                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 25262                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25263                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25264                                  ; Function:
 25265                                  ;	Call BIOS to perform disk read
 25266                                  ; Outputs:
 25267                                  ;	DI = CX on entry
 25268                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors unsuccessfully transfered
 25269                                  ;	AX = Status word as returned by BIOS (error code in AL if error)
 25270                                  ;	Zero set if OK (from BIOS) (carry clear)
 25271                                  ;	Zero clear if error (carry clear)
 25272                                  ; SI Destroyed, others preserved
 25273                                  ;
 25274                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 25367                                  ;Break	<SETUP -- SETUP A DISK READ OR WRITE FROM USER>
 25368                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25369                                  ;
 25370                                  ; Procedure Name : SETUP
 25371                                  ;
 25372                                  ; Inputs:
 25373                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT (value also in THISSFT)
 25374                                  ;	DMAAdd contains transfer address
 25375                                  ;	CX = Byte count
 25376                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 25377                                  ;   WARNING Stack must be clean, two ret addrs on stack, 1st of caller,
 25378                                  ;		2nd of caller of caller.
 25379                                  ; Outputs:
 25380                                  ;	    CX = byte count
 25381                                  ;	    [THISDPB] = Base of drive parameters if file
 25382                                  ;		      = Pointer to device header if device or NET
 25383                                  ;	    ES:DI Points to SFT
 25384                                  ;	    [NEXTADD] = Displacement of disk transfer within segment
 25385                                  ;	    [TRANS] = 0 (No transfers yet)
 25386                                  ;	    BytPos = Byte position in file
 25387                                  ;
 25388                                  ;	The following fields are relevant to local files (not devices) only:
 25389                                  ;
 25390                                  ;	    SecPos = Position of first sector (local files only)
 25391                                  ;	    [BYTSECPOS] = Byte position in first sector (local files only)
 25392                                  ;	    [CLUSNUM] = First cluster (local files only)
 25393                                  ;	    [SECCLUSPOS] = Sector within first cluster (local files only)
 25394                                  ;	    [THISDRV] = Physical unit number (local files only)
 25395                                  ;
 25396                                  ;      RETURNS ONE LEVEL UP WITH:
 25397                                  ;	   CX = 0
 25398                                  ;	   CARRY = Clear
 25399                                  ;	IF AN ERROR IS DETECTED
 25400                                  ; All other registers destroyed
 25401                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 26128                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 26129                                  ;Break   <DskRdBufScan -- Disk Read Buffer Scan>
 26130                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26131                                  ;
 26132                                  ; Procedure Name : DskRdBufScan
 26133                                  ;
 26134                                  ; Inputs:
 26135                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors read. (These constitute a block of
 26136                                  ;            sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
 26137                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
 26138                                  ;       [TEMP_VAR2]:[TEMP_VAR] = Transfer address (destination data address).
 26139                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
 26140                                  ;
 26141                                  ; Function:
 26142                                  ;	The Buffer Queue is scanned: the contents of any dirty buffers are
 26143                                  ;	"read" into the transfer memory block, so that the transfer memory
 26144                                  ;	reflects the most recent data.
 26145                                  ;
 26146                                  ; Outputs:
 26147                                  ;       Transfer memory updated as required.
 26148                                  ;
 26149                                  ; Uses:
 26150                                  ;       DS,AX,BX,CX,SI,DI destroyed.
 26151                                  ;       SS override for all global variables.
 26152                                  ;
 26153                                  ; Notes:
 26154                                  ;       FIRST_BUFF_ADDR is set-up to contain the LAST buffer to check, rather
 26155                                  ;	than the FIRST.
 26156                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26157                                  ;M039: Created
 26158                                  
 26159                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26160                                  ; DOSCODE:78F0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 26161                                  
 26162                                  ; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 26163                                  ; DOSCODE:78DCh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 26164                                  
 26165                                  ; 09/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 26166                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8313h
 26167                                  
 26168                                  ;procedure DskRdBufScan,NEAR
 26169                                  ;
 26170                                  ;ASSUME  DS:NOTHING
 26171                                  
 26172                                  DskRdBufScan:
 26173 0000415A 36833E[7100]00          	cmp	word [ss:DirtyBufferCount],0 ; Any dirty buffers?
 26174 00004160 743C                    	je	short bufx		     ; -no, skip all work.
 26175                                  
 26176 00004162 368B1E[0706]            	mov     bx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]
 26177 00004167 89DE                    	mov     si,bx
 26178 00004169 01D1                    	add     cx,dx
 26179 0000416B 83D600                  	adc     si,0
 26180                                  
 26181 0000416E E89823                  	call	GETCURHEAD		;DS:DI -> 1st buf in queue.
 26182                                  	;mov	ax,[di+2]
 26183 00004171 8B4502                  	mov     ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]
 26184 00004174 36A3[1711]              	mov     [ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],ax
 26185                                  		
 26186                                  	; 18/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 26187                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 26188                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+DPB.DRIVE]
 26189                                  	; 15/12/2022
 26190 00004178 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 26191                                  
 26192                                  ;       BX:DX = Extent start.
 26193                                  ;       SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 26194                                  ;          AL = Drive #.
 26195                                  ;       DS:DI-> 1st buffer in queue.
 26196                                  ;[FIRST_BUFF_ADDR] = Address offset of last buffer in queue.
 26197                                  
 26198                                  bufq:	
 26199                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 26200 0000417C 3A4504                  	cmp     al,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID] ;Same drive?
 26201 0000417F 7514                    	jne	short bufq1        	;  -no, jump.
 26202                                  
 26203                                  ;       Cmp32   bx,dx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 26204                                  ;       ja	short bufq1		;Jump if Extent start > buffer sector.
 26205                                  
 26206                                  	;cmp	bx,[di+8]
 26207 00004181 3B5D08                  	cmp	bx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 26208 00004184 7503                    	jne	short bufq01
 26209                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 26210 00004186 3B5506                  	cmp	dx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 26211                                  bufq01:
 26212 00004189 770A                    	ja	short bufq1
 26213                                  
 26214                                  ;       Cmp32   si,cx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 26215                                  ;       ja	short bufq2		;Jump if Extent end >= buffer sector.
 26216                                  
 26217                                  	;cmp	si,[di+8]
 26218 0000418B 3B7508                  	cmp	si,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 26219 0000418E 7503                    	jne	short bufq02
 26220                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+6]

 27332                                  ;Break   <DskWrtBufPurge -- Disk Write Buffer Purge>
 27333                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27334                                  ;
 27335                                  ; Procedure Name : DskWrtBufPurge
 27336                                  ;
 27337                                  ; Inputs:
 27338                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors to write. (These constitute a block of
 27339                                  ;	     sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
 27340                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
 27341                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
 27342                                  ;
 27343                                  ; Function:
 27344                                  ;       Purge the Buffer Queue and the Secondary Cache of any buffers which
 27345                                  ;	are in Extent; they are being over-written.
 27346                                  ;
 27347                                  ; Outputs:
 27348                                  ;       (Same as Input.)
 27349                                  ; Uses:
 27350                                  ;       All registers except DS,AX,SI,DI preserved.
 27351                                  ;       SS override for all global variables.
 27352                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27353                                  ;M039: Created
 27354                                  
 27355                                  ;procedure   DskWrtBufPurge,NEAR
 27356                                  ;
 27357                                  ;ASSUME  DS:NOTHING
 27358                                  
 27359                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27360                                  ; DOSCODE:7C0Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27361                                  
 27362                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27363                                  ; DOSCODE:7BD4h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27364                                  
 27365                                  ; 10/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 27366                                  ; DOSCODE:8714h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 27367                                  
 27368                                  ; NOTE: Secondary (Buffer) Cache is not used in PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 27369                                  
 27370                                  ; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:BB93h)
 27371                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - DOSCODE:7C0Eh)
 27372                                  
 27373                                  DskWrtBufPurge:
 27374                                  	;SaveReg <bx,cx>
 27375 0000452A 53                      	push	bx
 27376 0000452B 51                      	push	cx
 27377                                  
 27378 0000452C 368B1E[0706]            	mov	bx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]	;BX:DX = Extent start (sector #).
 27379 00004531 89DE                    	mov	si,bx
 27380 00004533 01D1                    	add	cx,dx
 27381 00004535 83D600                  	adc	si,0                    ;SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 27382                                  
 27383                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27384                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 27385                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+DPB.DRIVE]
 27386                                  	; 15/12/2022
 27387 00004538 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 27388                                  
 27389                                  ; 10/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 27390                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 27391                                  %if 0
 27392                                  
 27393                                  ;	BX:DX = Extent start.
 27394                                  ;	SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 27395                                  ;	AL = Drive #
 27396                                  
 27397                                  	cmp	word [ss:SC_CACHE_COUNT],0 ;Secondary cache in-use?
 27398                                  	je	short nosc		; -no, jump.
 27399                                  
 27400                                  ;	If any of the sectors to be written are in the secondary cache (SC),
 27401                                  ;	invalidate the entire SC. (This is an optimization; we really only
 27402                                  ;	need to invalidate those sectors which intersect, but that's slower.)
 27403                                  
 27404                                  	cmp	al,[ss:CurSC_DRIVE]	;Same drive?
 27405                                  	jne	short nosc		; -no, jump.
 27406                                  
 27407                                  	push    ax
 27408                                  	mov     ax,[ss:CurSC_SECTOR]
 27409                                  	mov     di,[ss:CurSC_SECTOR+2]	;DI:AX = SC start.
 27410                                  
 27411                                  	;Cmp32	si,cx,di,ax		;Extent end < SC start?
 27412                                  	;jbe	short sc5		; -yes, jump.
 27413                                  
 27414                                  	cmp	si,di
 27415                                  	jne	short sc01
 27416                                  	cmp	cx,ax
 27417                                  sc01: 
 27418                                  	jbe	short sc5
 27419                                  
 27420                                  	add	ax,[ss:SC_CACHE_COUNT]
 27421                                  	adc	di,0                    ;DI:AX = SC end + 1.
 27422                                  	
 27423                                  	;Cmp32	bx,dx,di,ax             ;Extent start > SC end?
 27424                                  	;jae	short sc5		; -yes, jump.
 27425                                  
 27426                                  	cmp	bx,di
 27427                                  	jne	short sc02
 27428                                  	cmp	dx,ax
 27429                                  sc02:
 27430                                  	jnb	short sc5
 27431                                  
 27432                                  	mov	word [ss:SC_STATUS],0	;Extent intersects SC: invalidate SC.
 27433                                  sc5:	
 27434                                  	pop     ax
 27435                                  
 27436                                  %endif
 27437                                  
 27438                                  ;	Free any buffered sectors which are in Extent; they are being over-
 27439                                  ;	written.
 27440                                  
 27441                                  nosc:	
 27442 0000453C E8CA1F                  	call	GETCURHEAD		;DS:DI -> first buffer in queue.
 27443                                  
 27444                                  _bufq:	
 27445                                  	;cmpo	al,[di+4]
 27446 0000453F 3A4504                  	cmp     al,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID] ;Same drive?
 27447 00004542 7527                    	jne	short bufq5		; -no, jump.
 27448                                  
 27449                                  ;       Cmp32   bx,dx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 27450                                  ;       ja	short bufq5		;Jump if Extent start > buffer sector.
 27451                                  
 27452                                  	;cmp	bx,[di+8]
 27453 00004544 3B5D08                  	cmp	bx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 27454 00004547 7503                    	jne	short bufq04
 27455                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 27456 00004549 3B5506                  	cmp	dx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 27457                                  bufq04:
 27458 0000454C 771D                    	ja	short bufq5
 27459                                  
 27460                                  ;       Cmp32   si,cx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 27461                                  ;       jbe	short bufq5		;Jump if Extent end < buffer sector.
 27462                                  
 27463                                  	;cmp	si,[di+8]
 27464 0000454E 3B7508                  	cmp	si,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 27465 00004551 7503                    	jne	short bufq05
 27466                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+6]
 27467 00004553 3B4D06                  	cmp	cx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 27468                                  bufq05:
 27469 00004556 7613                    	jbe	short bufq5
 27470                                  
 27471                                  ;	Buffer's sector is in Extent, so free it; it is being over-written.
 27472                                  
 27473                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 27474 00004558 F6450540                	test	byte [di+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty ;Buffer dirty?
 27475 0000455C 7403                    	jz	short bufq4		; -no, jump.
 27476 0000455E E8BF22                  	call	DEC_DIRTY_COUNT		; -yes, decrement dirty count.
 27477                                  bufq4:
 27478                                  	;mov	word [di+4],20FFh
 27479 00004561 C74504FF20              	mov     word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],((buf_visit<<8)|0FFh)
 27480                                  
 27481 00004566 E8B21F                  	call	SCANPLACE
 27482 00004569 EB02                    	jmp     short bufq6
 27483                                  bufq5: 
 27484 0000456B 8B3D                    	mov     di,[di]
 27485                                  	;mov	di,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 27486                                  bufq6: 
 27487 0000456D 363B3E[1711]            	cmp	di,[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR]	;Scanned entire buffer queue?
 27488 00004572 75CB                    	jne	short _bufq		; --no, go do next buffer.
 27489                                  	
 27490                                  	;RestoreReg <cx,bx>
 27491 00004574 59                      	pop	cx
 27492 00004575 5B                      	pop	bx
 27493 00004576 C3                      	retn
 27494                                  
 27495                                  ;EndProc DskWrtBufPurge
 27496                                  
 27497                                  ;Break   <DIV32 -- PERFORM 32 BIT DIVIDE>
 27498                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27499                                  ;
 27500                                  ; Procedure Name : DIV32
 27501                                  ;
 27502                                  ; Inputs:
 27503                                  ;       DX:AX = 32 bit dividend   BX= divisor
 27504                                  ; Function:
 27505                                  ;       Perform 32 bit division:  DX:AX/BX = CX:AX + DX (rem.)
 27506                                  ; Outputs:
 27507                                  ;       CX:AX = quotient , DX= remainder
 27508                                  ; Uses:
 27509                                  ;       All registers except AX,CX,DX preserved.
 27510                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27511                                  ;M039: DIV32 optimized for divisor of 512 (common sector size).
 27512                                  
 27513                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27514                                  ; DOSCODE:7C94h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27515                                  
 27516                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27517                                  ; DOSCODE:7C5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27518                                  
 27519                                  DIV32:
 27520 00004577 81FB0002                	cmp	bx,512
 27521 0000457B 7515                    	jne	short div5
 27522                                  
 27523 0000457D 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 27524 0000457F 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax           ; CX:AX = Dividend
 27525 00004581 81E2FF01                	and	dx,(512-1)      ; DX = Remainder
 27526 00004585 88E0                    	mov	al,ah
 27527 00004587 88CC                    	mov	ah,cl
 27528 00004589 88E9                    	mov	cl,ch
 27529 0000458B 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 27530 0000458D D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 27531 0000458F D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 27532 00004591 C3                      	retn
 27533                                  div5:	
 27534 00004592 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 27535 00004594 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx
 27536 00004596 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27537 00004598 F7F3                    	div	bx              ; 0:AX/BX
 27538 0000459A 91                      	xchg	cx,ax
 27539 0000459B F7F3                    	div	bx              ; DX:AX/BX
 27540 0000459D C3                      	retn
 27541                                  
 27542                                  ;Break   <SHR32 -- PERFORM 32 BIT SHIFT RIGHT>
 27543                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27544                                  ;
 27545                                  ; Procedure Name : SHR32
 27546                                  ;
 27547                                  ; Inputs:
 27548                                  ;	DX:AX = 32 bit sector number
 27549                                  ; Function:
 27550                                  ;       Perform 32 bit shift right
 27551                                  ; Outputs:
 27552                                  ;	AX = cluster number
 27553                                  ;	ZF = 1 if no error
 27554                                  ;	   = 0 if error (cluster number > 64k)
 27555                                  ; Uses:
 27556                                  ;       DX,CX
 27557                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27558                                  ; M017	- SHR32 rewritten for better performance
 27559                                  ; M039	- Additional optimization
 27560                                  
 27561                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27562                                  ; DOSCODE:7CBBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27563                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27564                                  ; DOSCODE:7C81h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27565                                  
 27566                                  SHR32:
 27567                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 27568 0000459E 268A4E05                	mov	cl,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 27569 000045A2 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch	    ;ZF=1
 27570 000045A4 E306                    	jcxz	norota
 27571                                  rotashft2:
 27572 000045A6 D1EA                    	shr	dx,1	    ;ZF reflects state of DX.
 27573 000045A8 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1	    ;ZF not affected.
 27574 000045AA E2FA                    	loop	rotashft2
 27575                                  norota:
 27576 000045AC C3                      	retn
 27577                                  
 27578                                  ;============================================================================
 27579                                  ; DIR.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 27580                                  ;============================================================================
 27581                                  ; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27582                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27583                                  
 27584                                  ;	TITLE	DIR - Directory and path cracking
 27585                                  ;	NAME	Dir
 27586                                  
 27587                                  ;Break	<FINDENTRY -- LOOK FOR AN ENTRY>
 27588                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27589                                  ;
 27590                                  ; Procedure Name : FINDENTRY,SEARCH
 27591                                  ;
 27592                                  ; Inputs:
 27593                                  ;	[THISDPB] set
 27594                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 27595                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Starting directory sector number
 27596                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster of directory
 27597                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 27598                                  ;	[NAME1] = Name to look for
 27599                                  ; Function:
 27600                                  ;	Find file name in disk directory.
 27601                                  ;	"?" matches any character.
 27602                                  ; Outputs:
 27603                                  ;	Carry set if name not found
 27604                                  ;	ELSE
 27605                                  ;	Zero set if attributes match (always except when creating)
 27606                                  ;	AH = Device ID (bit 7 set if not disk)
 27607                                  ;	[THISDPB] = Base of drive parameters
 27608                                  ;	DS = DOSGROUP
 27609                                  ;	ES = DOSGROUP
 27610                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX = Pointer into directory buffer
 27611                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:SI = Pointer to First Cluster field in directory entry
 27612                                  ;	[CURBUF] has directory record with match
 27613                                  ;	[NAME1] has file name
 27614                                  ;	[LASTENT] is entry number of the entry
 27615                                  ; All other registers destroyed.
 27616                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27617                                  
 27618                                  ;hkn; called from rename.asm and dir2.asm. DS must be already set up at
 27619                                  ;hkn; this point.
 27620                                  
 27621                                  SEARCH:
 27622                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27623                                  	; DOSCODE:7C90h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27624                                  
 27625                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27626                                  	; DOSCODE:7CCAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27627                                  
 27628                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27629                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 45B3h
 27630                                  	; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 27631                                  
 27632                                  	; 24/01/2024
 27633                                  
 27634                                  	; 13/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 27635                                  	; DOSCODE:8797h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 27636                                  
 27637                                  	;entry	FindEntry
 27638                                  FINDENTRY:
 27639 000045AD E8D405                  	call	STARTSRCH
 27640 000045B0 A0[6B05]                	MOV	AL,[ATTRIB]
 27641                                  	;and	al,9Eh
 27642 000045B3 24DE                    	AND	AL,~attr_ignore		; Ignore useless bits
 27643                                  	;cmp	al,8
 27644 000045B5 3C08                    	CMP	AL,attr_volume_id	; Looking for vol ID only ?
 27645 000045B7 7503                    	JNZ	short NOTVOLSRCH	; No
 27646 000045B9 E83402                  	CALL	SETROOTSRCH		; Yes force search of root
 27647                                  NOTVOLSRCH:
 27648 000045BC E84C01                  	CALL	GETENTRY
 27649                                  	;JNC	short SRCH

 27822                                  ;
 27823                                  ; Procedure Name : MetaCompare
 27824                                  ;
 27825                                  ; Inputs:
 27826                                  ;	DS:SI -> 11 character FCB style name NO '?'
 27827                                  ;	    Typically this is a directory entry. It MUST be in upper case
 27828                                  ;	ES:DI -> 11 character FCB style name with possible '?'
 27829                                  ;	    Typically this is a FCB or SFT. It MUST be in upper case
 27830                                  ; Function:
 27831                                  ;	Compare FCB style names allowing for ? match to any char
 27832                                  ; Outputs:
 27833                                  ;	Zero if match else NZ
 27834                                  ; Destroys CX,SI,DI all others preserved
 27835                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27836                                  
 27837                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27838                                  	; DOSCODE:7D3Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27839                                  
 27840                                  MetaCompare:
 27841 00004685 B90B00                  	MOV	CX,11
 27842                                  WILDCRD:
 27843 00004688 F3A6                    	REPE	CMPSB
 27844 0000468A 7407                    	JZ	short MetaRet 		; most of the time we will fail.
 27845                                  CHECK_META:
 27846 0000468C 26807DFF3F              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1],"?"
 27847 00004691 74F5                    	JZ	short WILDCRD
 27848                                  MetaRet:
 27849 00004693 C3                       	retn				; Zero set, Match

 27994                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27995                                  ;
 27996                                  ; Procedure Name : GETENTRY
 27997                                  ;
 27998                                  ; Inputs:
 27999                                  ;	[LASTENT] has directory entry
 28000                                  ;	ES:BP points to drive parameters
 28001                                  ;	[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[ENTLAST] set for DIR involved
 28002                                  ; Function:
 28003                                  ;	Locates directory entry in preparation for search
 28004                                  ;	GETENT provides entry for passing desired entry in AX
 28005                                  ; Outputs:
 28006                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX = Pointer to next directory entry in CURBUF
 28007                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:DX = Pointer to first byte after end of CURBUF
 28008                                  ;	[LASTENT] = New directory entry number
 28009                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS] set via DIRREAD
 28010                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28011                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28012                                  
 28013                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28014                                  GETENTRY:
 28015                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28016 0000470B A1[4803]                	MOV	AX,[LASTENT]
 28017                                  
 28018                                  	;entry	GETENT
 28019                                  GETENT:
 28020 0000470E A3[4803]                	MOV	[LASTENT],AX
 28021                                  ;
 28022                                  ; Convert the entry number in AX into a byte offset from the beginning of the
 28023                                  ; directory.
 28024                                  ;
 28025 00004711 B105                    	mov	cl,5			; shift left by 5 = mult by 32
 28026 00004713 D3C0                    	rol	ax,cl			; keep hight order bits
 28027 00004715 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 28028                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28029                                  	;and	ax,0FFE0h
 28030                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28031                                  	;and	ax,~(32-1)		; mask off high order bits
 28032                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28033 00004717 24E0                    	and	al,0E0h ; ~31
 28034 00004719 83E21F                  	and	dx,1Fh
 28035                                  	;and	dx,32-1			; mask off low order bits
 28036                                  ;
 28037                                  ; DX:AX contain the byte offset of the required directory entry from the
 28038                                  ; beginning of the directory. Convert this to a sector number. Round the
 28039                                  ; sector size down to a multiple of 32.
 28040                                  ;
 28041                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+2]
 28042 0000471C 268B5E02                	MOV	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 28043 00004720 80E3E0                  	and	bl,0E0h
 28044                                  	;AND	BL,255-31		; Must be multiple of 32
 28045 00004723 F7F3                    	DIV	BX
 28046                                  	; 14/02/2024
 28047                                  	;MOV	BX,DX			; Position within sector
 28048                                  				; NOTE: This BX value is not used in DIRREAD
 28049                                  				; Erdogan Tan - 14/02/2024
 28050                                  	;PUSH	BX
 28051 00004725 52                      	push	dx
 28052                                  	;
 28053 00004726 E84BF6                  	call	DIRREAD
 28054 00004729 5B                      	POP	BX
 28055                                  	;retc
 28056 0000472A 72BD                    	jc	short nextentry_retn
 28057                                  SETENTRY:
 28058 0000472C 8B16[E205]              	MOV	DX,[CURBUF]
 28059                                  	;;;add	dx,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 28060                                  	;;add	dx,20 ; MSDOS 6.0 
 28061                                  	;add	dx,24 ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 14/02/2024	
 28062 00004730 83C218                  	ADD	DX,BUFINSIZ
 28063 00004733 01D3                    	ADD	BX,DX
 28064                                  	;add	dx,[es:bp+2]
 28065 00004735 26035602                	ADD	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]  ; Always clears carry
 28066                                  	; 29/12/2022
 28067                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS contains a 'CLC' here, at DOSCODE:7E15h
 28068                                  	; 27/06/2024
 28069                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM contains 'CLC' here, at DOSCODE:8931h
 28070 00004739 F8                      	clc
 28071 0000473A C3                      	retn
 28072                                  
 28073                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28074                                  
 28075                                  ; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28076                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8933h
 28077                                  
 28078                                  sft_fcb_table:
 28079 0000473B 00<rep 14h>             	times 20 db 0
 28080                                  sftfcb.cluster:
 28081 0000474F 00000000                	dd	0
 28082                                  sftfcb.direntry:
 28083 00004753 0000                    	dw	0
 28084                                  sftfcb_entry_size equ $ - sftfcb.cluster ; = 6
 28085                                  
 28086 00004755 00<rep 72h>             	times 114 db 0	; 6*20 = 120 ; entry size = 6 bytes 
 28087                                  
 28088                                  SRCH_CLUSTER:
 28089 000047C7 0000                    	dw	0
 28090                                  SRCH_CLUSTER_HW:
 28091 000047C9 0000                    	dw	0

 28095                                  ;Break	<SETDIRSRCH SETROOTSRCH -- Set Search environments>
 28096                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28097                                  ;
 28098                                  ; Procedure Name : SETDIRSRCH,SETROOTSRCH
 28099                                  ;
 28100                                  ; Inputs:
 28101                                  ;	BX cluster number of start of directory
 28102                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28103                                  ;	DI next cluster number from fastopen extended info. DOS 3.3 only
 28104                                  ; Function:
 28105                                  ;	Set up a directory search
 28106                                  ; Outputs:
 28107                                  ;	[DIRSTART] = BX
 28108                                  ;	[CLUSFAC],[CLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC] set
 28109                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28110                                  ; destroys AX,DX,BX
 28111                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28112                                  
 28113                                  	;;;
 28114                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28115                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:89C3h
 28116                                  	;;;
 28117                                  SETDIRSRCH:
 28118 000047CB A1[EE0A]                	mov	ax,[ROOTCLUST_HW]
 28119                                  	;cmp	word [ROOTCLUST_HW],0
 28120 000047CE 21C0                    	and	ax,ax	
 28121 000047D0 7504                    	jnz	short SETDIRSRCH_FAT32
 28122                                  	
 28123 000047D2 09DB                    	or	bx,bx
 28124                                  	;jz	short SETROOTSRCH
 28125 000047D4 741C                    	jz	short SETROOTSRCH2 ; ax = 0
 28126                                  SETDIRSRCH_FAT32:
 28127                                  	;mov	ax,[ROOTCLUST_HW]
 28128 000047D6 A3[DC0A]                	mov	[DIRSTART_HW],ax
 28129 000047D9 A3[E80A]                	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],ax
 28130

 28366 000048F4 07                      	pop	es
 28367 000048F5 C3                      	retn
 28368                                  f_sfte_2:
 28369 000048F6 26034F04                	add	cx,[es:bx+4]	; SFT.SFCount ; number of entries in the table

 28371 000048FD 83FBFF                  	cmp	bx,0FFFFh ; -1	; the last SFT
 28372 00004900 75DC                    	jnz	short f_sfte_1
 28373 00004902 F9                      	stc			; (not found)

 28375 00004904 C3                      	retn

 28383                                  int_2Fh_1230h:		; Windows95 - FIND SFT ENTRY IN INTERNAL FILE TABLES
 28384 00004905 E8C7FF                  	call	find_sft_entry_number
 28385 00004908 7242                    	jc	short find_sfte_i_error
 28386 0000490A 06                      	push	es	; ax = SFT enty index number (of the requested SFT entry)
 28387 0000490B 57                      	push	di
 28388 0000490C 0E                      	push	cs
 28389 0000490D 07                      	pop	es

 28391                                  				; and used only for FCB calls

 28393                                  				;  only for fcb calls

 28396 00004916 F9                      	stc
 28397 00004917 7531                    	jnz	short sfte_i_notfound ; not found (cf=1)
 28398 00004919 8D5DFF                  	lea	bx,[di-1]	; offset of the entry in the table
 28399 0000491C 81EB[3B47]              	sub	bx,sft_fcb_table ; index into new file system table
 28400 00004920 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx
 28401 00004922 01DB                    	add	bx,bx		; 2*bx

 28415 00004945 F9                      	stc			; not found (cf=1)
 28416 00004946 EB02                    	jmp	short sfte_i_notfound
 28417

 28470                                  ;============================================================================
 28471                                  ; DIR2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 28472                                  ;============================================================================
 28473                                  ; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28474                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28475                                  ; 14/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28476                                  
 28477                                  ;	TITLE	DIR2 - Directory and path cracking
 28478                                  ;	NAME	Dir2
 28479                                  
 28480                                  ;Break	<GETPATH -- PARSE A WFP>
 28481                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28482                                  ;
 28483                                  ; Procedure Name : GETPATH
 28484                                  ;
 28485                                  ; Inputs:
 28486                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:\" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 28487                                  ;		terminated; d:/ (note forward slash) indicates a real device).
 28488                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 28489                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 28490                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 28491                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 28492                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 28493                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 28494                                  ;	[THISDPB] set to DPB if disk otherwise garbage.
 28495                                  ; Function:
 28496                                  ;	Crack the path
 28497                                  ; Outputs:
 28498                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Disk if disk file
 28499                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Unk if char device
 28500                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 28501                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 28502                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28503                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 28504                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 28505                                  ;	   Zero set
 28506                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 28507                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 28508                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 28509                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 28510                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 28511                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 28512                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 28513                                  ;	   Zero reset
 28514                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path or attribute mismatch
 28515                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 28516                                  ;	ELSE
 28517                                  ;	   [CurBuf] = -1 if root directory
 28518                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 28519                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 28520                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points into [CURBUF] to dir_first field for entry
 28521                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 28522                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 28523                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 28524                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 28525                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 28526                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 28527                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 28528                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it.
 28529                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 28530                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 28531                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 28532                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 28533                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 28534                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 28535                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 28536                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 28537                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 28538                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28539                                  
 28540                                  ;hkn; called from delete.asm, finfo.asm, mknode.asm and rename.asm.
 28541                                  ;hkn; DS already set up at this point.
 28542                                  
 28543                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28544                                  
 28545                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28546                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8B99h
 28547                                  
 28548                                  GETPATH:
 28549                                  	;mov	word [CREATING],0E500h
 28550 00004978 C706[7E05]00E5          	MOV	WORD [CREATING],DIRFREE*256+0 ; Not Creating, not DEL *.*
 28551                                  
 28552                                  ; Same as GetPath only CREATING and DELALL already set
 28553                                  
 28554                                  	;entry	GetPathNoSet
 28555                                  GetPathNoSet:
 28556                                  	;;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2
 28557                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk
 28558                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28559 0000497E E856C9                  	call	set_exerr_locus_disk
 28560                                  	;
 28561 00004981 C706[E205]FFFF          	MOV	word [CURBUF],-1	; initial setting
 28562                                  
 28563                                  ; See if the input indicates a device that has already been detected. If so,
 28564                                  ; go build the guy quickly. Otherwise, let findpath find the device.
 28565                                  
 28566 00004987 8B3E[B205]              	MOV	DI,[WFP_START]		; point to the beginning of the name
 28567                                  	;cmp	word [DI+1],5C3Ah
 28568                                  	;CMP	WORD [DI+1],'\' << 8 + ':'
 28569 0000498B 817D013A5C              	cmp	word [DI+1],':\'

 28831                                  ;Break	<ROOTPATH, FINDPATH -- PARSE A PATH>
 28832                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28833                                  ;
 28834                                  ; Procedure Name : ROOTPATH,FINDPATH
 28835                                  ;
 28836                                  ; Inputs:
 28837                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but,
 28838                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path which is assumed to start at
 28839                                  ;		the root (no leading '/').
 28840                                  ; Function:
 28841                                  ;	Search from root for path
 28842                                  ; Outputs:
 28843                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but:
 28844                                  ;	If root directory specified, [CURBUF] and [NAME1] are NOT set, and
 28845                                  ;	[NoSetDir] is ignored.
 28846                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28847                                  
 28848                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28849                                  	; DOSCODE:7F47h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28850                                  
 28851                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28852                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8C9Dh
 28853                                  
 28854                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:7F82h)
 28855                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:829Eh)
 28856                                  
 28857                                  ROOTPATH:
 28858 00004A35 E8B8FD                  	call	SETROOTSRCH
 28859                                  	; 24/09/2023
 28860 00004A38 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 28861                                  	;CMP	BYTE [SI],0
 28862 00004A3A 3824                    	cmp	[si],ah ; 0
 28863 00004A3C 7507                    	JNZ	short FINDPATH
 28864                                  
 28865                                  	;;;
 28866                                  	;; 15/02/2024
 28867                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:82A6h
 28868                                  	;mov	word [CURBUF],0FFFFh
 28869                                  	;;;
 28870                                  
 28871                                  ; Root dir specified
 28872 00004A3E A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 28873 00004A41 A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 28874                                  	; 24/09/2023
 28875                                  	;XOR	AH,AH			; Sets "device ID" byte, sets zero
 28876                                  					; (dir), clears carry.
 28877 00004A44 C3                      	retn
 28878                                  
 28879                                  ; Inputs:
 28880                                  ;	[ATTRIB] Set to get through directories
 28881                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Set to find last element
 28882                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28883                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path (no leading '/').
 28884                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 28885                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Phys sec # of first sector of directory
 28886                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Cluster # of next cluster
 28887                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors per cluster
 28888                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 28889                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 28890                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 28891                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 28892                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 28893                                  ;	[CREATING] and [DELALL] set
 28894                                  ; Function:
 28895                                  ;	Parse path name
 28896                                  ; Outputs:
 28897                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 28898                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 28899                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28900                                  ;	[THISDPB] = ES:BP
 28901                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 28902                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 28903                                  ;	   Zero set
 28904                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 28905                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 28906                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 28907                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 28908                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 28909                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 28910                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 28911                                  ;	   Zero reset
 28912                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path
 28913                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 28914                                  ;	ELSE
 28915                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 28916                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 28917                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points to fcb_FIRCLUS field for entry
 28918                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 28919                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 28920                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 28921                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 28922                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 28923                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 28924                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 28925                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it,
 28926                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 28927                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 28928                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 28929                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 28930                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 28931                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 28932                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 28933                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 28934                                  ; Destroys all other registers
 28935                                  
 28936                                  	; 11/05/2025 (MiniDOS v1.0)
 28937                                  
 28938                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28939                                  	; DOSCODE:7F58h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28940                                  
 28941                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28942                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8CAEh
 28943                                  
 28944                                      	;entry	FINDPATH
 28945                                  FINDPATH:
 28946 00004A45 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 28947 00004A46 56                      	PUSH	SI
 28948                                  	; 11/05/2025
 28949                                  	;MOV	DI,SI
 28950 00004A47 8B0E[C205]              	MOV	CX,[DIRSTART]		; Get start clus of dir being searched
 28951 00004A4B 833E[B605]FF            	CMP	word [CURR_DIR_END],-1
 28952 00004A50 7415                    	JZ	short NOIDS		; No current dir part
 28953                                  	;CMP	DI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 28954                                  	; 11/05/2025
 28955 00004A52 3B36[B605]              	cmp	si,[CURR_DIR_END] 
 28956 00004A56 750F                    	JNZ	short NOIDS		; Not to current dir end yet
 28957 00004A58 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 28958                                  	;;;
 28959                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28960 00004A5C A1[DC0A]                	mov	ax,[DIRSTART_HW]
 28961                                  	;mov	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 28962 00004A5F 2689454B                	mov	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],ax
 28963                                  	;;;
 28964                                  	;mov	[es:di+73],cx
 28965 00004A63 26894D49                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],CX	; Set current directory cluster
 28966                                  NOIDS:
 28967                                  
 28968                                  ; Parse the name off of DS:SI into NAME1. AL = 1 if there was a meta
 28969                                  ; character in the string. CX,DI may be destroyed.
 28970                                  ;
 28971                                  ;	invoke	NAMETRANS
 28972                                  ;	MOV	CL,AL
 28973                                  ;
 28974                                  ; The above is the slow method. The name has *already* been munged by
 28975                                  ; TransPath so no special casing needs to be done. All we do is try to copy
 28976                                  ; the name until ., \ or 0 is hit.
 28977                                  
 28978                                  	;MOV	AX,SS
 28979                                  	;MOV	ES,AX
 28980                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28981 00004A67 16                      	push	ss
 28982 00004A68 07                      	pop	es
 28983                                  
 28984                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 28985 00004A69 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28986                                  	;MOV	AX,'  ' ; 2020h
 28987                                  	;STOSB
 28988                                  	;STOSW
 28989                                  	;STOSW
 28990                                  	;STOSW
 28991                                  	;STOSW
 28992                                  	;STOSW
 28993                                  	; 11/05/2025 (MiniDOS)
 28994 00004A6C B020                    	mov	al, ' ' ; 20h
 28995 00004A6E B90B00                  	mov	cx, 11
 28996 00004A71 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 28997                                  
 28998                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 28999 00004A73 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 29000                                  	; 11/05/2025
 29001                                  	;XOR	AH,AH			; bits for CL
 29002                                  GetNam:
 29003                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29004                                  	;INC	CL ; ?*! ; MSDOS 6.0	;AN000; KK increment volid count
 29005                                  
 29006                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 29007                                  	; 16/12/2022
 29008                                  	;inc	cl ; not required !
 29009                                  	
 29010 00004A76 AC                      	LODSB
 29011 00004A77 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'	; 2Eh
 29012 00004A79 7412                    	JZ	short _SetExt
 29013 00004A7B 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29014 00004A7D 7424                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29015 00004A7F 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 29016 00004A81 7420                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29017 00004A83 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'	; 3Fh
 29018 00004A85 7503                    	JNZ	short StoNam
 29019                                  	;OR	AH,1
 29020                                  	; 11/05/2025
 29021 00004A87 80C901                  	or	cl, 1
 29022                                  StoNam: 
 29023 00004A8A AA                      	STOSB
 29024 00004A8B EBE9                    	JMP	short GetNam
 29025                                  _SetExt:
 29026 00004A8D BF[5305]                	MOV	DI,NAME1+8
 29027                                  GetExt:
 29028 00004A90 AC                      	LODSB
 29029 00004A91 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29030 00004A93 740E                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29031 00004A95 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 29032 00004A97 740A                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29033 00004A99 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'
 29034 00004A9B 7503                    	JNZ	short StoExt
 29035                                  	;OR	AH,1
 29036                                  	; 11/05/2025
 29037 00004A9D 80C901                  	or	cl, 1
 29038                                  StoExt: 
 29039 00004AA0 AA                      	STOSB
 29040 00004AA1 EBED                    	JMP	short GetExt
 29041                                  _GetDone:
 29042 00004AA3 4E                      	DEC	SI
 29043                                  	; 11/05/2025
 29044                                  	;MOV	CL,AH  ; 0 or 1 ; 29/12/2022
 29045 00004AA4 80C980                  	OR	CL,80H
 29046 00004AA7 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of this element
 29047 00004AA8 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 29048 00004AA9 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 29049 00004AAB 7503                    	JNZ	short check_device
 29050 00004AAD E9B500                  	JMP	_BADPATH		; NUL parse (two delims most likely)
 29051                                  check_device:
 29052 00004AB0 56                      	PUSH	SI			; Start of next element

 29373                                  ;

 29398                                  ; Inputs:
 29399                                  ;	DS,ES:DOSDATA

 29402                                  ; Function:
 29403                                  ;	Determine if file is in list of I/O drivers
 29404                                  ; Outputs:
 29405                                  ;	Carry set if not a device
 29406                                  ;	ELSE
