 33052                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33053                                  ; DOSCODE:8DC2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 33054                                  
 33055                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 33056                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset
 33057                                  
 33058                                  ;Break   <ALLOCATE -- Assign disk space>
 33059                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33060                                  ;
 33061                                  ; Procedure Name : ALLOCATE - Allocate Disk Space
 33062                                  ;
 33063                                  ;   ALLOCATE is called to allocate disk clusters. The new clusters are
 33064                                  ;   FAT-chained onto the end of the existing file.
 33065                                  ;
 33066                                  ;   The DPB contains the cluster # of the last free cluster allocated
 33067                                  ;   (dpb_next_free). We start at this cluster and scan towards higher
 33068                                  ;   numbered clusters, looking for the necessary free blocks.
 33069                                  ;
 33070                                  ;   Once again, fancy terminology gets in the way of correct coding. When
 33071                                  ;   using next_free, start scanning AT THAT POINT and not the one following it.
 33072                                  ;   This fixes the boundary condition bug when only free = next_free = 2.
 33073                                  ;
 33074                                  ;       If we get to the end of the disk without satisfaction:
 33075                                  ;
 33076                                  ;           if (dpb_next_free == 2) then we've scanned the whole disk.
 33077                                  ;               return (insufficient_disk_space)
 33078                                  ;           ELSE
 33079                                  ;               dpb_next_free = 2; start scan over from the beginning.
 33080                                  ;
 33081                                  ;   Note that there is no multitasking interlock. There is no race when
 33082                                  ;   examining the entrys in an in-core FAT block since there will be no
 33083                                  ;   context switch. When UNPACK context switches while waiting for a FAT read
 33084                                  ;   we are done with any in-core FAT blocks, so again there is no race. The
 33085                                  ;   only special concern is that V2 and V3 MSDOS left the last allocated
 33086                                  ;   cluster as "00"; marking it EOF only when the entire alloc request was
 33087                                  ;   satisfied. We can't allow another activation to think this cluster is
 33088                                  ;   free, so we give it a special temporary mark to show that it is, indeed,
 33089                                  ;   allocated.
 33090                                  ;
 33091                                  ;   Note that when we run out of space this algorithem will scan from
 33092                                  ;   dpb_next_free to the end, then scan from cluster 2 through the end,
 33093                                  ;   redundantly scanning the later part of the disk. This only happens when
 33094                                  ;   we run out of space, so sue me.
 33095                                  ;
 33096                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 33097                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 33098                                  ;                                                                          ;
 33099                                  ;   The use of FATBYT and RESTFATBYT is somewhat mysterious. Here is the
 33100                                  ;   explanation:
 33101                                  ;
 33102                                  ;   In the NUL file case (sf_firclus currently 0) ALLOCATE is called with
 33103                                  ;   entry BX = 0. What needs to be done in this case is to stuff the cluster
 33104                                  ;   number of the first cluster allocated in sf_firclus when the ALLOCATE is
 33105                                  ;   complete. THIS VALUE IS SAVED TEMPORARILY IN CLUSTER 0, HENCE THE CURRENT
 33106                                  ;   VALUE IN CLUSTER 0 MUST BE SAVED AND RESTORED. This is a side effect of
 33107                                  ;   the fact that PACK and UNPACK don't treat requests for clusters 0 and 1 as
 33108                                  ;   errors. This "stuff" is done by the call to PACK which is right before
 33109                                  ;   the
 33110                                  ;           LOOP   findfre         ; alloc more if needed
 33111                                  ;   instruction when the first cluster is allocated to the nul file. The
 33112                                  ;   value is recalled from cluster 0 and stored at sf_firclus at ads4:
 33113                                  ;
 33114                                  ;   This method is obviously useless (because it is non-reentrant) for
 33115                                  ;   multitasking, and will have to be changed. Storing the required value on
 33116                                  ;   the stack is recommended. Setting sf_firclus at the PACK of cluster 0
 33117                                  ;   (instead of actually doing the PACK) is BAD because it doesn't handle
 33118                                  ;   problems with INT 24 well.
 33119                                  ;
 33120                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 33121                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 33122                                  ;                                                                          ;
 33123                                  ;       ENTRY   BX = Last cluster of file (0 if null file)
 33124                                  ;               CX = No. of clusters to allocate
 33125                                  ;               ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 33126                                  ;               [THISSFT] = Points to SFT
 33127                                  ;
 33128                                  ;       EXIT   'C' set if insufficient space
 33129                                  ;                [FAILERR] can be tested to see the reason for failure
 33130                                  ;                CX = max. no. of clusters that could be added to file
 33131                                  ;              'C' clear if space allocated
 33132                                  ;                BX = First cluster allocated
 33133                                  ;                FAT is fully updated
 33134                                  ;                sf_FIRCLUS field of SFT set if file was null
 33135                                  ;
 33136                                  ;       USES    ALL but SI, BP
 33137                                  
 33138                                  ;callmagic  proc near
 33139                                  ;       push    ds                             ;push segment of routine 
 33140                                  ;       push    Offset MagicPatch              ;push offset for routine
 33141                                  ;       retf                                   ;simulate jmp far
 33142                                  ;                                              ;far return address is on
 33143                                  ;                                              ;stack, so far return from
 33144                                  ;                                              ;call will return this routine
 33145                                  ;callmagic  endp
 33146                                  
 33147                                  ; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33148                                  ;PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9AC5h
 33149                                  
 33150                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8DC2h)
 33151                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C078h)
 33152                                  
 33153                                  ; 07/03/2025
 33154                                  ; 25/09/2023
 33155                                  %if 0	; 27/02/2024
 33156                                  callmagic:
 33157                                  	push	ds
 33158                                  	push	word [ss:OffsetMagicPatch]
 33159                                  	retf	
 33160                                  %endif
 33161

 33766                                  ; 16/12/2022
 33767                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 33768                                  ;RELEASE_flush:
 33769 0000581F C3                      	retn
 33770                                  
 33771                                  ;Break	<RELEASE -- DEASSIGN DISK SPACE>
 33772                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33773                                  ;
 33774                                  ; Procedure Name : RELEASE
 33775                                  ;
 33776                                  ; Inputs:
 33777                                  ;       BX = Cluster in file
 33778                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 33779                                  ; Function:
 33780                                  ;       Frees cluster chain starting with [BX]
 33781                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 33782                                  ; AX,BX,DX,DI all destroyed. Other registers unchanged.
 33783                                  ;
 33784                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33785                                  
 33786                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33787                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D13h
 33788                                  
 33789                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8E86h)
 33790                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C27Fh)
 33791                                  
 33792                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33793                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33794                                  RELEASE:
 33795 00005820 31D2                            XOR     DX,DX
 33796                                  	
 33797                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33798                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33799                                  	;;;
 33800 00005822 8916[EA0A]              	mov	[CLUSDATA_HW],dx ; (dx = 0, release)
 33801                                  	;;;
 33802                                  
 33803                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D19h
 33804                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8E88h)
 33805                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C285h)
 33806                                  
 33807                                  	;entry	RELBLKS
 33808                                  RELBLKS:
 33809                                  
 33810                                  ;   Enter here with DX=0FFFFH to put an end-of-file mark in the first cluster
 33811                                  ;   and free the rest in the chain.
 33812                                  
 33813 00005826 E80807                  	call	UNPACK
 33814                                  	;jc	short RELEASE_flush
 33815                                  	;jz	short RELEASE_flush
 33816                                  	; 28/12/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33817 00005829 7652                            jbe	short RET12 ; jna short RET12
 33818                                  				; CCONTENT_HW:DI= Content of FAT
 33819                                   				; for given cluster (next cluster)
 33820 0000582B 89F8                    	MOV     AX,DI
 33821 0000582D 52                              PUSH    DX
 33822                                  
 33823                                  	;;; 28/12/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33824                                  	;push	ax
 33825                                  	;;;
 33826                                  
 33827 0000582E E8AF07                  	call	PACK
 33828                                  
 33829                                  	;;; 28/12/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33830                                  	;pop	ax
 33831 00005831 8B16[EC0A]              	mov	dx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 33832 00005835 8916[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],dx ; next cluster (hw) to be released
 33833 00005839 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax		 ; next cluster (lw) to be released
 33834                                  	;;;
 33835                                          
 33836 0000583B 5A                      	POP     DX
 33837                                  	;jc	short RELEASE_flush
 33838                                  	; 28/12/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33839 0000583C 723F                    	jc	short RET12
 33840                                          
 33841 0000583E 09D2                    	OR      DX,DX
 33842 00005840 751F                            JNZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; Was putting EOF mark
 33843                                  
 33844                                  ; 28/02/2024
 33845                                  %if 0
 33846                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 33847                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 33848                                  	CMP     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 33849                                          JZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; No
 33850                                          INC	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 33851                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 33852                                          MOV     BX,AX
 33853                                          dec     ax              	; check for "1"
 33854                                  	jz	short RELEASE_flush	; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 33855                                  %else
 33856                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33857                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33858                                  	;;;
 33859 00005842 3B16[EA0A]              	cmp	dx,[CLUSDATA_HW]	; > 0 ? (delete, release)
 33860 00005846 7519                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC	; no, EOF (allocate, -1), (dx = 0)
 33861                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh
 33862 00005848 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 33863                                  					; Free count valid?
 33864 0000584D 7412                    	jz	short NO_DEALLOC	; No (dx = 0)
 33865                                  relblks_ifc:
 33866                                  	;inc	word ptr es:[bp+1Fh]
 33867 0000584F 26FF461F                	inc	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 33868 00005853 7519                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2
 33869                                  
 33870                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 33871 00005855 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx
 33872 00005859 7513                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2	; not FAT32
 33873                                  
 33874                                  	;inc	word [es:bp+21h]
 33875 0000585B 26FF4621                	inc	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2]
 33876 0000585F EB0D                    	jmp	short NO_DEALLOC2
 33877                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 33878                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 33879 00005861 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx	; dx is -1 or 0
 33880                                  					; (valid 16 bit fat size is another number)
 33881 00005865 7507                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2 ; FAT (FAT16 or FAT12)
 33882                                  					; dx = 0, FAT32
 33883                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh
 33884 00005867 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2],0FFFFh
 33885 0000586C 75E1                    	jnz	short relblks_ifc
 33886                                  NO_DEALLOC2:
 33887 0000586E 833E[E80A]00            	cmp	word [CLUSTNUM_HW],0
 33888 00005873 7503                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC3
 33889 00005875 48                      	dec	ax			; check for "1"	
 33890 00005876 7405                    	jz	short RET12		; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 33891                                  NO_DEALLOC3:
 33892                                  	;;;
 33893                                  %endif
 33894                                  
 33895 00005878 E88D06                  	call	IsEOF
 33896 0000587B 72A3                            JB	short RELEASE	; Carry clear if JMP not taken
 33897                                  
 33898                                  	; 16/12/2022
 33899                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 33900                                  ; 28/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33901                                  %if 0
 33902                                  RELEASE_flush:
 33903                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33904                                  	mov	al,[es:bp]
 33905                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 33906                                  	push	si		; FLUSHBUF may trash these and we guarantee
 33907                                  	push	cx		;  them to be preserved.
 33908                                  	push	es
 33909                                  	push	bp
 33910                                  	call	FLUSHBUF	; commit buffers for this drive
 33911                                  	pop	bp
 33912                                  	pop	es
 33913                                  	pop	cx
 33914                                  	pop	si
 33915                                  %endif		; 28/02/2024
 33916                                  
 33917                                  RET12:
 33918 0000587D C3                      	retn
 33919                                  
 33920                                  ;Break	<GETEOF -- Find the end of a file>
 33921                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33922                                  ;
 33923                                  ; Procedure Name : GETEOF
 33924                                  ;
 33925                                  ; Inputs:
 33926                                  ;       ES:BP Points to DPB
 33927                                  ;       BX = Cluster in a file
 33928                                  ;       DS = CS
 33929                                  ; Outputs:
 33930                                  ;       BX = Last cluster in the file
 33931                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 33932                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 33933                                  ;
 33934                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33935                                  
 33936                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33937                                  %if 0
 33938                                  GETEOF:
 33939                                  	call	UNPACK
 33940                                          jc	short RET12
 33941                                          PUSH    BX
 33942                                          MOV     BX,DI
 33943                                  	call	IsEOF
 33944                                          POP     BX
 33945                                          JAE     short RET12
 33946                                          MOV     BX,DI
 33947                                          JMP     short GETEOF
 33948                                  %else
 33949                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33950                                  	;;;
 33951                                  GETEOF4:	; **
 33952 0000587E 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 33953                                  GETEOF1:
 33954 00005882 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 33955 00005884 8916[F20A]              	mov	[CLUSTERS_HW],dx ; CLUSTERS_HW:DI = Cluster Count
 33956 00005888 58                      	pop	ax
 33957 00005889 5A                      	pop	dx
 33958 0000588A C3                      	retn
 33959                                  
 33960                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D7Ch
 33961                                  GETEOF:
 33962 0000588B 52                      	push	dx
 33963 0000588C 50                      	push	ax
 33964 0000588D 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx ; 0	; cluster count = 0
 33965 0000588F 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 33966                                  GETEOF2:
 33967 00005891 E89D06                  	call	UNPACK
 33968 00005894 72EC                    	jc	short GETEOF1
 33969                                  		; CCONTENT_HW:DI = next cluster (cluster content)
 33970 00005896 40                      	inc	ax
 33971 00005897 7501                    	jnz	short GETEOF3
 33972 00005899 42                      	inc	dx
 33973                                  GETEOF3:
 33974 0000589A FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 33975 0000589E 53                      	push    bx
 33976                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33977 0000589F 8B1E[EC0A]              	mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 33978 000058A3 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 33979 000058A7 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 33980 000058A9 E85C06                  	call	IsEOF
 33981                                  	;pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 33982 000058AC 5B                      	pop	bx
 33983                                  	;jae	short GETEOF1   ; EOF
 33984 000058AD 73CF                    	jae	short GETEOF4 ; ** ; 28/02/2024
 33985                                  	;mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW] ; not EOF
 33986                                  	;mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 33987 000058AF 5B                      	pop	bx	; * ; 28/02/2024
 33988 000058B0 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 33989 000058B2 EBDD                    	jmp	short GETEOF2   ; get next cluster
 33990                                  	;;;
 33991                                  %endif

 34031                                  ;
 34032                                  ; Procedure : MakeFcb
 34033                                  ;
 34034                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34035                                  
 34036                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34037                                  	; DOSCODE:8E77h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34038                                  
 34039                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34040                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9DB0h
 34041                                  
 34042                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8ED3h)
 34043                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:8D92h)
 34044                                  
 34045                                  MAKEFCB:
 34046                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34047                                  	;MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0
 34048 000058B4 30D2                    	XOR	DL,DL		; Flag--not ambiguous file name
 34049                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34050 000058B6 368816[4E03]            	mov	[ss:SpaceFlag],dl ; 0
 34051                                  	;test	al,2
 34052 000058BB A802                    	test	AL,DRVBIT	; Use current drive field if default?
 34053 000058BD 7503                    	JNZ	short DEFDRV
 34054                                  	;MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0	; No - use default drive
 34055                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34056 000058BF 268815                  	mov	[es:di],dl ; 0
 34057                                  DEFDRV:
 34058 000058C2 47                      	INC	DI
 34059 000058C3 B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 34060                                  	;test	al,4
 34061 000058C6 A804                    	test	AL,NAMBIT	; Use current name fields as default?
 34062 000058C8 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX		; Save bits in BX
 34063 000058C9 B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 34064 000058CB 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB	; If not, go fill with blanks
 34065 000058CD 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34066 000058CF 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX		; Don't fill any
 34067                                  FILLB:
 34068 000058D1 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34069 000058D3 B103                    	MOV	CL,3
 34070 000058D5 F6C308                  	test	BL,EXTBIT	; Use current extension as default
 34071 000058D8 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB2
 34072 000058DA 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34073 000058DC 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX
 34074                                  FILLB2:
 34075 000058DE F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34076 000058E0 91                      	XCHG	AX,CX		; Put zero in AX
 34077 000058E1 AB                      	STOSW
 34078 000058E2 AB                      	STOSW			; Initialize two words after to zero
 34079 000058E3 83EF10                  	SUB	DI,16		; Point back at start
 34080                                  	;test	bl,1
 34081 000058E6 F6C301                  	test	BL,SCANSEPARATOR; Scan off separators if not zero
 34082 000058E9 7409                    	JZ	short SKPSPC
 34083 000058EB E88800                  	CALL	SCANB		; Peel off blanks and tabs
 34084 000058EE E81E01                  	CALL	DELIM		; Is it a one-time-only delimiter?
 34085 000058F1 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSCAN
 34086 000058F3 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over the delimiter
 34087                                  SKPSPC:
 34088 000058F4 E87F00                  	CALL	SCANB		; Always kill preceding blanks and tabs
 34089                                  NOSCAN:
 34090 000058F7 E8EC00                  	CALL	GETLET
 34091 000058FA 761E                    	JBE	short NODRV	; Quit if termination character
 34092 000058FC 803C3A                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],":"	; Check for potential drive specifier
 34093 000058FF 7519                    	JNZ	short NODRV
 34094 00005901 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over colon
 34095 00005902 2C40                    	SUB	AL,"@"          ; Convert drive letter to drive number (A=1)
 34096 00005904 760F                    	JBE	short BADDRV	; Drive letter out of range
 34097                                  
 34098 00005906 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34099 00005907 E8961E                  	call	GetVisDrv
 34100 0000590A 58                      	POP	AX
 34101 0000590B 730A                    	JNC	short HAVDRV
 34102                                  
 34103                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34104                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34105                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34106 0000590D 36803E[1006]1A          	CMP	byte [SS:DrvErr],error_not_DOS_disk ; 1Ah
 34107                                  					; if not FAT drive ;AN000;
 34108 00005913 7402                    	JZ	short HAVDRV		; assume ok	   ;AN000;
 34109                                  BADDRV:
 34110 00005915 B2FF                    	MOV	DL,-1
 34111                                  HAVDRV:
 34112 00005917 AA                      	STOSB			; Put drive specifier in first byte
 34113 00005918 46                      	INC	SI
 34114 00005919 4F                      	DEC	DI		; Counteract next two instructions
 34115                                  NODRV:
 34116 0000591A 4E                      	DEC	SI		; Back up
 34117 0000591B 47                      	INC	DI		; Skip drive byte
 34118                                  
 34119                                  	;entry	NORMSCAN
 34120                                  NORMSCAN:
 34121 0000591C B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 34122 0000591F E82200                  	CALL	GETWORD 	; Get 8-letter file name
 34123 00005922 803C2E                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],"."
 34124 00005925 7510                    	JNZ	short NODOT
 34125 00005927 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over dot if present
 34126                                  
 34127                                  	; 24/09/2023
 34128                                  	;mov	cx,3
 34129 00005928 B103                    	mov	cl,3	; ch=0
 34130                                  
 34131                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34132                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34133                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],DBCS_VOLID2 ; 100h ;AN000;
 34134                                  	; 10/06/2019
 34135 0000592A 36F606[1206]01          	test	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(DBCS_VOLID2>>8) ; 1
 34136 00005930 7402                    	JZ	short VOLOK				;AN000;
 34137 00005932 A4                      	MOVSB			; 2nd byte of DBCS	;AN000;
 34138                                  	; 24/09/2023
 34139                                  	;MOV	CX,2					;AN000;
 34140 00005933 49                      	dec	cx  ; cx=2
 34141                                  	;JMP	SHORT contvol				;AN000;
 34142                                  VOLOK:
 34143                                  	;MOV	CX,3		; Get 3-letter extension
 34144                                  contvol:
 34145 00005934 E81300                  	CALL	MUSTGETWORD
 34146                                  NODOT:
 34147 00005937 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL
 34148                                  
 34149                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34150                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],0FEFFh
 34151                                  	; 18/12/2022
 34152 00005939 368026[1206]FE          	and	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],0FEh ; (~DBCS_VOLID2)>>8

 34154                                  
 34155 0000593F C3                      	retn
 34156                                  
 34157                                  NONAM:
 34158 00005940 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34159 00005942 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34160 00005943 C3                      	retn
 34161

 34163 00005944 E89F00                  	CALL	GETLET

 34165 00005949 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34166

 34168                                  ;	If the name we are scanning is longer than CX, we keep on reading!
 34169                                  
 34170                                  MUSTGETWORD:
 34171 0000594A E89900                  	CALL	GETLET
 34172                                  
 34173                                  ;	If spaceFlag is set then we allow spaces in a pathname
 34174                                  
 34175                                  ;IF NOT TABLELOOK
 34176                                  ;	JB	short FILLNAM  ; MSDOS 3.3
 34177                                  ;ENDIF
 34178 0000594D 750C                    	JNZ	short MustCheckCX
 34179                                  
 34180                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34181 0000594F 36F606[4E03]FF          	test	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0FFh

 34204

 34210                                  scanb_retn:

 34213                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34214                                  ;
 34215                                  ; Procedure Name : NameTrans
 34216                                  ;
 34217                                  ; NameTrans is used by FindPath to scan off an element of a path. We must
 34218                                  ; allow spaces in pathnames
 34219                                  ;
 34220                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI points to start of path element
 34221                                  ;   Outputs:	Name1 has unpacked name, uppercased
 34222                                  ;		ES = DOSGroup
 34223                                  ;		DS:SI advanced after name
 34224                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AX,DX,CX
 34225                                  ;
 34226                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34227                                  
 34228                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34229                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34230                                  
 34231                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34232                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9E7Ch
 34233                                  
 34234                                  NameTrans:
 34235                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34236 0000597E 36C606[4E03]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],1
 34237 00005984 16                      	push	ss
 34238 00005985 07                      	pop	es
 34239                                  
 34240                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 34241 00005986 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 34242 00005989 57                      	PUSH	DI
 34243                                  
 34244                                  ; 29/02/2024
 34245                                  %if 0
 34246                                  	MOV	AX,'  '	; 2020h
 34247                                  	MOV	CX,5
 34248                                  	STOSB
 34249                                  	REP	STOSW		; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 34250                                  	XOR	AL,AL		; Set stuff for NORMSCAN
 34251                                  	MOV	DL,AL
 34252                                  %else
 34253                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34254                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34255                                  	;;;
 34256 0000598A B020                    	mov     al, 20h ; ' '
 34257 0000598C B90B00                  	mov     cx, 11
 34258 0000598F F3AA                    	rep stosb               ; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 34259 00005991 91                      	xchg    ax, cx
 34260 00005992 99                      	cwd
 34261                                  	;;;
 34262                                  %endif
 34263                                  
 34264 00005993 AA                      	STOSB
 34265 00005994 5F                      	POP	DI
 34266                                  
 34267 00005995 E884FF                  	CALL	NORMSCAN

 34277                                  
 34278                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34279                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34280                                  
 34281                                  ;If TableLook
 34282                                  
 34283                                  ;hkn; Table	SEGMENT
 34284                                  ;	PUBLIC	CharType
 34285                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34286                                  
 34287                                  ; Character type table for file name scanning
 34288                                  ; Table provides a mapping of characters to validity bits.
 34289                                  ; Four bits are provided for each character. Values 7Dh and above
 34290                                  ; have all bits set, so that part of the table is chopped off, and
 34291                                  ; the translation routine is responsible for screening these values.
 34292                                  ; The bit values are defined in DOSSYM.INC
 34293                                  
 34294                                  ;	      ; ^A and NUL
 34295                                  ;CharType:
 34296                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34297                                  ;	      ; ^C and ^B
 34298                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34299                                  ;	      ; ^E and ^D
 34300                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34301                                  ;	      ; ^G and ^F
 34302                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34303                                  ;	      ; TAB and BS
 34304                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34305                                  ;	      ; ^K and ^J
 34306                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34307                                  ;	      ; ^M and ^L
 34308                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34309                                  ;	      ; ^O and ^N
 34310                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34311                                  ;	      ; ^Q and ^P
 34312                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34313                                  ;	      ; ^S and ^R
 34314                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34315                                  ;	      ; ^U and ^T
 34316                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34317                                  ;	      ; ^W and ^V
 34318                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34319                                  ;	      ; ^Y and ^X
 34320                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34321                                  ;	      ; ESC and ^Z
 34322                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34323                                  ;	      ; ^] and ^;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34325                                  ;	      ; ^_ and ^^
 34326                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34327                                  ;	      ; ! and SPACE
 34328                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK)
 34329                                  ;	      ; # and "
 34330                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK)
 34331                                  ;	      ; $ - )
 34332                                  ;	 db   3 dup (0FFh)
 34333                                  ;	      ; + and *
 34334                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 34335                                  ;	      ; - and '
 34336                                  ;	 db   NOT (FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM)
 34337                                  ;	      ; / and .
 34338                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34339                                  ;	      ; 0 - 9
 34340                                  ;	 db   5 dup (0FFh)
 34341                                  ;	      ; ; and :
 34342                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 34343                                  ;	      ; = and <
 34344                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 34345                                  ;	      ; ? and >
 34346                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 34347                                  ;	      ; A - Z
 34348                                  ;	 db   13 dup (0FFh)
 34349                                  ;	      ; \ and [
 34350                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 34351                                  ;	      ; ^ and ]
 34352                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34353                                  ;	      ; _ - {
 34354                                  ;	 db   15 dup (0FFh)
 34355                                  ;	      ; } and |
 34356                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 34357                                  
 34358                                  ;CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2	; This is the value of the last
 34359                                  ;					; character in the table
 34360                                  
 34361                                  ;FCHK	equ 1		; normal name char, no chks needed
 34362                                  ;FDELIM	equ 2		; is a delimiter
 34363                                  ;FSPCHK	equ 4		; set if character is not a space or equivalent
 34364                                  ;FFCB	equ 8		; is valid in an FCB
 34365                                  
 34366                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34367                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34368                                  ; DOSCODE:8F76h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34369                                  
 34370                                  CharType: ; 63 bytes
 34371 000059A7 6666666606666666                db  66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 06h, 66h, 66h, 66h ; 0-7
 34372 000059AF 6666666666666666        	db  66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h ; 8-15
 34373 000059B7 F8F6FFFFFF4FF46E        	db 0F8h,0F6h,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 4Fh,0F4h, 6Eh ; 16-23
 34374 000059BF FFFFFFFFFF4444F4        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 44h, 44h,0F4h ; 24-31
 34375 000059C7 FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh ; 32-39
 34376 000059CF FFFFFFFFFF6F66FF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 6Fh, 66h,0FFh ; 40-47
 34377 000059D7 FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh ; 48-55
 34378 000059DF FFFFFFFFFFFFF4          	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F4h	   ; 56-62
 34379                                  
 34380                                  CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2
 34381

 34383                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 34385                                  ;       db 0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h

 34422                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34423                                  ; DOSCODE:9011h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34424                                  
 34425                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34426                                  ; DOSCODE:8FB5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34427                                  
 34428                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34429                                  ;
 34430                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 34431                                  ;
 34432                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 34433                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 34434                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 34435                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 34436                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 34437                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 34438                                  ;
 34439                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 34440                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 34441                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 34442                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 34443                                  ;
 34444                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 34445                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 34446                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 34447                                  ;
 34448                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34449                                  
 34450                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 34451                                  
 34452                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5517h
 34453                                  GETLET:	
 34454 000059E6 AC                      	LODSB
 34455                                  
 34456                                  ; This entry point has character in AL
 34457                                  
 34458                                  	;entry	UCase
 34459                                  UCase:	
 34460                                  	; 09/08/2018
 34461                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5518h
 34462                                  _UCase:
 34463 000059E7 53                      	PUSH	BX
 34464 000059E8 BB[7E0B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2
 34465                                  
 34466                                  ; Convert the character in AL to upper case
 34467                                  
 34468                                  gl_0:
 34469 000059EB 3C61                    	CMP	AL,"a"
 34470 000059ED 7214                    	JB	short gl_2	; Already upper case, go check type
 34471 000059EF 3C7A                    	CMP	AL,"z"
 34472 000059F1 7702                    	JA	short gl_1
 34473 000059F3 2C20                    	SUB	AL,20H		; Convert to upper case
 34474                                  
 34475                                  ; Map European character to upper case
 34476                                  
 34477                                  gl_1:
 34478 000059F5 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80H
 34479 000059F7 720A                    	JB	short gl_2	; Not EuroChar, go check type
 34480 000059F9 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80H		; translate to upper case with this index
 34481                                  
 34482                                  	; M048 - Start 
 34483                                  	; Lantastic call Ucase thru int 2f without setting SS to DOSDATA.
 34484                                  	; So we shall set up DS and to access FILE_UCASE_TAB in BX and also 
 34485                                  	; preserve it.
 34486                                  
 34487                                  	; 09/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34488                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34489                                  	;;XLAT	BYTE [CS:BX]	; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 34490                                  	;CS	XLAT
 34491                                  
 34492                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34493                                  
 34494                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34495 000059FB 1E                      	push	ds
 34496                                  	;getdseg <ds>
 34497 000059FC 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 34498 00005A01 D7                      	XLAT			; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 34499 00005A02 1F                      	pop	ds
 34500                                  
 34501                                  	; M048 - End
 34502                                  
 34503                                  ; Now check the type
 34504                                  
 34505                                  ;If TableLook
 34506                                  gl_2:
 34507                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34508 00005A03 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34509                                  
 34510                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34511                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 34512                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 34513                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 34514                                  	;cs	xlat	
 34515                                  	
 34516                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34517 00005A04 E81800                  	CALL	GetCharType	; returns type flags in AL
 34518                                  	
 34519                                  	;test	al,1	
 34520 00005A07 A801                    	TEST	AL,FCHK 	; test for normal character
 34521 00005A09 58                      	POP	AX
 34522                                  
 34523 00005A0A 5B                      	POP	BX
 34524 00005A0B C3                      	RETN
 34525                                  
 34526                                  ; This entry has character in AL and lookup table in BX
 34527                                  
 34528                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34529                                  ;	;entry GetLet3
 34530                                  GETLET3: ; 10/08/2018
 34531 00005A0C 53                      	PUSH	BX
 34532 00005A0D EBDC                    	JMP	short gl_0
 34533                                  ;ELSE
 34534                                  ;
 34535                                  ;gl_2:
 34536                                  ;	POP	BX
 34537                                  ;	CMP	AL,"."
 34538                                  ;	retz
 34539                                  ;	CMP	AL,'"'
 34540                                  ;	retz
 34541                                  ;	CALL	PATHCHRCMP
 34542                                  ;	retz
 34543                                  ;	CMP	AL,"["
 34544                                  ;	retz
 34545                                  ;	CMP	AL,"]"
 34546                                  ;	retz
 34547                                  ;ENDIF
 34548                                  
 34549                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------
 34550                                  ;
 34551                                  ; DELIM - check if character is a delimiter
 34552                                  ;	Entry : AX = character to check
 34553                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is not a delimiter
 34554                                  ;	Uses  : Flags
 34555                                  ;
 34556                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
 34557                                  
 34558                                  	;entry	DELIM
 34559                                  DELIM:
 34560                                  ;IF TableLook
 34561                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34562 00005A0F 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34563                                  
 34564                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34565                                  	;push	bx
 34566                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 34567                                  	;;09/08/2018
 34568                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 34569                                  	;cs	xlat
 34570                                  	;pop	bx
 34571                                  
 34572                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34573 00005A10 E80C00                  	CALL	GetCharType
 34574                                  	
 34575                                  	;test	al,2
 34576 00005A13 A802                    	TEST	AL,FDELIM
 34577 00005A15 58                      	POP	AX
 34578 00005A16 C3                      	RETN
 34579                                  ;ELSE
 34580                                  ;	CMP	AL,":"
 34581                                  ;	retz
 34582                                  ;
 34583                                  ;	CMP	AL,"<"
 34584                                  ;	retz
 34585                                  ;	CMP	AL,"|"
 34586                                  ;	retz
 34587                                  ;	CMP	AL,">"
 34588                                  ;	retz
 34589                                  ;
 34590                                  ;	CMP	AL,"+"
 34591                                  ;	retz
 34592                                  ;	CMP	AL,"="
 34593                                  ;	retz
 34594                                  ;	CMP	AL,";"
 34595                                  ;	retz
 34596                                  ;	CMP	AL,","
 34597                                  ;	retz
 34598                                  ;ENDIF
 34599                                  
 34600                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34601                                  ;
 34602                                  ;  SPCHK - checks to see if a character is a space or equivalent
 34603                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to check
 34604                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is a space
 34605                                  ;	Uses  : flags
 34606                                  ;
 34607                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34608                                  
 34609                                  	;entry SPCHK
 34610                                  SPCHK:
 34611                                  ;IF TableLook
 34612                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34613 00005A17 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34614                                  
 34615                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34616                                  	;push	bx
 34617                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 34618                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 34619                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 34620                                  	;cs	xlat
 34621                                  	;pop	bx
 34622                                  
 34623                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34624 00005A18 E80400                  	CALL	GetCharType
 34625                                  	
 34626                                  	;test	al,4
 34627 00005A1B A804                    	TEST	AL,FSPCHK
 34628 00005A1D 58                      	POP	AX
 34629 00005A1E C3                      	RETN
 34630                                  ;ELSE
 34631                                  ;	CMP	AL,9		; Filter out tabs too
 34632                                  ;	retz
 34633                                  ;; WARNING! " " MUST be the last compare
 34634                                  ;	CMP	AL," "
 34635                                  ;	return
 34636                                  ;ENDIF
 34637                                  
 34638                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34639                                  ;
 34640                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 34641                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 34642                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 34643                                  ;
 34644                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 34645                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 34646                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 34647                                  ;
 34648                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34649                                  
 34650                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34651                                  
 34652                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34653                                  
 34654                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34655                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34656                                  
 34657                                  GetCharType:
 34658                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 34659 00005A1F 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 34660 00005A21 7314                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 34661                                  
 34662 00005A23 53                      	push	bx
 34663 00005A24 BB[A759]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 34664 00005A27 D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 34665                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 34666 00005A29 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 34667 00005A2B 5B                      	pop	bx
 34668                                  
 34669                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 34670                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 34671                                  
 34672 00005A2C 7306                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 34673                                  
 34674                                  ; 29/02/2024
 34675                                  %if 0
 34676                                  	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 34677                                  	shr	al,1
 34678                                  	shr	al,1
 34679                                  	shr	al,1
 34680                                  %else
 34681                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34682                                  	;;;
 34683 00005A2E 51                      	push	cx
 34684 00005A2F B104                    	mov	cl,4			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 34685 00005A31 D2E8                    	shr	al,cl
 34686 00005A33 59                      	pop	cx
 34687                                  	;;;
 34688                                  %endif
 34689                                  
 34690                                  gct_80:
 34691 00005A34 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 34692 00005A36 C3                      	retn
 34693                                  gct_90:
 34694 00005A37 B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 34695 00005A39 C3                      	retn
 34696                                  
 34697                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34698                                  ;
 34699                                  ; Procedure : PATHCHRCMP
 34700                                  ;
 34701                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34702                                  
 34703                                  PATHCHRCMP:
 34704 00005A3A 3C2F                    	CMP	AL,'/'
 34705 00005A3C 7606                    	JBE	short PathRet
 34706 00005A3E 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 34707 00005A40 C3                      	retn
 34708                                  GotFor:
 34709 00005A41 B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 34710 00005A43 C3                      	retn
 34711                                  PathRet:
 34712 00005A44 74FB                    	JZ	short GotFor
 34713 00005A46 C3                      	retn

 34724                                  ;**	MSCTRLC.ASM - ^C and error handler for MSDOS
 34725                                  
 34726                                  ;	TITLE	Control C detection, Hard error and EXIT routines
 34727                                  ;	NAME	IBMCTRLC
 34728                                  
 34729                                  ;**	Low level routines for detecting special characters on CON input,
 34730                                  ;	the ^C exit/int code, the Hard error INT 24 code, the
 34731                                  ;	process termination code, and the INT 0 divide overflow handler.
 34732                                  ;
 34733                                  ;	FATAL
 34734                                  ;	FATAL1
 34735                                  ;	reset_environment
 34736                                  ;	DSKSTATCHK
 34737                                  ;	SPOOLINT
 34738                                  ;	STATCHK
 34739                                  ;	CNTCHAND
 34740                                  ;	DIVOV
 34741                                  ;	CHARHARD
 34742                                  ;	HardErr
 34743                                  ;
 34744                                  ;	Revision history:
 34745                                  ;
 34746                                  ;	    AN000	version 4.0   Jan 1988
 34747                                  ;	    A002	PTM    -- dir >lpt3 hangs
 34748                                  ;	    A003	PTM 3957- fake version for IBMCAHE.COM
 34749                                  ;
 34750                                  ; 	M011: NEC's 8086 clone chip uses Intel's undocumented bit number in
 34751                                  ;	      flags register. In order to return to user normally DOS used to
 34752                                  ;	      move F202 into flags, which sets bit number 1 in flags uncondit-
 34753                                  ;	      ionally. Now it is modified to maintain the state of bit 1.
 34754                                  ;
 34755                                  ; 	M024: suppressed fail and ignore options if not in the middle of int 
 34756                                  ;	      24 and if Ctrl P or ctrl printscrn is pressed in routine 
 34757                                  ;	      charhard.
 34758

 35064                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35065                                  ;
 35066                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 35067                                  ;
 35068                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 35069                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 35070                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 35071                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 35072                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 35073                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 35074                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 35075                                  ; is simulated.
 35076                                  ;
 35077                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35078                                  
 35079                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 35080                                  
 35081                                  CNTCHAND:
 35082                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 35083                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 35084                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 35085                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35086                                  
 35087                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35088                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:91C4h, 29/12/2022)
 35089 00005B8F 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 35090 00005B95 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35091                                  
 35092 00005B97 B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 35093 00005B99 E8DFC0                          CALL	BUFOUT
 35094 00005B9C E874BF                          CALL	CRLF
 35095                                  around_deadlock:
 35096 00005B9F 16                              PUSH    SS
 35097 00005BA0 1F                              POP     DS
 35098 00005BA1 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 35099 00005BA6 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 35100 00005BA8 E837DE                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 35101                                  NOSWAP:
 35102 00005BAB FA                      	CLI				; Prepare to play with stack
 35103 00005BAC 8E16[8605]              	MOV	SS,[USER_SS]		; User stack now restored
 35104 00005BB0 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]
 35105 00005BB4 E89EA8                          CALL	restore_world       ; User registers now restored
 35106                                  
 35107                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
 35108                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56ACh)
 35109                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 35110                                  	;MOV	BYTE [CS:INDOS],0	
 35111                                          ;MOV	BYTE [CS:ERRORMODE],0
 35112                                          ;MOV	[CS:ConC_Spsave],SP
 35113                                  	;clc	;30/07/2018
 35114                                          ;INT	int_ctrl_c ; 23h    ; Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35115                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 35116                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 35117                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 35118                                  			; else
 35119                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 35120                                  
 35121                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35122                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS,91ECh) 
 35123                                  
 35124                                  	; CS was used to address these variables. We have to use DOSDATA
 35125                                  	
 35126 00005BB7 07                      	pop	es ; *	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:91ECh)
 35127                                  			; (pop es, after 'call restore_world')	
 35128 00005BB8 1E                      	push	ds
 35129                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 35130 00005BB9 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35131 00005BBE C606[2103]00            	mov	byte [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 35132                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35133                                  	;;;
 35134 00005BC3 C606[C011]00            	mov	byte [INDOS_FLAG],0	; 2nd 'in dos' flag (what for?)
 35135                                  	;;;
 35136 00005BC8 C606[2003]00            	mov	byte [ERRORMODE],0
 35137 00005BCD 8926[3203]              	mov	[ConC_Spsave],SP	; save his SP
 35138                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it
 35139 00005BD1 8306[3203]02            	add	word [ConC_Spsave],2
 35140                                  
 35141 00005BD6 803E[660D]00            	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 35142 00005BDB 1F                       	pop	ds	; restore ds
 35143 00005BDC 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 35144 00005BDE F8                      	CLC				
 35145 00005BDF CD23                    	INT	int_ctrl_c  ; int 23h	; N: Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35146 00005BE1 EB06                    	jmp	short ctrlc_ret_addr
 35147                                  
 35148                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35149                                  do_low_int23:
 35150 00005BE3 F8                      	clc
 35151 00005BE4 2EFF1E[475A]            	call	far [cs:LowInt23Addr]
 35152                                  
 35153                                  	; 30/07/2018 
 35154                                  
 35155                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56C0h)
 35156                                  
 35157                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 35158                                  ;
 35159                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 35160                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 35161                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit
 35162                                  ;
 35163                                  ; User's may RETURN to us and leave interrupts on. 
 35164                                  ; Turn 'em off just to be sure
 35165                                  
 35166                                  ctrlc_ret_addr: ; 05/05/2019
 35167                                  
 35168 00005BE9 FA                      	CLI
 35169                                  
 35170                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 
 35171                                  	;MOV	[CS:USER_IN_AX],ax	; save the AX
 35172                                  	;PUSHF				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 35173                                  	;POP	AX
 35174                                  
 35175                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35176                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35177                                  
 35178                                  	; We have to use DOSDATA for these variables. Previously CS was used 
 35179                                  
 35180 00005BEA 50                      	push	ax
 35181 00005BEB 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 35182                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 35183 00005BED 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35184 00005BF2 A3[630D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
 35185 00005BF5 58                      	pop	ax
 35186 00005BF6 A3[3A03]                	MOV	[USER_IN_AX],ax		; save the AX
 35187 00005BF9 9C                      	pushf				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 35188 00005BFA 58                      	pop	ax
 35189                                  
 35190                                  ; See if the input stack is identical to the output stack
 35191                                  
 35192                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35193                                  	;CMP	SP,[CS:ConC_Spsave]
 35194                                  	;JNZ	SHORT ctrlc_try_new	; current SP not the same as saved SP
 35195                                  
 35196                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35197 00005BFB 3B26[3203]              	CMP	SP,[ConC_Spsave]
 35198 00005BFF 750A                    	JNZ	SHORT ctrlc_try_new	; current SP not the same as saved SP
 35199                                  
 35200                                  ; Repeat the operation by redispatching the system call.
 35201                                  
 35202                                  ctrlc_repeat:
 35203                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35204                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_IN_AX]
 35205                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35206                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35207 00005C01 A1[3A03]                	mov	ax,[USER_IN_AX]
 35208 00005C04 8E1E[630D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore ds and original sp
 35209                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0 
 35210                                  	;transfer COMMAND
 35211                                  COMMANDJ:
 35212 00005C08 E9FAA6                  	JMP	COMMAND
 35213                                  
 35214                                  ; The current SP is NOT the same as the input SP. Presume that he 
 35215                                  ; RETF'd leaving some flags on the stack and examine the input
 35216                                  
 35217                                  ctrlc_try_new:
 35218                                  	; 29/02/2024
 35219                                  	;ADD	SP,2			; pop those flags
 35220                                  	;
 35221                                  	;;test	ax,1
 35222                                  	;TEST	AX,f_Carry		; did he return with carry?
 35223 00005C0B A801                    	test	al,f_Carry ; test al,1
 35224                                  	;
 35225                                  	; 29/02/2024
 35226 00005C0D 58                      	pop	ax  ;  (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35227                                  	;
 35228 00005C0E 74F1                    	JZ	short ctrlc_repeat	; no carry set, just retry
 35229                                  
 35230                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35231 00005C10 8E1E[630D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore ds
 35232                                  
 35233                                  	; Well...  time to abort the user.  
 35234                                  	; Signal a ^C exit and use the EXIT system call..
 35235                                  
 35236                                  ctrlc_abort:
 35237                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35238                                          ;;MOV	AX,(EXIT SHL 8) + 0
 35239                                          ;MOV	AX,(EXIT*256) + 0  ; 4C00h
 35240                                  	;mov	byte [CS:DidCTRLC],0FFh ; 14/03/2018
 35241                                          ;transfer COMMAND	    ; give up by faking $EXIT
 35242                                  	;;JMP	SHORT COMMANDJ
 35243                                  	;JMP	COMMAND
 35244                                  
 35245                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35246                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 35249                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata

 35252 00005C22 1F                      	pop	ds
 35253                                  	;transfer COMMAND		; give up by faking $EXIT
 35254 00005C23 EBE3                    	JMP	SHORT COMMANDJ
 35255                                  	;JMP	COMMAND
