 35430                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35431                                  ;
 35432                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 35433                                  ;
 35434                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 35435                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 35436                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 35437                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 35438                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code
 35439                                  ;	DI = Original sector transfer count	
 35440                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 35441                                  ;	[READOP] = 0 for read, 1 for write
 35442                                  ;	Allowed Set with allowed responses to this error (other bits MUST BE 0)
 35443                                  ; Output:
 35444                                  ;	[FAILERR] will be set if user responded FAIL
 35445                                  ;
 35446                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35447                                  
 35448                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35449                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35450                                  HARDERR:
 35451                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35452                                  	; 30/07/2018
 35453                                  	; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35454 00005CA4 97                      	XCHG	AX,DI		  	; Error code in DI, count in AX
 35455                                  	;and	di,0FFh
 35456 00005CA5 81E7FF00                	AND	DI,STECODE		; And off status bits
 35457                                  	;CMP	DI,WRECODE		; Write Protect Error?
 35458                                  	;cmp	di,0
 35459 00005CA9 83FF00                  	cmp	DI,error_I24_write_protect ; Write Protect Error?
 35460 00005CAC 750A                    	JNZ	short NOSETWRPERR
 35461 00005CAE 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35462                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35463                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 35464                                  	;;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+0]

 35466 00005CAF 268A4600                	mov	al,[ES:BP]
 35467                                  		; 15/03/2018

 35469 00005CB7 58                      	POP	AX
 35470                                  NOSETWRPERR:
 35471 00005CB8 29C8                    	SUB	AX,CX		  ; Number of sectors successfully transferred
 35472 00005CBA 01C2                    	ADD	DX,AX		  ; First sector number to retry
 35473                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35474                                  	;;;

 35485                                  	;;;

 35490                                  	;;;

 35492 00005CD3 263B5606                	CMP	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 35493 00005CD7 7246                    	JB	SHORT ERRINT
 35494                                  
 35495                                  TESTDIR:	; 29/02/2024	
 35496 00005CD9 FEC4                    	INC	AH			; Flag for FAT
 35497                                  
 35498                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35499                                  	;;;
 35500                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 35501 00005CDB 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 35502 00005CE0 7525                    	jnz	short TESTDIR3 ; not FAT32
 35503 00005CE2 52                      	push	dx
 35504 00005CE3 368B16[0706]            	mov	dx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]
 35505                                  	;cmp	dx,[es:bp+2Bh]
 35506 00005CE8 263B562B                	cmp	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR+2]
 35507 00005CEC 5A                      	pop	dx
 35508 00005CED 7504                    	jnz	short TESTDIR1	; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 35509                                  	;cmp	dx,[es:bp+29h]
 35510 00005CEF 263B5629                	cmp	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR]
 35511                                  TESTDIR1:

 35513                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh ; -1
 35514 00005CF5 26C7461FFFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh
 35515                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh ; -1
 35516 00005CFB 26C74621FFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2],0FFFFh

 35518                                  TESTDIR2:  
 35519 00005D03 FEC4                    	inc	ah
 35520                                  	;inc	ah
 35521                                  	;jmp	short ERRINT
 35522                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 35523 00005D05 EB16                    	jmp	short ERRINT2
 35524                                  TESTDIR3:
 35525                                  	;;;
 35526

 35572                                  
 35573                                  	; DI has the INT-24-style extended error. We now map the error code
 35574                                  	; for this into the normalized get extended error set by using the
 35575                                  	; ErrMap24 table as a translate table. Note that we translate ONLY
 35576                                  	; the device returned codes and leave all others beyond the look up
 35577                                  	; table alone.

 35585 00005D47 BF0C00                  	MOV	DI,error_I24_gen_failure; mapped to gen_failure. Real codes
 35586                                  					;  Only come via GetExtendedError

 35589                                  ;
 35590                                  ; Entry point used by REDIRector on Network I 24 errors.
 35591                                  ;
 35592                                  ;	ASSUME	DS:NOTHING,ES:NOTHING,SS:DOSDATA
 35593                                  ;
 35594                                  ; ALL I 24 regs set up. ALL Extended error info SET. ALLOWED Set.
 35595                                  ;	EXITHOLD set for restore of ES:BP.
 35596                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------
 35597                                  	;entry	NET_I24_ENTRY
 35598                                  NET_I24_ENTRY:
 35599                                  GOT_RIGHT_CODE:
 35600 00005D4A 36803E[2003]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE],0	; No INT 24s if already INT 24

 35602 00005D52 B003                    	MOV	AL,3

 35604                                  NoSetFail:

 35606 00005D5B 16                      	PUSH	SS
 35607 00005D5C 07                      	POP	ES
 35608                                      
 35609                                  	; Wango!!! We may need to free some user state info... In 
 35610                                  	; particular, we may have locked down a JFN for a user and he may
 35611                                  	; NEVER return to us. Thus,we need to free it here and then
 35612                                  	; reallocate it when we come back.
 35613                                  
 35614 00005D5D 36833E[AA05]FF          	CMP	word [SS:SFN],-1 ; 0FFFFh
 35615 00005D63 740C                    	JZ	short _NoFree

 35625                                  					; Prepare to play with stack

 35630                                  	;;;

 35632                                  	;;;
 35633

 35641                                  faili24:				; AN000;
 35642 00005D89 B003                    	MOV	AL,3			; AN000;IFS.fake fail

 35644                                  i24yes: 				; AN000;

 35779                                  
 35780                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35781                                  ;
 35782                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 35783                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 35784                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 35785                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 35786                                  ;
 35787                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 35788                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 35789                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 35790                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 35791                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 35792                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 35793                                  ;
 35794                                  ; output:   none.
 35795                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35796                                  
 35797                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 35798                                  	
 35799                                  reset_environment:
 35800                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35801                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 35802                                  
 35803                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 35804

 35806                                  
 35807                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter
 35808                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 35809                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 35810                                  
 35811 00005E40 B482                    	MOV	AH,82h

 35813                                  	;int	2Ah

 35818

 35821                                  					; Allow REDIR to clear some stuff
 35822                                  					; On process exit.

 35825                                  			; SS = DOS CS

 35860                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that

 35966                                  ;
 35967                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 35968                                  ;
 35969                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.

 35971                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 35972                                  ;

 35974                                  
 35975                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 35976 00005EE1 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35977                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 35978 00005EE2 B8[BB0E]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 35979 00005EE5 2D[AB0E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 35980                                  					; Change to dosdata to access
 35981                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 35982                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35983

 35985 00005EE8 1E                      	push	ds

 35990                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 35991

 35994 00005EF2 7306                    	JAE	short NoTrans
 35995

 36017                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 36018                                  ;============================================================================
 36019                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36020                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36021                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36022                                  
 36023                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 36024                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 36025                                  
 36026                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 36027                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36028                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 36029                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 36030                                  ;
 36031                                  ;	IsEof
 36032                                  ;	UNPACK
 36033                                  ;	PACK
 36034                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 36035                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 36036                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 36037                                  ;	FAT_operation
 36038                                  ;
 36039                                  ;	Revision history:
 36040                                  ;
 36041                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 36042                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 36043                                  ;
 36044                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 36045                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 36046                                  
 36047                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36048                                  
 36049                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36050                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A40Ch
 36051                                  
 36052                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 36053                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36054                                  ;
 36055                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 36056                                  ;
 36057                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 36058                                  ;
 36059                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 36060                                  ;		BX has fat value
 36061                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 36062                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 36063                                  ;
 36064                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36065                                  
 36066                                  IsEOF:
 36067                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36068                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36069                                  	;;;
 36070 00005F08 E89801                  	call	IsFAT32			; is it FAT32 drive ?
 36071 00005F0B 730D                    	jnc	short IsEOF_FAT		; no, it has 12 or 16 bit FAT
 36072                                  
 36073                                  	; FAT32 fs
 36074 00005F0D 36813E[E80A]FF0F        	cmp	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW],0FFFh
 36075 00005F14 7503                    	jnz     short IsEOF_other1	; not EOF
 36076 00005F16 83FBF8                  	cmp     bx,0FFF8h		; 32 bit compare
 36077                                  IsEOF_other1:
 36078 00005F19 C3                      	retn 				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36079                                  
 36080                                  IsEOF_FAT:
 36081                                  	;;;
 36082                                  
 36083                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 36084 00005F1A 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 36085 00005F20 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 36086                                  
 36087                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 36088                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 36089                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 36090                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 36091                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 36092                                  
 36093 00005F22 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 36094 00005F26 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 36095                                  
 36096 00005F28 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 36097                                  IsEOF_other:
 36098 00005F2C C3                      	retn
 36099                                  EOF16:
 36100 00005F2D 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 36101 00005F30 C3                      	retn				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36102                                  
 36103                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36104                                  
 36105                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36106                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36107                                  ;
 36108                                  ; Procedure Name : UNPACK
 36109                                  ;
 36110                                  ; Inputs:
 36111                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36112                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 36113                                  ; Outputs:
 36114                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36115                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 36116                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36117                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 36118                                  ;
 36119                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36120                                  ;
 36121                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36122                                  
 36123                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36124                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A44Eh
 36125                                  	;
 36126                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS .SYS - DOSCODE:9511h)
 36127                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C368h)
 36128

 36324                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK

 36326                                  ; Inputs:

 36540                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 36541                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36542                                  ;
 36543                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 36544                                  ;
 36545                                  ; Inputs:
 36546                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 36547                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 36548                                  ; Function:
 36549                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 36550                                  ; Outputs:
 36551                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 36552                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 36553                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 36554                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 36555                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 36556                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 36557                                  ;
 36558                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36559                                  
 36560                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36561                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36562                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36563                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36564                                  
 36565                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36566                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A5D7h
 36567                                  
 36568                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 36569                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 36570 000060B8 C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 36571                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 36572 000060BD 50                      	push	ax
 36573 000060BE 53                      	push	bx
 36574 000060BF 51                      	push	cx
 36575 000060C0 52                      	push	dx
 36576                                  	; 02/03/2024
 36577                                  	;MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 36578                                  
 36579                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36580                                  	;;;
 36581                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36582 000060C1 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx
 36583 000060C3 8B16[E80A]              	mov	dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36584                                  	;
 36585 000060C7 52                      	push	dx ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36586                                  	;
 36587 000060C8 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 36588 000060CA E8D6FF                  	call	IsFAT32
 36589 000060CD 730E                    	jnc	short mapcl1 ; not FAT32
 36590                                  	; FAT32
 36591 000060CF D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36592 000060D1 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36593 000060D3 D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36594 000060D5 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36595 000060D7 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36596 000060D9 D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36597                                  	; DI:DX:AX = 4*(DX:AX)
 36598 000060DB EB14                    	jmp	short Map16		; 32 bit FAT	
 36599                                  mapcl1:
 36600                                  	;;;
 36601 000060DD 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 36602                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36603                                  	;JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 36604                                  	;SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 36605                                  	;
 36606                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36607                                  	;;;
 36608 000060E3 7304                    	jae	short mapcl2		; 16 bit FAT
 36609                                  	; 12 bit FAT
 36610 000060E5 D1EA                    	shr	dx,1
 36611 000060E7 D1D8                    	rcr     ax,1
 36612                                  mapcl2:
 36613 000060E9 01D8                    	add     ax,bx
 36614 000060EB 1316[E80A]              	adc     dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36615 000060EF 11FF                    	adc	di,di
 36616                                  	;;;
 36617                                  Map16:	
 36618                                  
 36619                                  ; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36620                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36621                                  %if 0
 36622                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 36623                                  	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 36624                                  	
 36625                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36626                                  	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 36627                                  	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 36628                                  %endif
 36629                                  
 36630 000060F1 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 36631                                  
 36632                                  ;IF FastDiv
 36633                                  ;
 36634                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 36635                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 36636                                  ;
 36637                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 36638                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 36639                                  ;
 36640                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 36641                                  
 36642 000060F5 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 36643 000060F9 751C                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 36644                                  
 36645                                  ; 02/04/2024
 36646                                  %if 0
 36647                                  	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 36648                                  	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 36649                                  	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 36650                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 36651                                  	;shr	al,1
 36652                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 36653                                  	shr	di,1			; 2
 36654                                  	rcr	al,1			; 2
 36655                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36656                                  	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 36657                                  %else
 36658                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36659                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36660                                  	;;;
 36661 000060FB 50                      	push	ax
 36662 000060FC D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 36663 000060FE D1DA                    	rcr	dx,1
 36664 00006100 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 36665 00006102 88E0                    	mov	al,ah			; 9 bit shift to right
 36666 00006104 88D4                    	mov	ah,dl
 36667 00006106 88F2                    	mov	dl,dh
 36668 00006108 30F6                    	xor	dh,dh
 36669 0000610A D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 36670 0000610C 10F6                    	adc	dh,dh
 36671 0000610E 87D7                    	xchg	dx,di		; DI:AX = sector contains requested cluster data
 36672 00006110 5A                      	pop	dx
 36673 00006111 81E2FF01                	and	dx,1FFh			; offset in sector
 36674                                  	;;;
 36675                                  %endif
 36676 00006115 EB07                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 36677                                  
 36678                                  _DoDiv:
 36679                                  ;ENDIF
 36680                                  
 36681                                  ; 02/04/2024
 36682                                  %if 0
 36683                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36684                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 36685                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36686                                  	mov	dx,di			; 2
 36687                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36688                                  	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 36689                                  %else
 36690                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36691                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36692                                  	;;;
 36693 00006117 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 36694 00006118 92                      	xchg	ax,dx
 36695 00006119 F7F1                    	div	cx
 36696 0000611B 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 36697 0000611C F7F1                    	div	cx
 36698                                  	;jmp	short DivDone
 36699                                  	;;;
 36700                                  %endif
 36701                                  
 36702                                  ;IF FastDiv
 36703                                  DivDone:
 36704                                  ;ENDIF
 36705                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 36706 0000611E 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 36707                                  	
 36708                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36709                                  	;;;
 36710 00006122 83D700                  	adc	di,0
 36711                                  	;;;
 36712                                  
 36713 00006125 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 36714                                  
 36715                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 36716                                  
 36717                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36718                                  	;;;
 36719 00006126 57                      	push	di ; 4*
 36720                                  	;;;
 36721 00006127 50                      	push	ax ; 3*
 36722 00006128 52                      	push	dx ; 2*
 36723 00006129 51                      	push	cx ; 1*
 36724                                  
 36725 0000612A 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX
 36726                                  
 36727                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36728                                  	; mov [HIGH_SECTOR],di ; *!* ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36729 0000612C 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 36730                                  	;
 36731                                  
 36732                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36733                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36734                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 36735                                  	;
 36736                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36737                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 36738                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 36739                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 36740                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 36741                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36742 0000612E E83D04                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *! ; *!* ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36743                                  
 36744                                  	;RESTORE <CX,AX,DX>		; CX is sec siz-1, AX is offset in sec
 36745 00006131 59                      	pop	cx ; 1*
 36746 00006132 58                      	pop	ax ; 2*
 36747 00006133 5A                      	pop	dx ; 3*
 36748                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36749                                  	;;;
 36750 00006134 5B                      	pop	bx ; 4*
 36751                                  	;;;
 36752                                  
 36753 00006135 725A                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 36754                                  
 36755 00006137 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 36756                                  	;;;lea	di,[si+16]
 36757                                  	;;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 36758                                  	;lea	di,[si+24] ; PCDOS 7.1	; 02/03/2024
 36759 0000613B 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 36760 0000613E 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 36761 00006140 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX
 36762 00006142 7530                    	JNZ	short MAPRET	; ds<>ss
 36763 00006144 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 36764                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 36765 00006146 16                      	push	ss
 36766 00006147 1F                      	pop	ds	
 36767 00006148 FE06[7805]              	INC	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT]
 36768 0000614C A2[8E05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE],AL
 36769 0000614F 8916[9005]              	MOV	[CLUSSEC],DX
 36770

 36772                                  	;MOV	WORD [CLUSSEC+2],0      ;F.C. >32mb	;AN000;
 36773                                  	;INC	DX
 36774                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36775                                  	;;;

 36779 0000615C 11C3                    	adc	bx,ax
 36780                                  	;mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],bx ; *!*
 36781                                  	;;;
 36782                                  
 36783                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36784                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb FAT sector <32mb ;AN000;
 36785                                  	;
 36786                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36787                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 36788                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 36789                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 36790                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 36791                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36792 0000615E E80D04                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *! ; *!* ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36793 00006161 722E                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 36794                                  
 36795 00006163 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 36796 00006167 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 36797 0000616A 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 36798                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 36799 0000616C 16                      	push	ss
 36800 0000616D 1F                      	pop	ds
 36801 0000616E A2[8F05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE+1],AL
 36802                                  
 36803                                  ;hkn; CLUSSAVE is in DOSDATA
 36804 00006171 BF[8E05]                	MOV	DI,CLUSSAVE
 36805                                  MAPRET:
 36806                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36807                                  	;;;
 36808 00006174 368F06[E80A]            	pop	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW]	; (ds<>ss)
 36809                                  	;;;
 36810                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX>
 36811 00006179 5A                      	pop	dx
 36812 0000617A 59                      	pop	cx
 36813 0000617B 5B                      	pop	bx
 36814                                  
 36815 0000617C 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; MZ allow shift to clear carry
 36816                                  
 36817                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36818                                  	;;;
 36819 0000617E E822FF                  	call	IsFAT32
 36820 00006181 720A                    	jc	short MapSet	; FAT32 fs
 36821                                  	;;;
 36822                                  
 36823 00006183 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 36824 00006189 7302                    	JAE	short MapSet		; MZ no, set flags
 36825 0000618B 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX
 36826                                  MapSet:
 36827 0000618D A801                    	TEST	AL,1			; set zero flag if not on boundary
 36828                                  	;RESTORE <AX>
 36829 0000618F 58                      	pop	ax
 36830 00006190 C3                      	retn
 36831                                  
 36832                                  MAP_POP:
 36833                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36834                                  	;;;
 36835                                  	;pop	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36836                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36837 00006191 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; (ds=ss)
 36838                                  	;;;
 36839                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX,AX>
 36840 00006195 5A                      	pop	dx
 36841 00006196 59                      	pop	cx
 36842 00006197 5B                      	pop	bx
 36843 00006198 58                      	pop	ax
 36844                                  fatread_sft_retn: ; 17/12/2022
 36845 00006199 C3                      	retn

 36847                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36848                                  ; DOSCODE:96B3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36849                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36850                                  ; DOSCODE:9657h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36851                                  
 36852                                  ; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36853                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A6C6h
 36854                                  
 36855                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 36856                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36857                                  ;
 36858                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 36859                                  ;
 36860                                  ; Inputs:
 36861                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of interest (local only,
 36862                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 36863                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 36864                                  ; Function:
 36865                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 36866                                  ;	if disk changed.
 36867                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 36868                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 36869                                  ; Outputs:
 36870                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36871                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 36872                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 36873                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 36874                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 36875                                  ;
 36876                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36877                                  
 36878                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 36879 0000619A 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 36880                                  
 36881                                  fatread_gotdpb:	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36882                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36883                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 36884                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36885 0000619E 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 36886 000061A2 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 36887 000061A5 E8CEA4                  	call	GOTDPB			; Set THISDPB
 36888                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36889                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36890 000061A8 E99C00                  	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36891                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 36892                                  	;retn
 36893                                  
 36894                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36895                                  ;
 36896                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 36897                                  ;
 36898                                  ; Inputs:
 36899                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 36900                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of interest (local only,
 36901                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 36902                                  ; Function:
 36903                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 36904                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 36905                                  ; Outputs:
 36906                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 36907                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 36908                                  ;	THISDRV set
 36909                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36910                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 36911                                  ;
 36912                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36913                                  
 36914                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36915                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36916                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36917                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36918                                  
 36919                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36920                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A6D8h
 36921                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C644h)
 36922                                  
 36923                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 36924 000061AB 06                      	PUSH	ES
 36925 000061AC 57                      	PUSH	DI
 36926                                  
 36927                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 36928 000061AD 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36929                                  
 36930                                  ; 03/03/2024
 36931                                  %if 0
 36932                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36933                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 36934                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36935                                  	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 36936                                  	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 36937                                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 36938                                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36939                                  %else
 36940                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36941                                  	;;;
 36942 000061B1 E8EAFF                  	call	fatread_gotdpb
 36943                                  	;;;
 36944                                  %endif
 36945 000061B4 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 36946 000061B5 07                      	POP	ES
 36947 000061B6 72E1                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 36948 000061B8 7542                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 36949                                  
 36950                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 36951                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 36952                                  
 36953                                  MED_CHANGE:
 36954                                  	;XOR	AX,AX
 36955                                  	;DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 36956                                  	; 03/03/2024
 36957 000061BA B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh ; -1
 36958                                  	
 36959 000061BD 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 36960 000061BE 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]
 36961 000061C2 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH			; CX is number of structures
 36962                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 36963 000061C4 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 36964                                  
 36965                                  ;hkn; SS override
 36966                                  
 36967                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 36968                                  ;
 36969                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 36970                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 36971                                  
 36972 000061C8 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 36973                                  frcd20: 
 36974                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 36975                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 36976 000061CD 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 36977 000061D2 7522                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 36978                                  
 36979                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36980                                  	;push	es
 36981                                  	;push	di
 36982                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 36983                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36984                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 36985                                  	;pop	di
 36986                                  	;pop	es
 36987                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 36988                                  
 36989                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36990 000061D4 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36991 000061D8 751C                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 36992 000061DA 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 36993 000061DC 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 36994 000061E0 7514                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 36995                                  
 36996                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36997                                  	;test	[es:di+49h],ax	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A70Fh
 36998 000061E2 26854549                	test	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX
 36999                                  	;JZ	short frcd25 ; = 0	; If root (0), leave root
 37000                                  		; !!! test es:[di+49h],ax
 37001                                  		; !!! jz short frcd25	
 37002                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM bug (!?) ; Erdogan Tan - 03/03/2024
 37003                                  		; test dword ptr es:[di+49h],-1 ; Win ME - BIOSCODE:0C694h
 37004                                  		; jz short frcd25
 37005                                  		;
 37006                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37007 000061E6 7506                    	jnz	short frcd24
 37008                                  
 37009                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37010                                  	;;;
 37011                                  	;test	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 37012 000061E8 2685454B                	test	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],AX
 37013 000061EC 7408                    	jz	short frcd25 ; = 0
 37014                                  frcd24:		; 03/03/2024
 37015                                  	;;;
 37016                                  	;mov	[es:di+49h],ax
 37017 000061EE 26894549                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX	; else invalid
 37018                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37019                                  	;;;
 37020                                  	;mov	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 37021 000061F2 2689454B                	mov	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],ax ; -1
 37022                                  	;;;
 37023                                  frcd25:	
 37024                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3
 37025                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0	 
 37026 000061F6 83C758                  	ADD	DI,curdir.size		; Point to next CDS
 37027 000061F9 E2D2                    	LOOP	frcd20
 37028 000061FB 1F                      	POP	DS
 37029                                  NO_CHANGE:
 37030 000061FC C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 37031 00006200 F8                      	CLC
 37032 00006201 C3                      	retn
 37033                                  
 37034                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 37035                                  ; 05/01/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 37036                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A7Fh
 37037                                  ;;;
 37038                                  chk_set_first_access:
 37039                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 37040 00006202 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 37041 00006207 750D                    	jnz	short chk_set_fa_1	; FAT (FAT12 or FAT16)
 37042                                  	; FAT32
 37043                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh
 37044 00006209 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT_HW],0FFFFh ; -1
 37045                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh	; High word of free cluster count
 37046 0000620E 26C74621FFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT_HW],0FFFFh ; -1
 37047 00006214 7505                    	jne	short chk_set_fa_2
 37048                                  chk_set_fa_1:
 37049                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh
 37050 00006216 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 37051                                  chk_set_fa_2:
 37052                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh	; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 37053 0000621B 26C7461FFFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 37054 00006221 7405                    	je	short chk_set_fa_3
 37055                                  	;or	byte [es:bp+18h],1
 37056 00006223 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],1
 37057                                  chk_set_fa_3:
 37058 00006228 C3                      	retn
 37059                                  ;;;

 37500                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 37501                                  	;;mov	ah,[es:bp+0Fh]
 37502                                  	;MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 37503                                  	;;mov	[DI-8],ax
 37504                                  	;MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcnt-BUFINSIZ],AX
 37505                                  
 37506                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37507                                  	;mov	[di-0Ah],al

 37509                                  						;>32mb		;AN000;
 37510                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+0Fh]
 37511                                  	MOV	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]		;>32mb
 37512                                  	;mov	[di-09h],ax					;AC000;
 37513                                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcntinc-BUFINSIZ],AX 
 37514                                  					;>32mb Correct buffer info ;AC000;
 37515                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 37516                                  	push	ss
 37517                                  	pop	ds
 37518                                  	XOR	AL,AL			;Media changed (Z), Carry clear
 37519                                  	retn
 37520                                  
 37521                                  FATERRJ: 
 37522                                  	JMP	FATERR
 37523                                  
 37524                                  %else

 37535                                  				; byte BUFFINFO.buf_flags = 0
 37536 000063F8 E92EFE                  	jmp	FATERR
 37537

 37637 00006497 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx

 37640

 37761                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37762                                  ; Retro DOS v2.0 - 12/03/2018
 37763                                  ;
 37764                                  ; buffer management for MSDOS
 37765                                  ;
 37766                                  ;CODE	SEGMENT BYTE PUBLIC  'CODE'
 37767                                  ;       ASSUME  SS:DOSGROUP,CS:DOSGROUP
 37768                                  ;
 37769                                  ;SUBTTL SETVISIT,SKIPVISIT -- MANAGE BUFFER SCANS
 37770                                  ;
 37771                                  ;SETVISIT:
 37772                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37773                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CAFh
 37774                                  ;; Inputs:
 37775                                  ;;      None
 37776                                  ;; Function:
 37777                                  ;;      Set up a scan of I/O buffers
 37778                                  ;; Outputs:
 37779                                  ;;      All visit flags = 0
 37780                                  ;;              NOTE: This pre-scan is needed because a hard disk error
 37781                                  ;;                    may cause a scan to stop in the middle leaving some
 37782                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 37783                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 37784                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37785                                  ;
 37786                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37787                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 37788                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37789                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 37790                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 37791                                  ;SETLOOP:
 37792                                  ;       ;;MOV	[DI+7],AL ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37793                                  ;	;and	[DI+5],al
 37794                                  ;	AND	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],AL
 37795                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 37796                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37797                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP
 37798                                  ;       POP     AX ; 09/09/2018
 37799                                  ;	LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37800                                  ;SVISIT_RETN:
 37801                                  ;       RETN
 37802                                  ;
 37803                                  ;SKIPVISIT:
 37804                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37805                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CC8h
 37806                                  ;
 37807                                  ;; Inputs:
 37808                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to a buffer
 37809                                  ;; Function:
 37810                                  ;;      Skip visited buffers
 37811                                  ;; Outputs:
 37812                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to next unvisited buffer
 37813                                  ;;      Zero is set if skip to LAST buffer
 37814                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37815                                  ;
 37816                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37817                                  ;       ;retz
 37818                                  ;       JZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37819                                  ;
 37820                                  ;	;;CMP	BYTE [DI+7],1 ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37821                                  ;       ;;;retnz
 37822                                  ;       ;;JNZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37823                                  ;
 37824                                  ;	;test	byte [di+5],20h
 37825                                  ;	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_visit	
 37826                                  ;	JNZ	short SKIPLOOP
 37827                                  ;	
 37828                                  ;	push	ax
 37829                                  ;	or	al,1
 37830                                  ;	pop	ax
 37831                                  ;	retn	
 37832                                  ;
 37833                                  ;SKIPLOOP:
 37834                                  ;	LDS     DI,[DI]
 37835                                  ;       JMP     SHORT SKIPVISIT
 37836                                  
 37837                                  ;============================================================================
 37838                                  ; BUF.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 37839                                  ;============================================================================
 37840                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37841                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37842                                  ; 06/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37843                                  
 37844                                  ;	TITLE	BUF - MSDOS buffer management
 37845                                  ;	NAME	BUF
 37846                                  
 37847                                  ;**	BUF.ASM - Low level routines for buffer cache management
 37848                                  ;
 37849                                  ;	GETCURHEAD
 37850                                  ;	ScanPlace
 37851                                  ;	PLACEBUF
 37852                                  ;	PLACEHEAD
 37853                                  ;	PointComp
 37854                                  ;	GETBUFFR
 37855                                  ;	GETBUFFRB
 37856                                  ;	FlushBuf
 37857                                  ;	BufWrite
 37858                                  ;	SET_RQ_SC_PARMS
 37859                                  ;
 37860                                  ;	Revision history:
 37861                                  ;
 37862                                  ;		AN000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 37863                                  ;		A004   PTM 3765 -- Disk reset failed
 37864                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk write optimization
 37865                                  ;		I001   5.0 PTR 722211 - Preserve CY when in buffer in HMA
 37866                                  
 37867                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 37868                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37869                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 37870                                  ; Inputs:
 37871                                  ;	 No Inputs
 37872                                  ; Function:
 37873                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37874                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 37875                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 37876                                  ; Outputs:
 37877                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37878                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 37879                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 37880                                  ; No other registers altered
 37881                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37882                                  
 37883                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37884                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37885                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37886                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37887                                  
 37888                                  ; 06/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37889                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AA4Bh
 37890                                  
 37891                                  GETCURHEAD:
 37892 00006509 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 37893 0000650E 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 37894 00006515 36893E[1711]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	; save first buffer address
 37895 0000651A C3                      	retn
 37896                                  
 37897                                  ;Break	<SCANPLACE, PLACEBUF -- PUT A BUFFER BACK IN THE POOL>
 37898                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37899                                  ; Procedure Name : ScanPlace
 37900                                  ; Inputs:
 37901                                  ;	Same as PLACEBUF
 37902                                  ; Function:
 37903                                  ;	Save scan location and call PLACEBUF
 37904                                  ; Outputs:
 37905                                  ;	DS:DI Points to saved scan location
 37906                                  ; All registers, except DS:DI, preserved.
 37907                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37908                                  ;M039: Rewritten to preserve registers.
 37909                                  
 37910                                  ;SCANPLACE:
 37911                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37912                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5DDCh
 37913                                  ;	push	es
 37914                                  ;	les	si,[di]
 37915                                  ;	;les	si,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_link]
 37916                                  ;	call	PLACEBUF
 37917                                  ;	push	es
 37918                                  ;	pop	ds
 37919                                  ;	mov	di,si
 37920                                  ;	pop	es
 37921                                  ;scanplace_retn:
 37922                                  ;	retn	
 37923                                  	
 37924                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37925                                  SCANPLACE:
 37926 0000651B FF35                    	push	word [di]
 37927                                  	;push	word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ;Save scan location
 37928 0000651D E80200                  	call	PLACEBUF
 37929 00006520 5F                      	pop	di
 37930 00006521 C3                      	retn
 37931                                  
 37932                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37933                                  ; Procedure Name : PlaceBuf
 37934                                  ; Input:
 37935                                  ;	DS:DI points to buffer (DS->BUFFINFO array, DI=offset in array)
 37936                                  ; Function:
 37937                                  ;	Remove buffer from queue and re-insert it in proper place.
 37938                                  ; NO registers altered
 37939                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37940                                  
 37941                                  ;procedure PLACEBUF,NEAR
 37942                                  
 37943                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37944                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37945                                  PLACEBUF:
 37946                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37947                                  
 37948                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37949 00006522 50                      	push	AX			;Save only regs we modify	;AN000;
 37950 00006523 53                      	push	BX							;AN000;
 37951                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37952                                  	;push	SI							;AN000;
 37953                                  	
 37954 00006524 8B05                    	mov	ax,[di]
 37955                                  	;mov	ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 37956 00006526 368B1E[6D00]            	mov	bx,[ss:BufferQueue]	; bx = offset of head of list;smr;SS Override
 37957                                  	
 37958 0000652B 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx				;Buf = last?		;AN000;
 37959 0000652D 7422                    	je	short nret			;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37960 0000652F 39DF                    	cmp	di,bx				;Buf = first?		;AN000;

 38123                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 38124                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38125                                  ;
 38126                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 38127                                  ; Inputs:
 38128                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 38129                                  ; Function:
 38130                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 38131                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 38132                                  ;	   same segment
 38133                                  ;
 38134                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 38135                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 38136                                  ; No Registers altered
 38137                                  ;
 38138                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38139                                  
 38140                                  POINTCOMP:
 38141                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38142                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h
 38143 0000655F 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 38144 00006561 750A                    	jnz	short _ret_label	; return if nz
 38145                                  	;jnz	short placehead_retn 
 38146 00006563 51                      	PUSH	CX
 38147 00006564 52                      	PUSH	DX

 38149 00006567 8CC2                    	MOV	DX,ES
 38150 00006569 39D1                    	CMP	CX,DX
 38151 0000656B 5A                      	POP	DX
 38152 0000656C 59                      	POP	CX
 38153                                  _ret_label:
 38154 0000656D C3                      	retn

 38156                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38157                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 38158                                  
 38159                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 38160                                  
 38161                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38162                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38163                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 38164                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38165                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 38166                                  ; 
 38167                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38168                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38169                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 38170                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38171                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38172                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38173                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38174                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38175                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38176                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38177                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38178                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38179                                  
 38180                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38181                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38182                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 38183                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38184                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 38185                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 38186                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 38187                                  ; 
 38188                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38189                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38190                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 38191                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 38192                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38193                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38194                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38195                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38196                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38197                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38198                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38199                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38200                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38201

 38819                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECKFLUSH
 38820                                  ;
 38821                                  ; Inputs : AL - Drive number, -1 means do not check for drive
 38822                                  ;	   DS:DI - pointer to buffer
 38823                                  ;
 38824                                  ; Function : Write out a buffer if it is dirty
 38825                                  ;
 38826                                  ; Carry set if problem (currently user FAILed to I 24)

 38828                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38829

 38831                                  
 38832                                  CHECKFLUSH:
 38833                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38834 00006737 B4FF                    	mov	ah,-1	; 01/08/2018 Retro DOS v3.0
 38835                                  	;cmp	[di+4],ah
 38836 00006739 386504                  	CMP	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AH

 38840                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 38841 00006742 3A4504                  	CMP	AL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 38842 00006745 F8                      	CLC
 38843 00006746 75EE                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not for this unit or SFT
 38844                                  
 38845                                  	; 07/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 38846                                  	;;;

 38848 0000674A 88C3                    	mov	bl,al
 38849                                  	;test	ss:drive_flags[bx],8 
 38850 0000674C 36F687[1012]08          	test	byte [ss:bx+drive_flags],8 ; bit 3
 38851 00006752 75E2                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn
 38852                                  	;;;
 38853                                  
 38854                                  DOBUFFER:
 38855                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 38856 00006754 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 38857 00006758 74DC                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not dirty, carry clear by TEST
 38858 0000675A 50                      	PUSH	AX
 38859                                  	;push	word [di+4]
 38860 0000675B FF7504                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 38861 0000675E E80B00                  	CALL	BUFWRITE

 38866                                  	;mov	[di+4],ax
 38867 00006767 894504                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AX
 38868                                  LEAVE_BUF:
 38869 0000676A 58                      	POP	AX			; Search info
 38870                                  checkflush_retn:

 38873                                  ;Break	<BUFWRITE -- WRITE OUT A BUFFER IF DIRTY>
 38874                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38875                                  ;
 38876                                  ;	BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk, if it's dirty.
 38877                                  ;
 38878                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DI Points to the buffer
 38879                                  ;
 38880                                  ;	EXIT	Buffer marked free
 38881                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 38882                                  ;
 38883                                  ;	USES	All buf DS:DI
 38884                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR
