 39182                                  ; MSPROC.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1992
 39183                                  ;============================================================================
 39184                                  ; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39185                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39186                                  ; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 39187                                  
 39188                                  ; (15/04/2018 - RetrO DOS v2.0, MSDOS 2.11 - PROC.ASM - 1983)
 39189                                  
 39190                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 39191                                  
 39192                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 39193                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 39194                                  
 39195                                  ; =========================================================================
 39196                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 39197                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 39198                                  ;
 39199                                  ;	$WAIT
 39200                                  ;	$EXEC
 39201                                  ;	$Keep_process
 39202                                  ;	Stay_resident
 39203                                  ;	$EXIT
 39204                                  ;	$ABORT
 39205                                  ;	abort_inner
 39206                                  ;
 39207                                  ;	Modification history:
 39208                                  ;
 39209                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 39210                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 39211                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 39212                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 39213                                  ;
 39214                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 39215                                  ;
 39216                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 39217                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 39218                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 39219                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 39220                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 39221                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 39222                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 39223                                  ;
 39224                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 39225                                  ;
 39226                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 39227                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 39228                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 39229                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 39230                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 39231                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 39232                                  ;
 39233                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 39234                                  ;
 39235                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 39236                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 39237                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 39238                                  ;
 39239                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 39240                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 39241                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 39242                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 39243                                  ;
 39244                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 39245                                  ;
 39246                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 39247                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 39248                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 39249                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 39250                                  ;
 39251                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 39252                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 39253                                  ;		       UMBs.
 39254                                  ;
 39255                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 39256                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 39257                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 39258                                  ;
 39259                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 39260                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 39261                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 39262                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 39263                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 39264                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 39265                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 39266                                  ;
 39267                                  ; =========================================================================
 39268                                  
 39269                                  ;SAVEXIT  EQU  10
 39270                                  
 39271                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>

 39282                                  ;	USES	all

 39297                                  _$WAIT:
 39298                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39299                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 39300

 39305                                  ; =========================================================================
 39306                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 39307                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 39308                                  ;
 39309                                  ;
 39310                                  ; Assembler usage:
 39311                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 39312                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 39313                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 39314                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 39315                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 39316                                  ;
 39317                                  ;	AL  Function
 39318                                  ;	--  --------
 39319                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 39320                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 39321                                  ;	    begin execution.
 39322                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 39323                                  ;
 39324                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 39325                                  ;
 39326                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39327                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39328                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39329                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39330                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39331                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39332                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39333                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39334                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39335                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39336                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39337                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39338                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39339                                  ;
 39340                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 39341                                  ;
 39342                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39343                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39344                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39345                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39346                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39347                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39348                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39349                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39350                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39351                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39352                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39353                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39354                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39355                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39356                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 39357                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39358                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39359                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 39360                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39361                                  ;
 39362                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 39363                                  ;
 39364                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39365                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 39366                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 39367                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39368                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 39369                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 39370                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39371                                  ;
 39372                                  ; Returns:
 39373                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 39374                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 39375                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 39376                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 39377                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 39378                                  ; =========================================================================
 39379                                  ;
 39380                                  ;   Revision history:
 39381                                  ;
 39382                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 39383                                  ;
 39384                                  ; =========================================================================
 39385                                  
 39386                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 39387                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)
 39388                                  
 39389                                  ; =========================================================================
 39390                                  
 39391                                  ;IF1		; warning message on buffers
 39392                                  ;%out	Please make sure that the following are contiguous and of the
 39393                                  ;%out	following sizes:
 39394                                  ;%out
 39395                                  ;%out	OpenBuf     128
 39396                                  ;%out	RenBuf	    128
 39397                                  ;%out	SearchBuf    53

 39420                                  _$EXEC:
 39421                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 39423                                  
 39424                                  EXEC001S:
 39425                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 39426                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 39427                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE

 39429                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Rel_Fac	,WORD

 39434                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA		,WORD
 39435                                  	;LocalVar    ExecNameLen 	,WORD
 39436                                  	;LocalVar    ExecName		,DWORD
 39437                                  	;

 39439                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_NoStack	,BYTE
 39440                                  
 39441                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 39442                                  	;%define	Exec_Blk	dword [bp-4]
 39443                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 39444                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]
 39445                                  	%define		Exec_BlkH	word [bp-2]
 39446                                  	%define		Exec_Func	byte [bp-5]
 39447                                  	%define		Exec_Load_High	byte [bp-6]
 39448                                  	%define		Exec_FH		word [bp-8]
 39449                                  	%define		Exec_Rel_Fac	word [bp-10]
 39450                                  	%define		Exec_Res_Len_Para word [bp-12]
 39451                                  	%define		Exec_Environ	word [bp-14]
 39452                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]
 39453                                  	%define		Exec_Load_Block	word [bp-18]
 39454                                  	%define		Exec_DMA	word [bp-20]
 39455                                  	%define		ExecNameLen	word [bp-22]
 39456                                  	;%define	ExecName	dword [bp-26]
 39457                                  	%define		ExecName	[bp-26] ; 09/08/2018
 39458                                  	%define		ExecNameL	word [bp-26]
 39459                                  	%define		ExecNameH	word [bp-24]
 39460                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39461                                  	%define		Exec_DMA_Save	word [bp-28]
 39462                                  	%define		Exec_NoStack	byte [bp-29]
 39463                                  	
 39464                                  	; ==================================================================
 39465                                  	; validate function
 39466                                  	; ==================================================================
 39467                                  		      	
 39468                                  	; M068 - Start
 39469                                  	;
 39470                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a
 39471                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 39472                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep
 39473                                  	; the A20 off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 39474                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 39475                                  
 39476                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39477 00006838 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 39478                                  
 39479                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack
 39480                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 39481                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExecReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 39482                                  
 39483 0000683E 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 39484                                  	;jne	short @f
 39485 00006840 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 39486                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 39487 00006842 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 39488 00006843 B9[0A04]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 39489 00006846 51                      	push	cx
 39490                                  ;@@:
 39491                                  Exec_@f:
 39492                                  	; M068 - End
 39493                                  	
 39494                                  	;Enter
 39495                                  
 39496 00006847 55                      	push	bp
 39497 00006848 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 39498                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 39499                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 39500                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 & MSDOS 6.22 & PCDOS 7.1 ; 07/03/2024
 39501                                  	; 17/12/2022
 39502                                  	; 20/05/2019
 39503 0000684A 83EC1E                  	sub	sp,30	; Retro DOS v4.0
 39504                                  
 39505                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39506 0000684D 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 39507                                  					; M030
 39508 0000684F 7611                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 39509                                  
 39510                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 39511                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 39512                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2
 39513                                  
 39514                                  Exec_Bad_Fun:
 39515                                  	;mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; 1
 39516                                  					; Extended Error Locus	;smr;SS Override
 39517                                  	; 01/07/2024
 39518 00006851 E87AAA                  	call	set_exerr_locus_unk

 39521 00006854 B001                    	mov	al,error_invalid_function

 39551 00006874 8846FB                  	mov	Exec_Func,AL

 39571                                  	;;;
 39572 00006891 B0A0                    	mov	al,0A0h			; Access mode bits: (0 to 2)
 39573                                  					; 000  read access

 41073                                  
 41074                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41075                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 41076                                  ;
 41077                                  ; Input:    DX is an offset from CurrentPDB at which to
 41078                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 41079                                  ;
 41080                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 41081                                  ;	    paragraphs long. An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 41082                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 41083                                  ;
 41084                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41085                                  
 41086                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41087                                  	; DOSCODE:A19Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41088                                  
 41089                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41090                                  	; DOSCODE:A13Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41091                                  
 41092                                  	; 09/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 41093                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B3BCh
 41094                                  
 41095                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 41096 00006E44 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 41097                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 41098 00006E45 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 41099 00006E4B 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 41100 00006E50 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 41101 00006E53 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 41102                                  
 41103 00006E55 BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h
 41104                                  
 41105                                  Keep_Shrink:
 41106 00006E58 89D3                    	mov	BX,DX
 41107 00006E5A 53                      	push	BX
 41108 00006E5B 06                      	push	ES
 41109 00006E5C E82F02                  	call	_$SETBLOCK		; ignore return codes.
 41110 00006E5F 1F                      	pop	DS
 41111 00006E60 5B                      	pop	BX
 41112 00006E61 7207                    	jc	short Keep_Done		; failed on modification
 41113                                  
 41114 00006E63 8CD8                    	mov	AX,DS
 41115 00006E65 01D8                    	add	AX,BX
 41116                                  	;mov	[2],ax
 41117 00006E67 A30200                  	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],AX	;PBUGBUG
 41118                                  
 41119                                  Keep_Done:
 41120 00006E6A 58                      	pop	AX
 41121 00006E6B EB26                    	jmp	SHORT exit_inner	; and let abort take care of the rest
 41122                                  
 41123                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41124                                  ;
 41125                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41126                                  
 41127                                  STAY_RESIDENT:
 41128                                  	;mov	ax,3100h
 41129 00006E6D B80031                  	mov	AX,(KEEP_PROCESS<<8)+0 ; Lower part is return code;PBUGBUG
 41130 00006E70 83C20F                  	add	DX,15
 41131 00006E73 D1DA                    	rcr	DX,1
 41132 00006E75 B103                    	mov	CL,3
 41133 00006E77 D3EA                    	shr	DX,CL

 41150

 41152                                  	; DOSCODE:A173h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41153                                  
 41154                                  	; 09/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 41155                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B3F4h
 41156                                  _$EXIT:
 41157                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41158                                  	; IBMDOSDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 6375h
 41159 00006E7C 30E4                    	xor	AH,AH
 41160 00006E7E 368626[4D03]            	xchg	AH,[SS:DidCTRLC]
 41161 00006E83 08E4                    	or	AH,AH
 41162                                  	;mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0
 41163 00006E85 36C606[7C05]00          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_TERMINATE
 41164 00006E8B 7406                    	jz	short exit_inner
 41165                                  	;mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],1
 41166 00006E8D 36C606[7C05]01          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_CTRL_C
 41167                                  
 41168                                  	;entry	Exit_inner
 41169                                  exit_inner:
 41170 00006E93 E8F595                  	call	Get_User_Stack		;PBUGBUG
 41171                                  
 41172 00006E96 36FF36[3003]            	push	word [ss:CurrentPDB]
 41173                                  	;pop	word [si+14h]
 41174 00006E9B 8F4414                  	pop	word [SI+user_env.user_CS] ;PBUGBUG
 41175 00006E9E EB08                    	jmp	short abort_inner
 41176                                  
 41177                                  ;BREAK <$ABORT -- Terminate a process>
 41178                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41179                                  ; Inputs:
 41180                                  ;	user_CS:00 must point to valid program header block
 41181                                  ; Function:
 41182                                  ;	Restore terminate and Cntrl-C addresses, flush buffers and transfer
 41183                                  ;	to the terminate address
 41184                                  ; Returns:
 41185                                  ;	TO THE TERMINATE ADDRESS
 41186                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41187                                  
 41188                                  _$ABORT:
 41189 00006EA0 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 41190                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0
 41191                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],AL ; = 0
 41192 00006EA2 36C606[7C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_ABORT
 41193                                  
 41194                                  	; abort_inner must have AL set as the exit code! The exit type
 41195                                  	; is retrieved from exit_type. Also, the PDB at user_CS needs
 41196                                  	; to be correct as the one that is terminating.
 41197                                  
 41198                                  abort_inner:
 41199 00006EA8 368A26[7C05]            	mov	AH,[SS:EXIT_TYPE]
 41200 00006EAD 36A3[3403]              	mov	[SS:exit_code],AX
 41201 00006EB1 E8D795                  	call	Get_User_Stack
 41202                                  
 41203                                  	;mov	ds,[si+14h]
 41204 00006EB4 8E5C14                  	mov	DS,[SI+user_env.user_CS] ; set up old interrupts ;PBUGBUG
 41205 00006EB7 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 41206 00006EB9 8EC0                    	mov	ES,AX
 41207                                  	;mov	si,10
 41208 00006EBB BE0A00                  	mov	SI,SAVEXIT
 41209                                  	;mov	di,88h
 41210 00006EBE BF8800                  	mov	DI,addr_int_terminate
 41211 00006EC1 A5                      	movsw
 41212 00006EC2 A5                      	movsw
 41213 00006EC3 A5                      	movsw
 41214 00006EC4 A5                      	movsw
 41215 00006EC5 A5                      	movsw
 41216 00006EC6 A5                      	movsw
 41217 00006EC7 E975EF                  	jmp	reset_environment
 41218

 41413                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 41414                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41415                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 41416                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41417                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 41418                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 41419                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41420                                  
 41421                                  arena_next:
 41422 00006F04 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 41423 00006F06 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 41424 00006F0A 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 41425                                  
 41426                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 41427                                  ;
 41428                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 41429                                  ;       RETN
 41430                                  
 41431                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 41432                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41433                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 41434                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41435                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 41436                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 41437                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 41438                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 41439                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41440                                  
 41441                                  check_signature:        
 41442                                  
 41443 00006F0B 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 41444                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 41445 00006F0D 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 41446                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 41447 00006F11 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 41448                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 41449 00006F13 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 41450                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 41451 00006F17 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 41452 00006F19 F9                              STC                             ; set error
 41453                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 41454                                  ;AFP_RETN:	; 10/03/2024
 41455                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 41456                                  check_signature_ok:
 41457                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 41458 00006F1A C3                      	RETN
 41459                                  
 41460                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 41461                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41462                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 41463                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 41464                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 41465                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 41466                                  ;
 41467                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 41468                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41469                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41470                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 41471                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 41472                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 41473                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 41474                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41475                                          
 41476                                  Coalesce:
 41477                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 41478 00006F1B 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 41479                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 41480                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 41481 00006F1E 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 41482 00006F20 E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 41483                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 41484 00006F23 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 41485                                  
 41486                                  coalesce_check:
 41487                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 41488 00006F25 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 41489                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 41490 00006F2A 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 41491                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 41492 00006F2C 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 41493 00006F31 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 41494                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 41495 00006F32 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 41496 00006F36 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 41497 00006F39 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 41498 00006F3B EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again
 41499                                  
 41500                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41501                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 41502                                  
 41503                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 41504                                  
 41505                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41506                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41507                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 41508                                  ;
 41509                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 41510                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 41511                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 41512                                  ;
 41513                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 41514                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 41515                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 41516                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 41517                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 41518                                  ;
 41519                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 41520                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 41521                                  ;
 41522                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 41523                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41524                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41525                                  ;           INT     21h
 41526                                  ;
 41527                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 41528                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 41529                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 41530                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 41531                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 41532                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 41533                                  ;
 41534                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 41535                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 41536                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 41537                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 41538                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 41539                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 41540                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 41541                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 41542                                  ;	USES	All
 41543                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41544                                  
 41545                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41546                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41547                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 41548                                  ;
 41549                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41550                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41551                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41552                                  ;           INT     21h
 41553                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 41554                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 41555                                  ;
 41556                                  ;   Description:
 41557                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 41558                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 41559                                  ;
 41560                                  ;   Error return:
 41561                                  ;           AX = error_not_enough_memory
 41562                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41563                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41564                                  
 41565                                  ; DOSCODE:A28Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41566                                  
 41567                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41568                                  ; DOSCODE:A22Eh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)

 41903                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41904                                  
 41905                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41906                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41907                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 41908                                  ;
 41909                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 41910                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 41911                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 41912                                  ;
 41913                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 41914                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 41915                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 41916                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 41917                                  ;
 41918                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 41919                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 41920                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 41921                                  ;		code.
 41922                                  ;
 41923                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 41924                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 41925                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 41926                                  ;
 41927                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41928                                  ;		'C' set if error
 41929                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 41930                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 41931                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 41932                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 41933                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 41934                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 41935                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41936                                  
 41937                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41938                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41939                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41940                                  ;
 41941                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41942                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 41943                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 41944                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 41945                                  ;           INT     21h
 41946                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 41947                                  ;         size possible
 41948                                  ;   Error return:
 41949                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 41950                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41951                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 41952                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 41953                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41954                                  
 41955                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 41956                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41957                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 41958 0000708E E807A8                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 41959                                  
 41960 00007091 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE
 41961 00007094 8CC0                            MOV     AX,ES
 41962 00007096 48                              DEC     AX
 41963 00007097 E871FE                          CALL    check_signature
 41964 0000709A 7303                            JNC     SHORT setblock_grab
 41965                                  
 41966                                  setblock_bad:
 41967 0000709C E905FF                          JMP     alloc_trashed
 41968                                  
 41969                                  setblock_grab:
 41970 0000709F 8ED8                            MOV     DS,AX
 41971 000070A1 E877FE                          CALL    Coalesce

 42050                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42051                                  
 42052                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42053                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42054                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 42055                                  ;
 42056                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42057                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42058                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42059                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42060                                  ;           INT     21h
 42061                                  ;
 42062                                  ;	ENTRY	
 42063                                  ;		(al) = 0
 42064                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 42065                                  ;
 42066                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 42067                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 42068                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 42069                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 42070                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 42071                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 42072                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 42073                                  ;
 42074                                  ;		(al) = 2
 42075                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 42076                                  ;
 42077                                  ;		(al) = 3
 42078                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 42079                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 42080                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 42081                                  ;
 42082                                  ;
 42083                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42084                                  ;
 42085                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 42086                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 42087                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 42088                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 42089                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 42090                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 42091                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 42092                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 42093                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 42094                                  ;
 42095                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42096                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 42097                                  ;
 42098                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 42099                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 42100                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 42101                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 42102                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 42103                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42104                                  
 42105                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42106                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42107                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42108                                  ;
 42109                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42110                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42111                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42112                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42113                                  ;           INT     21h
 42114                                  ;
 42115                                  ;   Error return:
 42116                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 42117                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42118                                  
 42119                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42120                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42121                                  _$ALLOCOPER:

 42338                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42339                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42340                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 42341                                  ;
 42342                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 42343                                  ;
 42344                                  ;
 42345                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 42346                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 42347                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 42348                                  ;		   else
 42349                                  ;			DS = last arena
 42350                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 42351                                  ;
 42352                                  ;		   CY if error
 42353                                  ;
 42354                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 42355                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42356                                  
 42357                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42358                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42359                                  
 42360                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42361                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 42362                                  
 42363                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42364                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B6D9h
 42365                                  
 42366                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A4D6h)
 42367                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:9F25h)
 42368                                  
 42369                                  GetLastArena:
 42370 00007157 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 42371                                  
 42372 00007158 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 42373 0000715C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 42374 0000715E 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 42375                                  
 42376 00007160 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42377                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42378 00007164 7416                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES
 42379                                  
 42380                                  GLA_next:
 42381 00007166 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42382 00007168 E899FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42383                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42384                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42385                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42386 0000716B 7222                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42387                                  
 42388                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42389                                  %if 0
 42390                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42391                                  	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is
 42392                                  					;    umb_head
 42393                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 42394                                  %else
 42395                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42396                                  	;;;
 42397 0000716D E85BFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42398 00007170 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb
 42399                                  	;;;
 42400                                  %endif
 42401 00007172 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42402                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42403 00007176 EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 42404                                  GLA_chkumb:
 42405 00007178 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42406                                  GLA_@f:
 42407 0000717A 75EA                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 42408                                  
 42409                                  GLA_done:
 42410                                  
 42411                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42412                                  %if 0
 42413                                  					; M061 - Start
 42414                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42415                                  	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 42416                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next
 42417                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 42418                                  %else
 42419                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42420                                  	;;;
 42421 0000717C E84CFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42422 0000717F 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret ; cf=0
 42423                                  	;;;
 42424                                  %endif
 42425 00007181 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42426 00007183 E87EFD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42427                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42428 00007186 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42429 00007188 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42430 0000718A 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 42431                                  					; M061 - End
 42432                                  GLA_ret:
 42433                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42434                                  	;clc
 42435                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42436                                  	;clc
 42437 0000718C 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 42438 0000718D C3                      	retn				; M061
 42439                                  
 42440                                  GLA_err:
 42441 0000718E F9                      	stc				; M061
 42442                                  GLA_err2:
 42443 0000718F 58                      	pop	ax
 42444                                  
 42445                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 
 42446                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42447                                  	;;;
 42448 00007190 58                      	pop	ax	; return address to _$ALLOCOPER (the caller)
 42449 00007191 E84DA1                  	call	set_exerr_locus_mem
 42450 00007194 E910FE                  	jmp	alloc_trashed2	; (error return from _$ALLOCOPER)
 42451                                  	;;;
 42452                                  
 42453                                  	; 10/03/2024
 42454                                  	;retn

 42499 00007197 [9B71]                  SERVERTAB:	dw	SERVER_DISP

 42501 0000719B 0B                      SERVER_DISP:	db	(SERVER_DISP_END-SERVER_DISP-1)/2 ; = 11
 42502 0000719C [5072]                  		dw	SRV_CALL	; 0

 42523                                  ;
 42524                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 42525                                  ;
 42526                                  ; Inputs:
 42527                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 42528                                  ; Function:
 42529                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 42530                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 42531                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 42532                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 42533                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 42534                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 42535                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 42536                                  ;			CX User Index
 42537                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 42538                                  ;			BX = UID
 42539                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 42540                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 42541                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 42542                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 42543                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 42544                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 42545                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 42546                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 42547                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 42548                                  ;
 42549                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42550                                  
 42551                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42552                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B735h
 42553                                  
 42554                                  _$ServerCall:
 42555                                  	; 13/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42556                                  	; DOSCODE:A4D2h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)		
 42557                                  	; 10/06/2019
 42558                                  	; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 42560

 42563 000071B2 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7

 42609                                  ; Commit - iterate through the open file list and make sure that the
 42610                                  ; directory entries are correctly updated.

 42613                                  COMMIT_ALL:

 42635                                  					;      doesn't deadlock
