 42875                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 42876                                  
 42877                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 42878                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42879                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 42880                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 42881                                  ;
 42882                                  ;	NOTE:
 42883                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42884                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42885                                  ;
 42886                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 42887                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 42888                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 42889                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42890                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 42891                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 42892                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42893                                  
 42894                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42895                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42896                                  
 42897                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 42898                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42899                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42900 000072E5 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42901                                  	
 42902                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 42903 000072EA 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 42904                                  
 42905                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 42906 000072EF 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 42907 000072F4 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 42908                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42909                                  	;mov	al,6
 42910 000072F6 B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42911                                  ReturnCarry:
 42912 000072F8 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 42913 000072F9 C3                      	retn				; go back
 42914                                  pjfn10: 
 42915                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 42916 000072FA 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 42917 000072FF 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 42918                                  	;clc
 42919                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 42920 00007301 C3                      	retn
 42921                                  
 42922                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 42923                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42924                                  ;
 42925                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 42926                                  ;
 42927                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 42928                                  ;
 42929                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 42930                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 42931                                  ;                   AX has error code
 42932                                  ;               Carry Reset
 42933                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 42934                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 42935                                  ; NOTE:
 42936                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42937                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42938                                  ;
 42939                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42940                                  
 42941                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42942                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42943                                  
 42944                                  SFFromHandle:
 42945 00007302 E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 42946                                  	;retc				; return if error
 42947 00007305 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 42948 00007307 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 42949                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42950                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42951                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42952                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42953                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42954                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42955 0000730B 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 42956                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42957                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42958                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42959                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42960                                  GetSF:
 42961 0000730D 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 42962 0000730E 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 42963 00007311 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 42964 00007313 E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 42965 00007316 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 42966 00007317 C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 42967                                  
 42968                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 42969                                  
 42970                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 42971                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42972                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 42973                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 42974                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 42975                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 42976                                  ;
 42977                                  ;   NOTE:
 42978                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 42979                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42980                                  ;
 42981                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 42982                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42983                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 42984                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 42985                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 42986                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42987                                  
 42988                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42989                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42990                                  
 42991                                  SFFromSFN:
 42992                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42993                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42994 00007318 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42995                                  
 42996                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 42997 0000731D 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 42998                                  sfsfn5:	
 42999                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 43000 00007322 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 43001 00007326 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 43002                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 43003 00007328 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 43004 0000732C 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 43005                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 43006 0000732F 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 43007 00007332 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 43008 00007334 F9                      	STC
 43009 00007335 C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 43010                                  sfsfn7:
 43011 00007336 50                      	push	ax
 43012                                  	;;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 43013                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 5.0 to PCDOS 7.1 (to Win ME) ; 11/03/2024
 43014                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 43015                                  	
 43016                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43017 00007337 B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 43018                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43019                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 43020                                  	
 43021 00007339 F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 43022 0000733B 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 43023 0000733D 58                      	pop	ax
 43024                                  	;add	di,6
 43025 0000733E 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 43026 00007341 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 43027                                  
 43028                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 43029                                  
 43030                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 43031                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43032                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 43033                                  ;
 43034                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43035                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43036                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 43037                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 43038                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43039                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43040                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 43041                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43042                                  
 43043                                  JFNFree:
 43044 00007342 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 43045                                  jfnf1:	
 43046 00007344 E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 43047 00007347 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 43048 00007349 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 43049 0000734D 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 43050 0000734F 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 43051 00007350 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 43052                                  
 43053                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 43054                                  jfnf5:	
 43055                                  	;mov	al,4
 43056 00007352 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 43057                                  jfnfx:	
 43058 00007354 C3                      	retn				; bye
 43059                                  
 43060                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 43061                                  
 43062                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 43063                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43064                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 43065                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43066                                  ;
 43067                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 43068                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 43069                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 43070                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 43071                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 43072                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 43073                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 43074                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 43075                                  ;
 43076                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 43077                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 43078                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 43079                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 43080                                  ;
 43081                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43082                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 43083                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 43084                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43085                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43086                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43087                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43088                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 43089                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43090                                  
 43091                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43092                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43093                                  
 43094                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43095                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B8DEh
 43096                                  
 43097                                  SFNFree:
 43098                                  	; 12/08/2018
 43099                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43100                                  	;
 43101                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 43102 00007355 50                      	push	ax
 43103 00007356 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 43104                                  sfnf5:	
 43105 00007358 53                      	push	bx
 43106 00007359 E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 43107 0000735C 5B                      	pop	bx
 43108 0000735D 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 43109 0000735F 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 43110                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 43111 00007363 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 43112                                  	
 43113                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 43114 00007365 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43115                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43116 00007369 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 43117                                  sfnf7:	
 43118 0000736B 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 43119 0000736C EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 43120                                  
 43121                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 43122                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 43123                                  ;
 43124                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43125                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43126                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43127                                  
 43128                                  sfnf10:	
 43129 0000736E 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43130                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43131 00007372 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43132 00007376 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 43133 00007378 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43134                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 43135 0000737C 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43136 00007380 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 43137                                  
 43138                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 43139                                  ;
 43140                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43141                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43142                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43143                                  
 43144                                  sfnf20:
 43145                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43146                                  
 43147                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 43148 00007382 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43149                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 43150                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43151                                  
 43152 00007387 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43153                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43154 0000738B 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43155 0000738F 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43156                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 43157 00007393 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43158                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43159                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43160                                  	;pop	ax
 43161                                  	;;clc
 43162                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 43163                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43164 00007397 58                      	pop	ax
 43165                                  	;clc
 43166 00007398 C3                      	retn
 43167                                  
 43168                                  ;**	Error - no more free SFNs
 43169                                  ;
 43170                                  ;	'C' set
 43171                                  ;	(TOS) = saved ax
 43172                                  
 43173                                  sfnf95: 
 43174 00007399 58                      	pop	ax
 43175                                  
 43176                                  ; 11/03/2024
 43177                                  %if 0
 43178                                  	;mov	al,4
 43179                                  	mov	al,error_too_many_open_files
 43180                                  	retn				; return with 'C' and error
 43181                                  %else
 43182                                  	; 11/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43183                                  	;;;
 43184 0000739A EBB6                    	jmp	short jfnf5
 43185                                  	;;;
 43186                                  %endif

 43197                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 43198                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43199                                  ;
 43200                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 43201                                  ;
 43202                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 43203                                  ;		path
 43204                                  ;
 43205                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43206                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 43207                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 43208                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 43209                                  ;
 43210                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43211                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 43212                                  ;	USES	all
 43213                                  ;
 43214                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43215                                  
 43216                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43217                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43218                                  
 43219                                  ; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43220                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B926h
 43221                                  
 43222                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A145h)
 43223                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A72Bh)
 43224                                  
 43225                                  _$CLOSE:
 43226                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 43227                                  
 43228 0000739C E8F602                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 43229 0000739F 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 43230 000073A1 16                      	push	ss
 43231 000073A2 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 43232 000073A3 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 43233 000073A7 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 43234                                  
 43235                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 43236                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 43237                                  ;
 43238                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 43239                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT; if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 43240                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.
 43241                                  
 43242                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 43243 000073AB 26833D01                	cmp	word [ES:DI],1		; will the SFT become free?
 43244 000073AF 740A                    	jz	short FreeJFN 		; yes, free JFN anyway.
 43245                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 43246 000073B1 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 43247                                  	;and	al,0F0h
 43248 000073B5 24F0                    	AND	AL,SHARING_MASK
 43249                                  	;cmp	al,70h
 43250 000073B7 3C70                    	CMP	AL,SHARING_NET_FCB
 43251 000073B9 7407                    	JZ	short PostFree		; 70-mode and big ref count => free it
 43252                                  
 43253                                  ; The JFN must be freed. Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 43254                                  ; -1.
 43255                                  
 43256                                  FreeJFN:
 43257 000073BB E827FF                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; d = pJFN (handle);
 43258 000073BE 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN
 43259                                  PostFree:
 43260                                  
 43261                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!
 43262                                  
 43263 000073C2 E84DC2                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 43264                                  
 43265                                  ; DOS_Close may return an error. If we see such an error, we report it but
 43266                                  ; the JFN stays closed because DOS_Close always frees the SFT!
 43267                                  
 43268 000073C5 7205                    	JC	short CloseError
 43269                                  	;mov	ah,3Eh
 43270 000073C7 B43E                    	MOV	AH,CLOSE		; MZ Bogus multiplan fix
 43271                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43272                                  CloseOk:
 43273 000073C9 E9B392                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 43274                                  CloseError:
 43275                                  CommitError:	; 11/03/2024
 43276 000073CC E9BA92                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 43277                                  
 43278                                  ;	BREAK <$Commit - commit the file>
 43279                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43280                                  ;
 43281                                  ;**	$Commit - Commit a File
 43282                                  ;
 43283                                  ;	$Commit "commits" a file to disk - all of it's buffers are
 43284                                  ;	flushed out. BUGBUG - I'm pretty sure that $Commit doesn't update
 43285                                  ;	the directory entry, etc., so this commit is pretty useless. check
 43286                                  ;	and fix this!! jgl
 43287                                  ;
 43288                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43289                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 43290                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Commit
 43291                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 43292                                  ;
 43293                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43294                                  ;	EXIT	none
 43295                                  ;	USES	all
 43296                                  ;;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43297                                  
 43298                                  _$COMMIT:
 43299                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 43300                                  
 43301 000073CF E8C302                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 43302                                  	;JC	short CommitError	; error return
 43303                                  	; 11/03/2024
 43304 000073D2 72F8                    	jc	short CommitError
 43305                                  
 43306 000073D4 16                      	push	ss
 43307 000073D5 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_COMMIT
 43308 000073D6 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 43309 000073DA 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 43310                                  
 43311                                  ;	ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_COMMIT
 43312                                  ;
 43313                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 43314                                  
 43315 000073DE E88EC3                  	call	DOS_COMMIT
 43316 000073E1 72E9                    	JC	short CommitError
 43317                                  	; 07/12/2022
 43318                                  	;jc	short CloseError
 43319                                  	;mov	ah,68h
 43320 000073E3 B468                    	MOV	AH,COMMIT
 43321                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43322                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 43323                                  CommitOk:
 43324 000073E5 EBE2                    	jmp	short CloseOk
 43325                                  
 43326                                  ; 11/03/2024
 43327                                  ;CommitError:
 43328                                  ;	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43329                                  ;	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 43330                                  ;	jmp	short CloseError

 43332                                  ;	BREAK <$ExtHandle - extend handle count>
 43333                                  
 43334                                  ;**	$ExtHandle - Extend Handle Count
 43335                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43336                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43337                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Number of Opens Allowed (MAX=65534;66535 is
 43338                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 6700H			 reserved to mark SFT
 43339                                  ;	    INT     int_command 		 busy )
 43340                                  ;
 43341                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = new number of handles
 43342                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43343                                  ;		'C' set iff err
 43344                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 43345                                  ;			 AX = error_not_enough_memory
 43346                                  ;			      error_too_many_open_files
 43347                                  ;	USES	all
 43348                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43349                                  
 43350                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43351                                  
 43352                                  _$ExtHandle:
 43353 000073E7 31ED                    	XOR	BP,BP			; 0: enlarge  1: shrink  2:psp
 43354                                  	;cmp	bx,20
 43355 000073E9 83FB14                  	CMP	BX,FILPERPROC
 43356 000073EC 7303                    	JAE	short exth2		; Don't set less than FilPerProc no
 43357 000073EE BB1400                  	MOV	BX,FILPERPROC
 43358                                  exth2:	
 43359 000073F1 368E06[3003]            	MOV	ES,[ss:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block;smr;SS Override
 43360                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:32h]
 43361 000073F6 268B0E3200              	MOV	CX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; get number of handle allowed
 43362 000073FB 39CB                    	CMP	BX,CX			; the requested == current
 43363                                  	;JE	short ok_done 		; yes and exit
 43364                                  	; 11/03/2024
 43365 000073FD 74CA                    	je	short CloseOk
 43366 000073FF 771E                    	JA	short larger		; go allocate new table
 43367                                  
 43368                                  ;	We're going to shrink the # of handles available
 43369                                  
 43370                                  	;MOV	BP,1			; shrink
 43371                                  	; 11/03/2024
 43372 00007401 45                      	inc	bp
 43373                                  
 43374                                  	;mov	ds,[ES:36h]
 43375 00007402 268E1E3600              	MOV	DS,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer+2] ;
 43376 00007407 89DE                    	MOV	SI,BX			;
 43377 00007409 29D9                    	SUB	CX,BX			; get difference
 43378                                  
 43379                                  ;	BUGBUG - code a SCASB here, should be a bit smaller
 43380                                  chck_handles:
 43381 0000740B 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],-1		; scan through handles to ensure close
 43382 0000740E 7539                    	JNZ	short too_many_files	; status
 43383 00007410 46                      	INC	SI
 43384 00007411 E2F8                    	LOOP	chck_handles
 43385                                  
 43386 00007413 83FB14                  	CMP	BX,FILPERPROC		; = 20
 43387 00007416 7707                    	JA	short larger		; no
 43388                                  
 43389                                  	;MOV	BP,2			; psp
 43390                                  	; 11/03/2024
 43391 00007418 45                      	inc	bp	
 43392                                  	;mov	di,24
 43393 00007419 BF1800                  	MOV	DI,PDB.JFN_TABLE	; es:di -> jfn table in psp
 43394 0000741C 53                      	PUSH	BX
 43395 0000741D EB1B                    	JMP	short movhandl
 43396                                  
 43397                                  larger:
 43398                                  	;CMP	BX,-1			; 65535 is not allowed
 43399                                  	;JZ	short invalid_func	; 10/08/2018
 43400                                  	; 11/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43401                                  	;;;
 43402 0000741F 43                      	inc	bx
 43403 00007420 747D                    	jz	short invalid_func
 43404 00007422 4B                      	dec	bx
 43405                                  	;;;
 43406 00007423 F8                      	CLC
 43407 00007424 53                      	PUSH	BX			; save requested number
 43408 00007425 83C30F                  	ADD	BX,0FH			; adjust to paragraph boundary
 43409 00007428 B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 43410                                  	;ror	bx,cl			; MSDOS 3.3
 43411 0000742A D3DB                    	RCR	BX,CL			; DOS 4.00 fix		;AC000;
 43412                                  	;AND	BX,1FFFH		; clear most 3 bits
 43413                                  	; 01/07/2024
 43414 0000742C 80E71F                  	and	bh,1Fh
 43415                                  
 43416 0000742F 55                      	PUSH	BP
 43417 00007430 E80AFB                  	call	_$ALLOC			; allocate memory
 43418 00007433 5D                      	POP	BP
 43419 00007434 7264                    	JC	short no_memory		; not enough memory
 43420                                  
 43421 00007436 8EC0                    	MOV	ES,AX			; es:di points to new table memory
 43422 00007438 31FF                    	XOR	DI,DI
 43423                                  movhandl:
 43424 0000743A 368E1E[3003]            	MOV	DS,[ss:CurrentPDB] 	; get user PDB address	;smr;SS Override
 43425                                  
 43426 0000743F F7C50300                	test	BP,3			; enlarge ?
 43427 00007443 7409                    	JZ	short enlarge 		; yes
 43428 00007445 59                      	POP	CX			; cx = the amount you shrink
 43429 00007446 51                      	PUSH	CX
 43430 00007447 EB09                    	JMP	short copy_hand
 43431                                  
 43432                                  ;	Done.  'C' clear
 43433                                  
 43434                                  ; 17/12/2022
 43435                                  ;ok_done:
 43436                                  ;	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43437                                  ;	;jmp	short CommitOk
 43438                                  ;	; 17/12/2022
 43439                                  ;	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 43440                                  
 43441                                  too_many_files:
 43442                                  	;mov	al,4
 43443 00007449 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 43444                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43445                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 43446                                  CommitErrorj:
 43447                                  	;jmp	short CommitError
 43448                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43449 0000744B E93B92                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 43450                                  
 43451                                  ; 11/03/2024
 43452                                  ; 17/12/2022
 43453                                  ;ok_done:
 43454                                  ;	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43455                                  ;	;jmp	short CommitOk
 43456                                  ;	; 17/12/2022
 43457                                  ;	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 43458                                  
 43459                                  enlarge:
 43460                                  	;mov	cx,[32h]
 43461 0000744E 8B0E3200                	MOV	CX,[PDB.JFN_Length]	; get number of old handles
 43462                                  copy_hand:
 43463 00007452 89CA                    	MOV	DX,CX
 43464                                  	;lds	si,[34h]
 43465 00007454 C5363400                	LDS	SI,[PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get old table pointer
 43466 00007458 F3A4                    	REP	MOVSB			; copy information to new table
 43467 0000745A 59                      	POP	CX			; get new number of handles
 43468 0000745B 51                      	PUSH	CX			; save it again
 43469 0000745C 29D1                    	SUB	CX,DX			; get the difference
 43470 0000745E B0FF                    	MOV	AL,-1			; set availability to handles
 43471 00007460 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 43472 00007462 368E1E[3003]            	MOV	DS,[ss:CurrentPDB] 	; get user process data block;smr;SS Override
 43473                                  	;cmp	word [34h],0
 43474 00007467 833E340000              	CMP	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer],0 ; check if original table pointer
 43475 0000746C 750D                    	JNZ	short update_info	; yes, go update PDB entries
 43476 0000746E 55                      	PUSH	BP
 43477 0000746F 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save old table segment
 43478 00007470 06                      	PUSH	ES			; save new table segment
 43479 00007471 8E063600                	MOV	ES,[PDB.JFN_Pointer+2]	; get old table segment
 43480 00007475 E83AFC                  	call	_$DEALLOC		; deallocate old table memory
 43481 00007478 07                      	POP	ES			; restore new table segment
 43482 00007479 1F                      	POP	DS			; restore old table segment
 43483 0000747A 5D                      	POP	BP
 43484                                  
 43485                                  update_info:
 43486 0000747B F7C50200                	test	BP,2			; psp?
 43487 0000747F 7408                    	JZ	short non_psp 		; no
 43488                                  	;mov	word [34h],18h ; 24
 43489 00007481 C70634001800            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer],PDB.JFN_TABLE ; restore
 43490 00007487 EB06                    	JMP	short final
 43491                                  non_psp:
 43492                                  	;mov	word [34h],0
 43493 00007489 C70634000000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer],0 ; new table pointer offset always 0
 43494                                  final:
 43495                                  	;mov	[36h],es	
 43496 0000748F 8C063600                	MOV	[PDB.JFN_Pointer+2],ES	; update table pointer segment
 43497                                  	;pop	word [32h]
 43498 00007493 8F063200                	POP	word [PDB.JFN_Length]	; restore new number of handles
 43499                                  	; 11/03/2024
 43500                                  ok_done:
 43501                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43502 00007497 E9E591                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 43503                                  ;ok_done_j:
 43504                                  ;	jmp	short ok_done

 43531                                  ;	BREAK <$READ - Read from a file handle>
 43532                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43533                                  ;
 43534                                  ;**	$Read - Read from a File Handle
 43535                                  ;
 43536                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 43537                                  ;
 43538                                  ;	LDS	DX, buf
 43539                                  ;	MOV	CX, count
 43540                                  ;	MOV	BX, handle
 43541                                  ;	MOV	AH, Read
 43542                                  ;	INT	int_command
 43543                                  ;	  AX has number of bytes read
 43544                                  ;
 43545                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = file handle
 43546                                  ;		(cx) = byte count
 43547                                  ;		(ds:dx) = buffer address
 43548                                  ;	EXIT	Through system call return so that to user:
 43549                                  ;		  'C' clear if OK
 43550                                  ;		    (ax) = bytes read
 43551                                  ;		  'C' set if error
 43552                                  ;		    (ax) = error code
 43553                                  ;
 43554                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43555                                  
 43556                                  	; 12/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43557                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BA2Eh
 43558                                  
 43559                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A83Ah)
 43560                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A256h)
 43561                                  
 43562                                  _$READ:
 43563 000074A3 BE[FC39]                	MOV	SI,DOS_READ
 43564                                  ReadDo:
 43565 000074A6 E83CFE                  	call	pJFNFromHandle
 43566 000074A9 7208                    	JC	short ReadError
 43567                                  
 43568 000074AB 268A05                  	MOV	AL,[ES:DI]
 43569 000074AE E8E401                  	call	CheckOwner		; get the handle
 43570 000074B1 7303                    	JNC	short ReadSetup		; no errors do the operation
 43571                                  
 43572                                  ;	Have an error. 'C' set
 43573                                  
 43574                                  ReadError:
 43575                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43576                                  	;;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR		; go to error traps
 43577                                  	;jmp	short CommitErrorj3
 43578                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43579 000074B3 E9D391                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 43580                                  
 43581                                  ReadSetup:
 43582 000074B6 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[ss:THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer;smr;SS Override
 43583 000074BB 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[ss:THISSFT+2],ES	; save segment value	;smr;SS Override
 43584                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43585                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 
 43586                                  ;; Extended Open
 43587                                  	;test	byte [es:di+3],20h
 43588 000074C0 26F6450320              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode+1],(INT_24_ERROR>>8)
 43589                                  						 ;AN000;;EO. need i24
 43590 000074C5 7406                    	JZ	short needi24 		     	 ;AN000;;EO. yes
 43591 000074C7 36800E[F605]02          	OR	byte [ss:EXTOPEN_ON],EXT_OPEN_I24_OFF ; 2
 43592                                  					;AN000;;EO. set it off;smr;SS Override
 43593                                  needi24:				;AN000;
 43594                                  
 43595                                  ; 12/03/2024
 43596                                  %if 0
 43597                                  
 43598                                  ;; Extended Open
 43599                                  	push	word [SS:DMAADD]
 43600                                  	push	word [SS:DMAADD+2]	;smr;SS Override

 44328                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 44329                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44330                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 44331                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 44332                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 44333                                  ;   that it does not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 44334                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 44335                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 44336                                  ;
 44337                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 44338                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 44339                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 44340                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 44341                                  ;	USES	none
 44342                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44343                                  
 44344                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44345                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44346                                  CheckOwner:
 44347                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44348                                  
 44349 00007695 E86AFC                  	call	SFFromHandle
 44350 00007698 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 44351                                  
 44352 0000769A 50                      	push	ax
 44353                                  
 44354                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 44355                                  
 44356                                  ;SR; WIN386 patch - Do not check for USER_ID for using handles since these 
 44357                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.
 44358                                  
 44359 0000769B 36F606[450F]01          	test	byte [ss:IsWin386],1 ; 02/06/2019
 44360 000076A1 7404                    	jz	short no_win386		;win386 is not present
 44361 000076A3 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			;set the zero flag
 44362 000076A5 EB08                    	jmp	short _skip_win386	
 44363                                  
 44364                                  no_win386:
 44365 000076A7 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]		;smr;SS Override
 44366                                  	;cmp	ax,[es:di+47]
 44367 000076AB 263B452F                	cmp	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID]
 44368                                  
 44369                                  _skip_win386:
 44370 000076AF 58                      	pop	ax
 44371                                  	
 44372                                  	; 17/12/2022
 44373 000076B0 7403                    	jz	short co_ret_label

 44375                                  	;jnz	short CheckOwner_err

 44392                                  
 44393                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 44394                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 44395                                  
 44396                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 44397                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 44398                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 44399                                  
 44400                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 44401                                  ;
 44402                                  ;	$AssignOper
 44403                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 44404                                  ;	InitCDS
 44405                                  ;	$UserOper
 44406                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 44407                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 44408                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 44409                                  ;
 44410                                  ;   Revision history:
 44411                                  ;
 44412                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 44413                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 44414                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 44415                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 44416                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 44417                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 44418                                  ;				    aliasing.
 44419                                  ;
 44420                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 44421                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 44422                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 44423                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 44424                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 44425                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 44426                                  ;
 44427                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 44428                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 44429                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 44430                                  ;
 44431                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 44432                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 44433                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 44434                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 44435                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 44436                                  ;
 44437                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 44438                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 44439                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 44440                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 44441                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 44442                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 44443                                  ;
 44444                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 44445                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 44446                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 44447                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 44448                                  ;   number.
 44449                                  ;
 44450                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 44451                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 44452                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 44453                                  ;   TransPath.
 44454                                  ;
 44455                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 44456                                  
 44457                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 44458                                  
 44459                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 44460                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 44461                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 44462                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 44463                                  ;					; current drive)
 44464                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 44465                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 44466                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 44467                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 44468                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 44469                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 44470                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 44471                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 44472                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error

 44474                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 44475                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44476                                  ; Inputs:
 44477                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 44478                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 44479                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 44480                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 44481                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 44482                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 44483                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 44484                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 44485                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 44486                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 44487                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44488                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 44489                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 44490                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44491                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 44492                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 44493                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 44494                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 44495                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 44496                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 44497                                  ; Function:
 44498                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 44499                                  ; Returns:
 44500                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 44501                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44502                                  
 44503                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44504                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 44507                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 44510                                  srinuse:								;AN000;

 44516                                  	;cmp	word [si+45h],0

 44518 000076C7 7410                    	JZ	short baddrv		      ;     no			;AN000;

 44526 000076D1 EB19                    	JMP	SHORT okdone		      ; 			;AN000;
 44527                                  resetdrv:

 44532 000076D7 EB13                    	JMP	SHORT okdone		      ; 			;AN000;

 44535                                  baddrv: 								;AN000;

 44539                                  	;JMP	SHORT ASS_ERR		      ; 			;AN000;
 44540                                  	; 17/12/2022
 44541                                  	; 21/05/2019
 44542                                  ASS_ERR:

 44544

 44548                                  
 44549                                    ;IF	NOT INSTALLED

 44551                                    ;ELSE
 44552                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)

 44554                                  	;mov	ax,111Eh

 44556 000076E4 B81E11                  	mov	ax,(MultNET*256)+30
 44557 000076E7 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - DO REDIRECTION
 44558                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 44559                                  			; STACK: WORD function to execute
 44560                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = error code
 44561                                  			; STACK unchanged

 44574                                  ;Break <FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a drive number>
 44575                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44576                                  ;**	FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a Drive #
 44577                                  ;
 44578                                  ;	ENTRY	AL has drive number A = 0
 44579                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set
 44580                                  ;		    No DPB for this drive number
 44581                                  ;		'C' clear
 44582                                  ;		    DS:SI points to DPB for drive
 44583                                  ;	USES	SI, DS, Flags
 44584                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44585                                  
 44586                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44587                                  FIND_DPB:
 44588 000076EF 36C536[2600]            	LDS	SI,[SS:DPBHEAD]		;smr;SS Override

 44674                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 44675                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44676                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 44677                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 44678                                  ;
 44679                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 44680                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 44681                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 44682                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 44683                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 44684                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 44685                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 44686                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 44687                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 44688                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 44689                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 44690                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44691                                  
 44692                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 44693                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44694                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 44700                                  	;POP	AX

 44986                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 44987                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44988                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 44989                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 44990                                  ;
 44991                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 44992                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 44993                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 44994                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 44995                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 44996                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 44997                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 44998                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44999                                  
 45000                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45001                                  TransFCB:
 45002                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45003                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45004                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 45005                                  	;ENTER
 45006 0000782B 55                      	push	bp
 45007 0000782C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 45008                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 45009 0000782E 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 45010 00007831 16                      	push	ss
 45011 00007832 07                      	pop	es
 45012 00007833 06                      	push	es
 45013 00007834 57                      	push	di
 45014                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 45015                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 45016 00007835 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 45017 00007838 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 45018 0000783E 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45019 00007844 E8B9A9                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 45020                                  	; 06/12/2022
 45021 00007847 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 45022 00007849 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 45023 0000784C 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45024 00007850 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 45025                                  GetDrive:
 45026 00007856 AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 45027 00007857 E862FF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 45028 0000785A 722A                    	jc	short BadPack
 45029 0000785C E86F03                  	call	TextFromDrive           ; convert 0-based drive to text
 45030                                  
 45031                                  ; Scan the source to see if there are any illegal chars
 45032                                  
 45033                                  	;mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 45034 0000785F B90B00                  	mov	cx,11
 45035 00007862 56                      	push	si			; back over name, ext
 45036                                  FCBScan:
 45037 00007863 AC                      	lodsb				; get a byte
 45038                                  	
 45039                                  	; 09/08/2018
 45040                                  	;;xlat	byte [es:bx]
 45041                                  	;es	xlat
 45042                                  
 45043                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 45045

 45051 0000786D 5E                      	pop	si
 45052 0000786E 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 45053 00007870 E8EAAD                  	call	PackName                ; crunch the path
 45054 00007873 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination
 45055 00007874 07                      	pop	es
 45056 00007875 16                      	push	ss			; get DS addressability
 45057 00007876 1F                      	pop	ds
 45058                                  	;lea	si,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 45059                                  	;LEA	SI,FCBTmp		; point at new pathname

 45061 0000787A 803F00                  	cmp	byte [bx],0
 45062 0000787D 7407                    	jz	short BadPack

 45065 00007883 5D                      	pop	bp

 45069                                  	;mov	al,3
 45070 00007887 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found

 45074 0000788B 5D                      	pop	bp
 45075                                  TransPath_retn:
