 45077                                  
 45078                                  ; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45079                                  
 45080                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 45081                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45082                                  ;
 45083                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 45084                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 45085                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 45086                                  ;       exactly.
 45087                                  ;
 45088                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 45089                                  ;       matches splice.
 45090                                  ;
 45091                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 45092                                  ;
 45093                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 45094                                  ;
 45095                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 45096                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 45097                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 45098                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 45099                                  ;
 45100                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 45101                                  ;
 45102                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 45103                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 45104                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 45105                                  ;
 45106                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 45107                                  ;
 45108                                  ;       if fSharing then
 45109                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45110                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45111                                  ;           splice
 45112                                  ;           fatRead
 45113                                  ;           return
 45114                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 45115                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 45116                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45117                                  ;           return
 45118                                  ;       if device then
 45119                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45120                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45121                                  ;           return
 45122                                  ;       if file then
 45123                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 45124                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 45125                                  ;           Copy current dir
 45126                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 45127                                  ;           splice
 45128                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 45129                                  ;           if local then
 45130                                  ;               fatread
 45131                                  ;           return
 45132                                  ;
 45133                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45134                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 45135                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45136                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 45137                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 45138                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 45139                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 45140                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 45141                                  ;
 45142                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45143                                  
 45144                                  ; 22/05/2019
 45145                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45146                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45147                                  
 45148                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45149                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45150                                  
 45151                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45152                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BE1Dh
 45153                                  
 45154                                  TransPath:
 45155 0000788D 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 45156 0000788F EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 45157                                  TransPathSet:
 45158 00007891 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45159                                  SetSplice:
 45160 00007893 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	; NoSetDir = !fExact;	;smr;SS Override
 45161 00007897 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45162                                  TransPathNoSet:
 45163 00007899 36A2[7105]              	MOV	[SS:FSPLICE],AL		; fSplice = TRUE;	;smr;SS Override
 45164 0000789D 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 45165 000078A3 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 45166 000078A8 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 45167 000078AF 16                      	push	ss
 45168 000078B0 07                      	pop	es
 45169                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45170 000078B1 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; end of buffer
 45171                                  ;
 45172                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 45173                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 45174                                  ;
 45175                                  	;TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 45176                                  	;JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 45177                                  	; 13/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45178                                  	;;;
 45179 000078B5 36803E[7205]00          	cmp	byte [ss:FSHARING],0
 45180 000078BB 7435                    	jz	short CheckUNC
 45181                                  	;;;
 45182                                  ;
 45183                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 45184                                  ;
 45185 000078BD E8F802                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 45186 000078C0 E8F9FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 45187 000078C3 722A                    	jc	short NoPath
 45188 000078C5 E80603                  	CALL	TextFromDrive		; drop in new
 45189 000078C8 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit
 45190 000078CB E83401                  	CALL	Canonicalize            ; copy and canonicalize
 45191 000078CE 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 45192                                  ;
 45193                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 45194                                  ;
 45195 000078D0 16                      	push	ss
 45196 000078D1 1F                      	pop	ds
 45197 000078D2 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START] 		; point to name
 45198 000078D6 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45199 000078DB 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice
 45200 000078DD E82D02                  	CALL    Splice
 45201                                  NoServerSplice:
 45202 000078E0 16                      	push	ss
 45203 000078E1 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD
 45204 000078E2 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; for fatread
 45205 000078E6 E8AF9F                  	call	ECritDisk
 45206 000078E9 E8BFE8                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 45207 000078EC E8D69F                  	call	LCritDisk
 45208                                  NoPath:
 45209                                  	;mov	al,3
 45210 000078EF B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45211 000078F1 C3                      	retn				; any errors are in Carry flag
 45212                                  
 45213                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 45214                                  ; the name if so.
 45215                                  
 45216                                  CheckUNC:
 45217 000078F2 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override
 45218                                  	;CallInstall NetSpoolCheck,MultNET,35
 45219 000078F9 B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 45220 000078FC CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 45221                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 45222                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name
 45223                                  			; Return: CF set if not resolved
 45224 000078FE 7329                    	JNC	short UNCDone
 45225                                  
 45226                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 45227                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 45228                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 45229                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 45230                                  
 45231                                  NO_CHECK:
 45232 00007900 E8B502                  	CALL    DriveFromText		; eat drive letter
 45233 00007903 50                      	PUSH    AX                      ; save it
 45234 00007904 8B04                    	MOV     AX,[SI]			; get first two bytes of path
 45235 00007906 E831E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45236 00007909 86E0                    	XCHG    AH,AL                   ; swap for second byte
 45237 0000790B E82CE1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45238 0000790E 751F                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; not a path char
 45239 00007910 38C4                    	CMP     AH,AL                   ; are they same?
 45240 00007912 751B                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; nope
 45241                                  
 45242                                  ; We have a UNC request. We must copy the string up to the beginning of the
 45243                                  ; local machine root path
 45244                                  
 45245 00007914 58                      	POP     AX
 45246 00007915 A5                      	MOVSW                           ; get the lead \\.
 45247                                  UNCCpy:
 45248 00007916 AC                      	LODSB                           ; get a byte
 45249 00007917 E8CDE0                   	call	UCase                   ;AN000;; convert the char
 45250 0000791A 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45251 0000791C 740E                    	JZ	short UNCTerm		; end of string. All done.
 45252 0000791E E819E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char?
 45253 00007921 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; backup position
 45254 00007923 AA                      	STOSB
 45255 00007924 75F0                    	JNZ	short UNCCpy		; no, go copy
 45256 00007926 E8D900                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham (and set cMeta)
 45257                                  UNCDone:
 45258 00007929 16                      	push	ss
 45259 0000792A 1F                      	pop	ds
 45260 0000792B C3                       	retn				; return error code
 45261                                  UNCTerm:
 45262 0000792C AA                      	STOSB                           ;AN000;
 45263 0000792D EBFA                    	JMP	short UNCDone		;AN000;
 45264                                  
 45265                                  CheckDevice:
 45266                                  
 45267                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 45268                                  
 45269 0000792F 58                      	POP     AX                      ; retrieve drive info
 45270 00007930 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		; check for null file
 45271 00007933 7504                    	JNZ	short CheckPath
 45272                                  	;mov	al,2 
 45273 00007935 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; bad file error
 45274 00007937 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error on null input
 45275 00007938 C3                      	RETN				; bye!
 45276                                  CheckPath:
 45277 00007939 50                      	push	ax
 45278 0000793A 55                      	push	bp			; save drive number
 45279                                  
 45280                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45281                                  %if 0
 45282                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45283                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 45284                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 45285                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 45286                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 45287                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 45288                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 45289                                  ;;;
 45290                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 45291                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 45292                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 45293                                  ;;;
 45294                                  ;;;More info:
 45295                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 45296                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 45297                                  ;;;
 45298                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45299                                  start5Dhack:
 45300                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice
 45301                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 45302                                  
 45303                                  %endif
 45304                                  
 45305                                  ; 13/03/2024
 45306                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BECBh
 45307                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC47h)
 45308                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6C2h))
 45309                                  %if 0
 45310                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45311                                  %else
 45312                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45313                                  
 45314                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45315                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 45316 0000793B E8C0D3                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 45317                                  %endif
 45318 0000793E 5D                      	pop	bp
 45319 0000793F 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 45320 00007940 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 45321                                  
 45322                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 45323                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 45324                                  ; call.
 45325                                  
 45326 00007942 36C606[7205]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; simulate sharing dos call;smr;SS Override
 45327 00007948 E871FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; set ThisCDS and init DUMMYCDS
 45328 0000794B 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 45329                                  
 45330                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 45331                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 45332                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 45333                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 45334                                  ; a device.
 45335                                  
 45336 00007951 E87A02                  	CALL    TextFromDrive
 45337 00007954 B02F                    	MOV     AL,'/'                  ; path sep.
 45338 00007956 AA                      	STOSB
 45339 00007957 E8489E                  	call	StrCpy			; move remainder of string
 45340                                  
 45341 0000795A F8                      	CLC                             ; everything OK.
 45342 0000795B 16                      	push	ss
 45343 0000795C 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; remainder of OK stuff
 45344                                  DoFile_retn:
 45345 0000795D C3                      	retn
 45346                                  
 45347                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45348                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BEEEh
 45349                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC6Ah)
 45350                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6F2h))
 45351                                  ;%if 1
 45352                                  
 45353                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45354                                  %if 0
 45355                                  
 45356                                  no5Dshere:
 45357                                  	; 10/08/2018
 45358                                  	jmp	CheckThisDevice		; snoop for device
 45359                                  %endif
 45360                                  
 45361                                  ;.erre (no5Dshere - start5Dhack - 5D)
 45362                                  
 45363                                  ; We have a file. Get the raw CDS.
 45364                                  
 45365                                  DoFile:
 45366                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 45367                                  
 45368 0000795E E83FFE                  	call	GetVisDrv               ; get proper CDS
 45369                                  	;mov	al,3 
 45370 00007961 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad file error
 45371 00007963 72F8                    	jc	short DoFile_retn  ; CARRY set -> bogus drive/spliced
 45372                                  
 45373                                  ; ThisCDS has correct CDS. DS:SI advanced to point to beginning of path/file.
 45374                                  ; Make sure that CDS has valid directory; ValidateCDS requires a temp buffer
 45375                                  ; Use the one that we are going to use (ES:DI).
 45376                                  
 45377                                  	;SAVE    <DS,SI,ES,DI>		; save all string pointers.
 45378 00007965 1E                      	push	ds
 45379 00007966 56                      	push	si
 45380 00007967 06                      	push	es
 45381 00007968 57                      	push	di
 45382 00007969 E8C5D2                  	call	ValidateCDS             ; poke CDS and make everything OK
 45383                                  	;RESTORE <DI,ES,SI,DS>		; get back pointers
 45384 0000796C 5F                      	pop	di
 45385 0000796D 07                      	pop	es
 45386 0000796E 5E                      	pop	si
 45387 0000796F 1F                      	pop	ds
 45388                                  	;mov	al,3
 45389 00007970 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45390                                  	;retc				; someone failed an operation
 45391 00007972 72E9                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45392                                  
 45393                                  ; ThisCDS points to correct CDS. It contains the correct text of the
 45394                                  ; current directory. Copy it in.
 45395                                  
 45396 00007974 1E                      	push	ds
 45397 00007975 56                      	push	si
 45398 00007976 36C536[A205]            	LDS     SI,[SS:THISCDS]		; point to CDS	;smr;SS Override
 45399 0000797B 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; point to destination
 45400                                  	;add	bx,[si+79] ; MSDOS 6.0
 45401 0000797D 035C4F                  	ADD     BX,[SI+curdir.end]	; point to backup limit
 45402                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45403 00007980 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; regenerate end of buffer
 45404                                  					;AN000;
 45405 00007984 E82A9E                  	call	FStrCpy                 ; copy string. ES:DI point to end
 45406 00007987 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to NUL byte
 45407                                  
 45408                                  ; Make sure that there is a path char at end.
 45409                                  
 45410 00007988 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 45411 0000798A 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 45412 0000798E 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 45413 00007990 AA                      	STOSB
 45414                                  
 45415                                  ; Now get original string.
 45416                                  
 45417                                  GetOrig:
 45418 00007991 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 45419 00007992 5E                      	pop	si
 45420 00007993 1F                      	pop	ds
 45421                                  
 45422                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 45423                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 45424                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 45426 00007994 E8CE00                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 45427 00007997 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char
 45428 00007999 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL                   ; end of string?
 45429 0000799B 7410                    	JZ	short DoCanon		; yes, skip.
 45430                                  ;
 45431                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 45432                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 45433                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 45434                                  ;
 45435 0000799D 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 45436                                  SkipPath:
 45437 0000799F AC                      	LODSB
 45438 000079A0 E897E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 45439 000079A3 74FA                    	JZ	short SkipPath
 45440 000079A5 4E                      	DEC     SI
 45441 000079A6 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45442 000079A8 7403                    	JZ	short DoCanon
 45443                                  
 45444                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in
 45445                                  ; for yucks.
 45446                                  
 45447                                  PathAssure:
 45448 000079AA B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 45449 000079AC AA                      	STOSB
 45450                                  
 45451                                  ; ES:DI point to the correct spot for canonicalization to begin.
 45452                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 45453                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..
 45454                                  
 45455                                  DoCanon:
 45456 000079AD E85200                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham.
 45457                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 45458 000079B0 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45459                                  
 45460                                  ; The string has been moved to ES:DI. Reset world to DOS context, pointers
 45461                                  ; to wfp_start and do string substitution. BP is still the max position in
 45462                                  ; buffer.
 45463                                  
 45464 000079B2 16                      	push	ss
 45465 000079B3 1F                      	pop	ds
 45466 000079B4 8B3E[B205]              	MOV     DI,[WFP_START]		; DS:SI point to string
 45467 000079B8 C536[A205]              	LDS     SI,[THISCDS]		; point to CDS
 45468 000079BC E81702                  	CALL    PathPref                ; is there a prefix?
 45469 000079BF 7514                    	JNZ	short DoSplice		; no, do splice
 45470                                  
 45471                                  ; We have a match. Check to see if we ended in a path char.
 45472                                  
 45473 000079C1 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]		; last char to match
 45474 000079C4 E873E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; did we end on a path char? (root)
 45475 000079C7 740C                    	JZ	short DoSplice		; yes, no current dir here.
 45476                                  Pathline:                               ; 2/13/KK
 45477 000079C9 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		; end at NUL?
 45478 000079CD 7406                    	JZ	short DoSplice
 45479 000079CF 47                      	INC     DI                      ; point to after current path char
 45480 000079D0 36893E[B605]            	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],DI	; point to correct spot ;smr;SS Override
 45481                                  
 45482                                  ; Splice the result.
 45483                                  
 45484                                  DoSplice:
 45485 000079D5 16                      	push	ss
 45486 000079D6 1F                      	pop	ds			; back to DOSDATA
 45487 000079D7 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START]		; point to beginning of string
 45488 000079DB 31C9                    	XOR     CX,CX
 45489 000079DD F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45490 000079E2 7403                    	JZ	short SkipSplice
 45491 000079E4 E82601                  	CALL    Splice                  ; replaces in place.
 45492                                  SkipSplice:

 45517                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 45518                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45519                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 45520                                  ;
 45521                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45522                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 45523                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 45524                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 45525                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45526                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 45527                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 45528                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 45529                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 45530                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 45531                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45532                                  
 45533                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45534                                  
 45535                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45536                                  
 45537                                  Canonicalize:
 45538                                  
 45539                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 45540                                  
 45541 00007A02 AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 45542 00007A03 E834E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 45543 00007A06 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 45544 00007A08 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 45545 00007A0A 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 45546 00007A0C AA                      	STOSB
 45547 00007A0D EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 45548                                  CanonDec:
 45549 00007A0F 4E                      	DEC     SI
 45550                                  
 45551                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 45552                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 45553                                  ; buffer.
 45554                                  
 45555                                  CanonLoop:
 45556                                  
 45557                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 45558                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 45559                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 45560

 45562 00007A12 3804                    	CMP     [SI],AL                 ;       if (*s == 0) {
 45563 00007A14 751A                    	JNZ	short DoComponent

 45565 00007A1B 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate

 45567 00007A1F AA                      	STOSB

 45569                                  DoTerminate:

 45586                                  ; We have a textual component that we must copy. We uppercase it and truncate
 45587                                  ; it to 8.3
 45588                                  
 45589                                  DoComponent:                            ;           }

 45591 00007A33 72FA                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn	;           return (-1);

 45593                                  ; We special case the . and .. cases. These will be backed up.
 45594                                  
 45595                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'.' + (0 SHL 8)
 45596 00007A35 26833D2E                	CMP	WORD [ES:DI],002Eh
 45597 00007A39 7408                    	JZ	short Skip1

 45605                                  	; 07/07/2024 (*)
 45606                                  	;MOV    AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error

 45608 00007A48 EB02                    	JMP     short CanonPath         ;           }

 45611                                  
 45612                                  CanonNormal:                            ;       else

 45614                                  
 45615                                  ; We have successfully copied a component. We are now pointing at a path

 45617                                  ; If we point at something else, then we have an error.

 45622

 45624

 45630 00007A5B AA                      	STOSB                           ; copy the one byte
 45631                                  
 45632                                  ; Skip all remaining path chars
 45633                                  
 45634                                  CanonPathLoop:

 45638 00007A62 4E                      	DEC     SI                      ; back up

 45642                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45643                                  ;   PathSep - look at DS:SI and see if char is / \ or NUL
 45644                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to a char
 45645                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has char from DS:SI (/ => \)
 45646                                  ;               Zero set if AL is / \ or NUL

 45666                                  ;               BX has current directory back up limit (point to a / \)

 45693                                  ;Break <CopyComponent - copy out a file path component>
 45694                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45695                                  ;   CopyComponent - copy a file component from a path string (DS:SI) into ES:DI
 45696                                  ;

 45698                                  ;               ES:DI - destination
 45699                                  ;               ES:BP - end of buffer
 45700                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - too long
 45701                                  ;               Carry Clear - DS:SI moved past component
 45702                                  ;                   CX has length of destination

 45811                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 45812                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45813                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 45814                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 45815                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 45816                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 45817                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 45818                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 45819                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 45820                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 45821                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 45822                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise
 45823                                  ;               ThisCDS points to proper CDS if spliced, otherwise it is
 45824                                  ;                   left alone
 45825                                  ;               ThisDPB points to proper DPB
 45826                                  ;   Registers modified: DS:SI, ES:DI, BX,AX,CX
 45827                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45828                                  
 45829                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45830                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C0A6h
 45831

 45902                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45903                                  ; DOSCODE:AE46h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45904                                  
 45905                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45906                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C12Dh
 45907                                  
 45908                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 45909                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45910                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 45911                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 45912                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 45913                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 45914                                  ;
 45915                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 45916                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 45917                                  ;   Outputs:
 45918                                  ;       Carry Clear
 45919                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 45920                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 45921                                  ;       Carry Set
 45922                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 45923                                  ;   Registers modified: all

 45967                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45968                                  ;   DriveFromText - examine DS:SI and remove a drive letter, advancing the
 45969                                  ;   pointer.

 45996                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45997                                  ;   TextFromDrive - turn AL into a drive letter: and put it at es:di with
 45998                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.
 45999                                  ;
 46000                                  ;   Inputs:     AL has 0-based drive number
 46001                                  ;   Outputs:    ES:DI advanced

 46011 00007BD4 AB                      	STOSW
 46012                                  PathPref_retn:

 46015                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 46016                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46017                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 46018                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 46019                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 46020                                  ;
 46021                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 46022                                  ;               ES:DI string
 46023                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 46024                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 46025                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 46026                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 46027                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46028                                  
 46029                                  PathPref:

 46031 00007BD9 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte
 46032 00007BDA F3A6                    	REPZ    CMPSB                   ; compare
 46033 00007BDC 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 46034 00007BDE 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 46035 00007BDF 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 46036 00007BE2 E855DE                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 46037 00007BE5 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 46038                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK
 46039 00007BE7 268A05                  	MOV     AL,[ES:DI]		; get next char to match
 46040 00007BEA E87AFE                  	CALL    PathSepGotCh            ; was it a pathchar?
 46041                                  Prefix:
 46042 00007BED 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 46043 00007BEE C3                      	retn
 46044                                  
 46045                                  ;Break   <ScanPathChar - see if there is a path character in a string>
 46046                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46047                                  ;     ScanPathChar - search through the string (pointed to by DS:SI) for
 46048                                  ;     a path separator.
 46049                                  ;
 46050                                  ;     Input:    DS:SI target string (null terminated)
 46051                                  ;     Output:   Zero set => path separator encountered in string
 46052                                  ;               Zero clear => null encountered
 46053                                  ;     Registers modified: SI

 46079                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>

 46081                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 46082                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 46083                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 46084                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 46085                                  ;           INT     int_command
 46086                                  ;
 46087                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 46088                                  ;       ------          --------
 46089                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 46090                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 46091                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 46092                                  ;
 46093                                  ;   Error returns:
 46094                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 46095                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 46096                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 46097                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 46098                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46099                                  
 46100                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46101                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 46102                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46103                                  ;
 46104                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 46105                                  ;
 46106                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 46107                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 46108                                  ;
 46109                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 46110                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 46111                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 46112                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 46113                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46114                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46115                                  ;	USES	all
 46116                                  ;
 46117                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46118                                  
 46119                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46120                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46121                                  
 46122                                  ; 14/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46123                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C194h
 46124                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0AF10h)
 46125                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A9A7h)
 46126                                  
 46127                                  _$OPEN:       
 46128 00007BF8 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 6.0	
 46129                                  _$Open2:

 46131 00007BFA B516                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 46132 00007BFC E88C02                  	call	SetAttrib

 46136                                  
 46137 00007C02 50                      	push	ax

 46139                                  ;*	General file open/create code. The $CREATE call and the various
 46140                                  ;	$OPEN calls all come here.
 46141                                  ;
 46142                                  ;	We'll share a lot of the standard stuff of allocating SFTs, cracking
 46143                                  ;	path names, etc., and then dispatch to our individual handlers.
 46144                                  ;	WARNING - this info and list is just a guess, not definitive - jgl
 46145                                  ;
 46146                                  ;	(TOS) = create mode
 46147                                  ;	(CX) = address of routine to call to do actual function
 46148                                  ;	(DS:DX) = ASCIZ name
 46149                                  ;	SAttrib = Attribute mask
 46150                                  
 46151                                  ;	Get a free SFT and mark it "being allocated"
 46152

 46154 00007C03 E8929C                  	call	ECritSFT

 46160                                  
 46161 00007C0E 36891E[AA05]            	MOV	[SS:SFN],BX		; save the SFN for later;smr;SS Override
 46162 00007C13 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT],DI		; save the SF offset	;smr;SS Override
 46163 00007C18 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES	; save the SF segment	;smr;SS Override
 46164                                  
 46165                                  ;	Find a free area in the user's JFN table.
 46166                                  
 46167 00007C1D E822F7                  	call	JFNFree			; get a free jfn
 46168                                  	;jnc	short SaveJFN
 46169                                  	; 14/03/2024

 46171                                  	;
 46172                                  ;OpenFailJ:
 46173                                  	;JMP	OpenFail		; there were free JFNs... try SFN
 46174                                  
 46175                                  SaveJFN:

 46177 00007C27 368C06[B005]            	MOV	[ss:PJFN+2],ES		; save the jfn segment	;smr;SS Override
 46178 00007C2C 36891E[AC05]            	MOV	[ss:JFN],BX		; save the jfn itself	;smr;SS Override
 46179                                  
 46180                                  ;	We have been given an JFN. We lock it down to prevent other tasks from
 46181                                  ;	reusing the same JFN.
 46182                                  
 46183 00007C31 368B1E[AA05]            	MOV	BX,[ss:SFN]					;smr;SS Override
 46184 00007C36 26881D                  	MOV	[ES:DI],BL		; assign the JFN

 46223                                  	;

 46228 00007C6B 7405                    	JZ	short _DoOper ; 10/08/2018

 46230                                  	;mov	cx,1000h

 46232                                  _DoOper:
 46233                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3
 46234                                  	;;mov	word [si+2], 0
 46235                                  	;;mov	word [si+33h], 0
 46236                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],0
 46237                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],0
 46238                                  
 46239                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46240                                  ;**	Check if this is an extended open. If so you must set the
 46241                                  ;	modes in sf_mode. Call Set_EXT_mode to do all this. See
 46242                                  ;	Set_EXT_mode in creat.asm
 46243                                  
 46244                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46245                                  	;SAVE	<di, es>                ;M022 conditional removed here
 46246 00007C72 57                      	push	di
 46247 00007C73 06                      	push	es
 46248 00007C74 1E                      	push	ds
 46249 00007C75 07                      	pop	es
 46250 00007C76 56                      	push	si
 46251 00007C77 5F                      	pop	di			; (es:di) = SFT address
 46252 00007C78 E8B0B4                  	call	Set_EXT_mode
 46253                                  	;RESTORE <es, di>
 46254 00007C7B 07                      	pop	es
 46255 00007C7C 5F                      	pop	di
 46256                                  
 46257                                  	;Context DS
 46258 00007C7D 16                      	push	ss
 46259 00007C7E 1F                      	pop	ds	
 46260                                  
 46261 00007C7F 51                      	push	cx

 46263 00007C82 59                      	pop	cx
 46264 00007C83 C536[9E05]              	LDS	SI,[THISSFT]
 46265 00007C87 7240                    	JC	short OpenE2		;AN000;FT. chek extended open hooks first
 46266                                  	;jc	short OpenE ; MSDOS 3.3

 46268                                  ;	The SFT was successfully opened. Remove busy mark.
 46269                                  
 46270                                  OpenOK:
 46271                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 46272 00007C89 C7040100                	mov	word [SI],1
 46273                                  	;or	[SI+5],cx
 46274 00007C8D 094C05                  	OR	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],CX ; set no inherit bit if necessary
 46275                                  
 46276                                  ; If the open mode is 70, we scan the system for other SFT's with the same
 46277                                  ; contents. If we find one, then we can 'collapse' thissft onto the already
 46278                                  ; opened one. Otherwise we use this new one. We compare uid/pid/mode/mft
 46279                                  ;
 46280                                  ; Since this is only relevant on sharer systems, we stick this code into the
 46281                                  ; sharer.

 46295

 46363                                  ;	BREAK <$Creat - create a brand-new file>
 46364                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46365                                  ;
 46366                                  ;**	$Creat - Create a File
 46367                                  ;
 46368                                  ;	$Creat creates the directory entry specified in DS:DX and gives it the
 46369                                  ;	initial attributes contained in CX
 46370                                  ;

 46372                                  ;		(CX) = initial attributes
 46373                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 46374                                  ;		  (ax) = error code

 46534                                  ;	BREAK <$UNLINK - delete a file entry>
 46535                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46536                                  ;
 46537                                  ;**	$UNLINK - Delete a File
 46538                                  ;
 46539                                  ;
 46540                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 46541                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 46542                                  ;	    IF VIA SERVER DOS CALL
 46543                                  ;	     MOV     CX,SEARCH_ATTRIB
 46544                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Unlink
 46545                                  ;	    INT     21h
 46546                                  ;
 46547                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = path name
 46548                                  ;		(cx) = search_attribute, if via server_dos
 46549                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 46550                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46551                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46552                                  ;			= error_file_not_found
 46553                                  ;			= error_access_denied
 46554                                  ;
 46555                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46556                                  
 46557                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46558                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C2E4h
 46559                                  
 46560                                  _$UNLINK:

 46562 00007D43 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; Point at input string
 46563 00007D45 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; temp spot for path
 46564 00007D48 E846FB                  	call	TransPathSet		; go get normalized path
 46565 00007D4B 59                      	pop	cx
 46566 00007D4C 7216                    	JC	short ChModErr		; badly formed path
 46567 00007D4E 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1	; meta chars?	;smr;SS Override
 46568 00007D54 750E                    	JNZ	short NotFound
 46569 00007D56 16                      	push	ss
 46570 00007D57 1F                      	pop	ds
 46571                                  	;mov	ch,6
 46572 00007D58 B506                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system ; unlink appropriate files
 46573 00007D5A E82E01                  	call	SetAttrib
 46574 00007D5D E8BAAD                  	call	DOS_DELETE		; remove that file
 46575                                  	;JC	short UnlinkE 		; error is there
 46576                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46577 00007D60 729C                    	jc	short NORERR
 46578                                  
 46579                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)

 46582 00007D62 EBDB                    	jmp	short OpenOkj3

 46722                                  ;Break <$CreateNewFile - Create a new directory entry>
 46723                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46724                                  ;   CreateNew - Create a new directory entry. Return a file handle if there
 46725                                  ;	was no previous directory entry, and fail if a directory entry with
 46726                                  ;	the same name existed previously.
 46727                                  ;
 46728                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an ASCIZ file name
 46729                                  ;		CX contains default file attributes
 46730                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear:
 46731                                  ;		    AX has file handle opened for read/write
 46732                                  ;		Carry Set:
 46733                                  ;		    AX has error code
 46734                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 46735                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46736                                  
 46737                                  _$CreateNewFile:
 46738 00007DDC 51                      	push	cx			; Save attributes on stack
 46739 00007DDD B9[D530]                	MOV	CX,DOS_Create_New	; routine to call
 46740 00007DE0 E9F1FE                  	JMP	AccessSet		; use good ol' open
 46741                                  
 46742                                  ;**	BinToAscii - convert a number to a string.
 46743                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46744                                  ;	BinToAscii converts a 16 bit number into a 4 ascii characters.
 46745                                  ;	This routine is used to generate temp file names so we don't spend
 46746                                  ;	the time and code needed for a true hex number, we just use
 46747                                  ;	A thorugh O.
 46748                                  ;
 46749                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = value
 46750                                  ;		(es:di) = destination
 46751                                  ;	EXIT	(es:di) updated by 4
 46752                                  ;	USES	cx, di, flags
 46753                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46754                                  
 46755                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 46756                                  ;BinToAscii:
 46757                                  ;	mov     cx,4
 46758                                  ;bta5:
 46759                                  ;	push    cx
 46760                                  ;	mov     cl,4
 46761                                  ;	rol     ax,cl
 46762                                  ;	push    ax
 46763                                  ;	and     al,0Fh
 46764                                  ;	add     al,'0'
 46765                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'
 46766                                  ;	jbe     short bta6
 46767                                  ;	add     al,7
 46768                                  ;bta6: 
 46769                                  ;	stosb
 46770                                  ;	pop     ax
 46771                                  ;	pop     cx
 46772                                  ;	loop    bta5
 46773                                  ;	retn
 46774                                  
 46775                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46776                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 & Windows ME
 46777                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0B0D9h)
 46778                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0ABA4h)
 46779                                  %if 0
 46780                                  
 46781                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46782                                  BinToAscii:
 46783                                  	mov	cx,404h			; (ch) = digit counter, (cl) = shift cnt
 46784                                  bta5:	
 46785                                  	ROL	AX,CL			; move leftmost nibble into rightmost
 46786                                  	push	ax			; preserve remainder of digits
 46787                                  	AND	AL,0Fh			; grab low nibble
 46788                                  	ADD	AL,'A'			; turn into ascii
 46789                                  	STOSB				; drop in the character
 46790                                  	pop	ax			; (ax) = shifted number
 46791                                  	dec	ch
 46792                                  	jnz	short bta5		; process 4 digits
 46793                                  	retn
 46794                                  %else
 46795                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46796                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C385h
 46797                                  
 46798                                  BinToAscii:
 46799 00007DE3 50                      	push	ax		; convert a number to a string ; ax = value
 46800 00007DE4 86E0                    	xchg	ah,al
 46801                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46802 00007DE6 D410                    	aam	10h		; AH = AL / 16 and AL = remainder
 46803 00007DE8 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; 'AA'
 46804 00007DEB AB                      	stosw
 46805 00007DEC 58                      	pop	ax
 46806                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46807 00007DED D410                    	aam	10h
 46808 00007DEF 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; add ax,'AA'
 46809 00007DF2 AB                      	stosw
 46810 00007DF3 C3                      	retn	
 46811                                  %endif
 46812                                  
 46813                                  ;Break	<$CreateTempFile - create a unique name>
 46814                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46815                                  ;   $CreateTemp - given a directory, create a unique name in that directory.
 46816                                  ;	Method used is to get the current time, convert to a name and attempt
 46817                                  ;	a create new. Repeat until create new succeeds.
 46818                                  ;
 46819                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a null terminated directory name.
 46820                                  ;		CX  contains default attributes
 46821                                  ;   Outputs:	Unique name is appended to DS:DX directory.
 46822                                  ;		AX has handle
 46823                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 46824                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46825                                  
 46826                                  	; 10/07/2024
 46827                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46828                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46829                                  
 46830                                  _$CreateTempFile:
 46831                                  	;Enter
 46832 00007DF4 55                      	push	bp
 46833 00007DF5 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 46834                                  
 46835                                  	;LocalVar  EndPtr,DWORD
 46836                                  	;LocalVar  FilPtr,DWORD
 46837                                  	;LocalVar  Attr,WORD
 46838                                  
 46839 00007DF7 83EC0A                  	sub	sp,10
 46840                                  
 46841                                  	;test	cx,0FFD8h
 46842 00007DFA F7C1D8FF                	test	CX,~attr_changeable
 46843 00007DFE 7405                    	JZ	short OKatts		; Ok if no non-changeable bits set
 46844                                  
 46845                                  ; We need this "hook" here to detect these cases (like user sets one both of
 46846                                  ; vol_id and dir bits) because of the structure of the or $CreateNewFile loop
 46847                                  ; below. The code loops on error_access_denied, but if one of the non
 46848                                  ; changeable attributes is specified, the loop COULD be infinite or WILL be
 46849                                  ; infinite because CreateNewFile will fail with access_denied always. Thus we
 46850                                  ; need to detect these cases before getting to the loop.
 46851                                  
 46852                                  	;mov	ax, 5
 46853 00007E00 B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied
 46854 00007E03 EB7A                    	JMP	SHORT SETTMPERR
 46855                                  
 46856                                  OKatts:
 46857                                  	;MOV	attr,CX 		; save attribute
 46858 00007E05 894EF6                  	mov     [bp-10],cx
 46859                                  	;MOV	FilPtrL,DX		; pointer to file
 46860 00007E08 8956F8                  	mov	[bp-8],dx
 46861                                  	;MOV	FilPtrH,DS
 46862 00007E0B 8C5EFA                  	mov	[bp-6],ds
 46863                                  	;MOV	EndPtrH,DS		; seg pointer to end of dir
 46864 00007E0E 8C5EFE                  	mov	[bp-2],ds
 46865 00007E11 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 46866 00007E12 07                      	POP	ES			; destination for nul search
 46867 00007E13 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 46868 00007E15 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 46869 00007E17 F7D9                    	NEG	CX			; number of bytes remaining in segment
 46870                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46871 00007E19 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;AN000;MS. cx=0 ? ds:dx on segment boundary
 46872 00007E1B 7501                    	JNZ	short okok		;AN000;MS. no

 46922                                  
 46923                                  ; The operation failed and the error has been mapped in AX. Grab the extended
 46924                                  ; error and figure out what to do.
 46925                                  
 46926                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3			; M049 - start
 46927                                  ;;	mov	ax,[ss:EXTERR]				;smr;SS Override

 46943                                  					;    to error_cannot_make if this is 
 46944                                  					;    so.
 46945                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46946                                  %if 0

 46948                                  					; See if it's REALLY an att mismatch
 46949                                  	je	short SETTMPERR		; no, network error, stop
 46950                                  ;M070
 46951                                  ; If the user failed on an I24, we do not want to try again
 46952                                  ;

 46954                                  	;je	short SETTMPERR		;yes, do not try again ;M070
 46955

 46958                                  	jne	short CreateLoop ; 10/06/2019 
 46959                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46960                                  	;jz	short SETTMPERR
 46961                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop
 46962                                  %else

 46995                                  ;   SetAttrib will set the search attribute (SAttrib) either to the normal
 46996                                  ;   (CH) or to the value in CL if the current system call is through
 46997                                  ;   serverdoscall.
 46998                                  ;

 47030                                  ;Break	<Extended_Open- Extended open the file>
 47031                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47032                                  ; Input: AL= 0 reserved  AH=6CH
 47033                                  ;	 BX= mode
 47034                                  ;	 CL= create attribute  CH=search attribute (from server)
 47035                                  ;	 DX= flag
 47036                                  ;	 DS:SI = file name
 47037                                  ;	 ES:DI = parm list
 47038                                  ;			   DD  SET EA list (-1) null
 47039                                  ;			   DW  n  parameters
 47040                                  ;			   DB  type (TTTTTTLL)
 47041                                  ;			   DW  IOMODE
 47042                                  ; Function: Extended Open
 47043                                  ; Output: carry clear
 47044                                  ;		     AX= handle
 47045                                  ;		     CX=1 file opened
 47046                                  ;			2 file created/opened
 47047                                  ;			3 file replaced/opened
 47048                                  ;	  carry set: AX has error code
 47049                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47050                                  
 47051                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47052                                  	; 16/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 47273                                  ;BREAK <$LockOper - Lock Calls>
 47274                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47275                                  ;
 47276                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47277                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle	       (DOS 3.3)
 47278                                  ;	    MOV     CX, OffsetHigh
 47279                                  ;	    MOV     DX, OffsetLow
 47280                                  ;	    MOV     SI, LengthHigh
 47281                                  ;	    MOV     DI, LengthLow
 47282                                  ;	    MOV     AH, LockOper
 47283                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 47284                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47285                                  ;
 47286                                  ;   Error returns:
 47287                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47288                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47289                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 47290                                  ;
 47291                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47292                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 5C??	       (DOS 4.00)
 47293                                  ;
 47294                                  ;				    0? lock all
 47295                                  ;				    8? lock write
 47296                                  ;				    ?2 lock multiple
 47297                                  ;				    ?3 unlock multiple
 47298                                  ;				    ?4 lock/read
 47299                                  ;				    ?5 write/unlock
 47300                                  ;				    ?6 add (lseek EOF/lock/write/unlock)
 47301                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 47302                                  ;	    MOV     CX, count or size
 47303                                  ;	    LDS     DX, buffer
 47304                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47305                                  ;
 47306                                  ;   Error returns:
 47307                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47308                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47309                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 47310                                  ;
 47311                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47312
