 47740 00008090 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 47741                                  	
 47742                                  	; 19/03/2024
 47743                                  	;;mov	dx,[es:bp+17]
 47744                                  	;MOV	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.DIR_SECTOR]
 47745                                  
 47746                                  	; 19/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 47747                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 47748                                  	;;;
 47749                                   	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 47750 00008092 2639560F                	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx ; 0
 47751 00008096 740A                    	jz	short sharev_1 ; FAT32
 47752                                  	; FAT16 or FAT12
 47753                                  	;mov	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0
 47754 00008098 8916[0706]              	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],dx ; 0
 47755                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+11h]
 47756 0000809C 268B5611                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.DIR_SECTOR]
 47757 000080A0 EB0C                    	jmp     short sharev_2
 47758                                  sharev_1:
 47759                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+2Bh]
 47760 000080A2 268B562B                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR+2]
 47761 000080A6 8916[0706]              	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],dx
 47762                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+29h]
 47763 000080AA 268B5629                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR]
 47764                                  sharev_2: 
 47765                                  	;;;
 47766 000080AE E8F3DB                  	call	HARDERR
 47767                                  ; 01/07/2024
 47768                                  %if 0
 47769                                  	POP	DI
 47770                                  	POP	ES
 47771                                  	POP	DS
 47772                                  	CMP	AL,1
 47773                                  	jz	short shchk_retn	; 1 = retry, carry clear
 47774                                  	STC
 47775                                  	retn
 47776                                  %else
 47777 000080B1 EBAD                    	jmp	short sharev_3
 47778                                  %endif
 47779                                  
 47780                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47781                                  ;   ShareEnd - terminate sharing info on a particular SFT/UID/PID. This does
 47782                                  ;       NOT perform a close, it merely asserts that the sharing information
 47783                                  ;       for the SFT/UID/PID may be safely released.
 47784                                  ;
 47785                                  ;   Inputs:     ES:DI points to an SFT
 47786                                  ;   Outputs:    None
 47787                                  ;   Registers modified: all except DS,ES,DI
 47788                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47789                                  
 47790                                  ShareEnd:
 47791                                  	; 26/07/2019
 47792 000080B3 FF1E[9800]              	call	far [JShare+(2*4)]	; 2 = MFTClose
 47793 000080B7 C3                      	retn
 47794                                  
 47795                                  ;Break <ShareEnter - attempt to enter a node into the sharing set>
 47796                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47797                                  ;   ShareEnter - perform a retried entry of a nodde into the sharing set. If
 47798                                  ;   the max number of retries is exceeded, we notify the user via int 24.
 47799                                  ;
 47800                                  ;   Inputs:     ThisSFT points to the SFT
 47801                                  ;               WFP_Start points to the WFP
 47802                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry clear => successful entry
 47803                                  ;               Carry set => failed system call
 47804                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 47805                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47806                                  
 47807                                  ShareEnter:
 47808 000080B8 51                      	push	cx
 47809                                  retry:
 47810 000080B9 8B0E[1A00]              	mov     cx,[RetryCount]
 47811                                  attempt:
 47812 000080BD C43E[9E05]              	les     di,[THISSFT]		; grab sft
 47813 000080C1 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 47814                                   	;mov	[es:di+51],ax
 47815 000080C3 26894533                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],AX ; indicate free SFT
 47816 000080C7 51                      	push	cx
 47817 000080C8 E8ABFF                  	call    SHARE_CHECK             ; attempt to enter into the sharing set
 47818 000080CB 59                      	pop	cx
 47819 000080CC 730A                    	jnc	short done		; success, let the user see this
 47820 000080CE E80497                  	call	Idle                    ; wait a while
 47821 000080D1 E2EA                    	loop    attempt                 ; go back for another attempt
 47822 000080D3 E8A5FF                  	call    SHARE_VIOLATION         ; signal the problem to the user
 47823 000080D6 73E1                    	jnc	short retry		; user said to retry, go do it
 47824                                  done:
 47825 000080D8 59                      	pop	cx
 47826 000080D9 C3                      	retn
 47827

 47829                                  ; EXEPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 47830                                  ;============================================================================
 47831                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 47832                                  ; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 47833                                  
 47834                                  ;** EXEPATCH.ASM 
 47835                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47836                                  ;	Contains the foll:
 47837                                  ;
 47838                                  ;		- code to find and overlay buggy unpack code
 47839                                  ;		- new code to be overlayed on buggy unpack code 
 47840                                  ;		- old code sequence to identify buggy unpack code
 47841                                  ;
 47842                                  ;	Revision history:
 47843                                  ;
 47844                                  ;		Created: 5/14/90
 47845                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47846                                  
 47847                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47848                                  ;
 47849                                  ; M020 : Fix for rational bug - for details see routine header
 47850                                  ; M028 : 4b04 implementation
 47851                                  ; M030 : Fixing bug in EXEPACKPATCH (EXEC_CS is an un-relocated value)
 47852                                  ; M032 : set turnoff bit only if DOS in HMA.
 47853                                  ; M033 : if IP < 2 then not exepacked.
 47854                                  ; M046 : support for a 4th version of exepacked files.
 47855                                  ; M068 : support for copy protected apps.
 47856                                  ; M071 : use A20OFF_COUNT of 10.
 47857                                  ;
 47858                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47859                                  
 47860                                  PATCH1_COM_OFFSET	EQU	06CH
 47861                                  PATCH1_OFFSET		EQU	028H
 47862                                  PATCH1_CHKSUM		EQU	0EF4EH
 47863                                  CHKSUM1_LEN		EQU	11CH/2 ; 142
 47864                                  
 47865                                  PATCH2_COM_OFFSET	EQU	076H
 47866                                  PATCH2_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47867                                  
 47868                                  	; The strings that start at offset 076h have two possible 
 47869                                  	; check sums that are defined as PATCH2_CHKSUM PATCH2A_CHKSUM
 47870                                  
 47871                                  PATCH2_CHKSUM		EQU	78B2H
 47872                                  CHKSUM2_LEN		EQU	119H/2
 47873                                  PATCH2A_CHKSUM		EQU	1C47H		; M046
 47874                                  CHKSUM2A_LEN		EQU	103H/2		; M046
 47875                                  
 47876                                  PATCH3_COM_OFFSET	EQU	074H
 47877                                  PATCH3_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47878                                  PATCH3_CHKSUM		EQU	4EDEH
 47879                                  CHKSUM3_LEN		EQU	117H/2
 47880                                  
 47881                                  ;**	Data structure passed for ExecReady call
 47882                                  ;
 47883                                  ;struc ERStruc
 47884                                  ; .ER_Reserved:	resw	1	; reserved, should be zero
 47885                                  ; .ER_Flags:	resw	1
 47886                                  ; .ER_ProgName:	resd	1	; ptr to ASCIIZ str of prog name
 47887                                  ; .ER_PSP:	resw	1	; PSP of the program
 47888                                  ; .ER_StartAddr: resd	1	; Start CS:IP of the program
 47889                                  ; .ER_ProgSize:	resd	1	; Program size including PSP
 47890                                  ; .size:
 47891                                  ;endstruc
 47892                                  
 47893                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 47894                                  
 47895                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 47896                                  	; DOSCODE:B3DDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 47897                                  
 47898                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47899                                  	; DOSCODE:B37Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 47900                                  
 47901                                  	; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47902                                  	; DOSCODE:C697h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 47903                                  
 47904                                  ; M028 - BEGIN
 47905                                  
 47906                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47907                                  ;
 47908                                  ;	Procedure Name		: ExecReady
 47909                                  ;
 47910                                  ;	Input			: DS:DX -> ERStruc (see exe.inc)
 47911                                  ;
 47912                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47913                                  
 47914                                  ExecReady:
 47915 000080DA 89D6                    	mov	si,dx			; move the pointer into a friendly one
 47916                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47917                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47918 000080DC F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47919                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; COM or EXE ?
 47920 000080E0 7418                    	jz	short er_setver		; only setver for .COM files
 47921                                  
 47922                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47923 000080E2 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47924 000080E5 83C010                  	add	ax,10h
 47925 000080E8 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 47926                                  
 47927                                  	;mov	cx,[si+10]
 47928 000080EA 8B4C0A                  	mov	cx,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr]   ; M030
 47929                                  	;mov	ax,[si+12]	; 11/04/2024
 47930 000080ED 8B440C                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr+2] ; M030
 47931                                  
 47932                                  	;call	[ss:FixExePatch]
 47933 000080F0 36FF16[670D]            	call	word [ss:FixExePatch] ; 28/12/2022
 47934                                  	
 47935                                  	; 20/03/2024
 47936                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47937 000080F5 36FF16[4612]            	call	word [ss:Rational386PatchPtr]
 47938                                  
 47939                                  er_setver:
 47940                                  	;;test	word [si+2],2		; Q: is this an overlay
 47941                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47942 000080FA F6440202                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY ; 2
 47943                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY
 47944 000080FE 7518                    	jnz	short er_chkdoshi	; Y: set A20OFF_COUNT if DOS high
 47945                                  					; N: set up lie version first
 47946 00008100 1E                      	push	ds
 47947 00008101 56                      	push	si
 47948                                  	;lds	si,[si+4]
 47949 00008102 C57404                  	lds	si,[si+ERStruc.ER_ProgName]
 47950 00008105 E8DCEC                  	call	Scan_Execname1
 47951 00008108 E8EDEC                  	call	Scan_Special_Entries
 47952 0000810B 5E                      	pop	si
 47953 0000810C 1F                      	pop	ds
 47954                                  	;mov	es,[si+8]
 47955 0000810D 8E4408                  	mov	es,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47956 00008110 36A1[BB0E]              	mov	ax,[ss:SPECIAL_VERSION]
 47957                                  	;mov	[es:40h],ax ; 11/04/2024
 47958 00008114 26A34000                	mov	[es:PDB.Version],ax
 47959                                  
 47960                                  er_chkdoshi:
 47961 00008118 36803E[660D]00          	cmp	byte [ss:DosHasHMA],0	; M032: Q: is dos in HMA (M021)
 47962 0000811E 741E                    	je	short er_done		; M032: N: done
 47963                                  
 47964                                  					; M068 - Start
 47965                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47966 00008120 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]	; ax = PSP
 47967                                  
 47968                                  	;or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],4
 47969 00008123 36800E[8600]04          	or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECA20OFF ; Set bit to signal int 21
 47970                                  					; ah = 25 & ah= 49. See dossym.inc 
 47971                                  					; under TAG M003 & M009 for 
 47972                                  					; explanation
 47973                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47974                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47975 00008129 F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47976                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; Q: COM file
 47977 0000812D 7506                    	jnz	short er_setA20		; N: inc a20off_count, set 
 47978                                  					;    a20off_psp and ret
 47979                                     	; 07/03/2025
 47980                                  	;push	ds
 47981                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; DS = load segment of com file.
 47982                                  	;call	IsCopyProt ; !*!	; check if copy protected
 47983                                  	;pop	ds
 47984                                  
 47985                                  	; 07/03/2025 (MiniDOS 1.0)
 47986 0000812F 36C606[8500]0A          	mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],0Ah ; *!*
 47987                                  
 47988                                  er_setA20:
 47989                                  	; We need to inc the A20OFF_COUNT here. Note that if the count
 47990                                  	; is non-zero at this point it indicates that the A20 is to be 
 47991                                  	; turned off for that many int 21 calls made by the app. In 
 47992                                  	; addition the A20 has to be turned off when we exit from this 
 47993                                  	; call. Hence the inc.
 47994                                  
 47995 00008135 36FE06[8500]            	inc	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT]		
 47996 0000813A 36A3[6300]              	mov	[ss:A20OFF_PSP],ax	; set the PSP for which A20 is to be
 47997                                  					; turned OFF.
 47998                                  er_done:				; M068 - End
 47999 0000813E 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 48000 00008140 C3                      	retn
 48001

 48019                                  ; DOSCODE:B76Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 48020                                  
 48021                                  initiret: ; MSDOS 6.0

 48024 00008141 CF                      	iret
 48025

 48027                                  
 48028                                  ; pointer to the BIOS data segment that will be available just to the
 48029                                  ; initialization code
 48030                                  
 48031 00008142 7000                    InitBioDataSeg:	dw 70h ; KERNEL_SEGMENT = 0070h
 48032                                  
 48033                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48034                                  ; DOSCODE:B76Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 48035                                  
 48036                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48037                                  ; DOSCODE:CCE1h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48038                                  
 48039                                  ; Convert AX from a number of bytes to a number of paragraphs (round up).
 48040                                  
 48041                                  ParaRound:
 48042 00008144 83C00F                  	add	ax, 15
 48043 00008147 D1D8                    	rcr	ax, 1
 48044 00008149 D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48045 0000814B D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48046 0000814D D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48047 0000814F C3                      	retn

 48056                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48057                                  ;
 48058                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 48059                                  ;
 48060                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 48061                                  ;
 48062                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 48063                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 48064                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 48065                                  ;
 48066                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 48067                                  ;
 48068                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48069                                  
 48070                                  WhatCPUType:
 48071                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48072                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 48073                                  
 48074                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 48075                                  
 48076                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 48077                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 48078                                  ;
 48079                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 48080                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 48081                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 48082                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 48083                                  
 48084                                  	; 04/11/2022
 48085                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 48086                                  
 48087                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48088                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0CCEDh
 48089                                  
 48090                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 48091 00008150 9C                      	pushf
 48092 00008151 53                      	push	bx			; preserve bx
 48093 00008152 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 48094                                  
 48095 00008154 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 48096 00008156 50                      	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 48097 00008157 9D                      	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 48098 00008158 9C                      	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 48099 00008159 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 48100 0000815A 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 48101 0000815D 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 48102 00008160 740E                    	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 48103                                  
 48104 00008162 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 48105 00008165 50                      	push	ax
 48106 00008166 9D                      	popf
 48107 00008167 9C                      	pushf
 48108 00008168 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 48109 00008169 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 48110 0000816C 7401                    	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 48111                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 48112 0000816E 43                      	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 48113                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 48114 0000816F 43                      	inc	bx
 48115                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 48116 00008170 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 48117 00008172 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 48118 00008173 9D                      	popf
 48119                                  	
 48120                                  	;endm
 48121                                  
 48122                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48123 00008174 C3                      	retn	; 19/09/2023
 48124                                  
 48125                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48126                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022

 48130                                  ; MAIN ENTRY FOR DOS INITIALIZATION
 48131                                  
 48132                                  	; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48133                                  	; DOSCODE:B779h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48134                                  
 48135                                  	; 23/03/2024
 48136                                  	; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48137                                  	; DOSCODE:CCEDh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48138                                  
 48139                                  	; DOSCODE:BA57h (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS)
 48140                                  	; BIOSCODE:CF81h (Windows ME IO.SYS)
 48141                                  	
 48142                                  	; 30/05/2019
 48143                                  	; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48144                                  	; 07/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 48145                                  	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 03/03/2018
 48146                                  	; 03/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48147                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 79A9h
 48148                                  DOSINIT:
 48149                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 7C77h
 48150                                  	;
 48151                                  	; Far call from SYSINIT
 48152                                  	; DX = Memory size in paragraphs
 48153                                  	; DS:SI = [DEVICE_LIST] (SYSINIT.S) 
 48154                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v2.0, 16/03/2018)
 48155                                  	;
 48156                                  	; ES:DI = ptr to BIOS communication block (sysinit3.s)
 48157                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v4.0, 20/04/2019)
 48158                                  
 48159 00008175 FA                              CLI
 48160 00008176 FC                              CLD
 48161                                  
 48162                                  	; 03/11/2022
 48163                                  	;push	dx ; 30/05/2019		; save parameters from BIOS
 48164                                  	
 48165                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48166                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48167                                  	;push	dx ; =*=		; save parameters from BIOS
 48168                                  	
 48169 00008177 56                      	push	si
 48170 00008178 1E                      	push	ds
 48171 00008179 57                      	push	di			;save di (ptr to BiosComBlock)
 48172                                  
 48173 0000817A 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			;bx:di = ptr to BiosComBlock
 48174                                  
 48175                                  ; First, move the DOS data segment to its final location in low memory
 48176                                  
 48177                                  	;;;mov	ax,0BF69h ; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 7C7Fh
 48178                                  	;;mov	ax,0BC77h ; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 79B1h
 48179                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48180                                  	;mov	ax,0D20Fh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM, file offset 92FFh
 48181 0000817C B8[EC85]                	mov	ax,MEMSTRT		; get offset of end of init code
 48182                                  
 48183                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48184 0000817F 83C00F                  	add	ax,15			; round to nearest paragraph
 48185                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; boundary
 48186                                  	; 12/04/2024
 48187 00008182 24F0                    	and	al,0F0h
 48188                                  
 48189 00008184 89C6                    	mov	si,ax			; si = offset of DOSDATA in current
 48190                                  					; code segment
 48191                                  	; 05/12/2022
 48192                                  	; 30/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48193                                  	;xor	si,si
 48194                                  	
 48195                                  	;mov	ax,cs
 48196                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; ds = current code segment
 48197                                  					; DS:SI now points to dosdata
 48198                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48199 00008186 0E                      	push	cs
 48200 00008187 1F                      	pop	ds
 48201                                  
 48202                                  	;mov	es,[cs:0BA49h] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, offset 7C8Eh 
 48203                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]	; First access to DosDataSg in
 48204                                  					;  BData segment. Cannot use
 48205                                  					;  getdseg macro here!!!
 48206                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48207 00008188 8E06[4281]              	mov	es,[InitBioDataSeg]
 48208                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48209                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]  ; ds = cs !
 48210                                  
 48211                                  	;mov	es,[es:3]
 48212 0000818C 268E060300              	mov	es,[es:DosDataSg]	; Get free location in low memory
 48213

 49070                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49071                                  ;
 49072                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 49073                                  ;
 49074                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 49075                                  ;
 49076                                  ;	USED:	none
 49077                                  ;
 49078                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49079                                  
 49080                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 49081                                  ;
 49082                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 49083                                  ;
 49084 00008473 50                      	push	ax
 49085                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 49086 00008474 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 49087 00008477 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49088                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 49089                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 49090                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 49091 00008479 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 49092 0000847B 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 49093                                  ;
 49094                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 49095                                  ; need to call it later.
 49096                                  ;
 49097 0000847D 53                      	push	bx
 49098 0000847E 52                      	push	dx
 49099 0000847F 1E                      	push	ds
 49100 00008480 06                      	push	es
 49101                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 49102 00008481 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 49103 00008484 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49104                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 49105                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 49106                                  
 49107 00008486 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 49108                                  
 49109 0000848B 891E[4D10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 49110 0000848F 8C06[4F10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 49111                                  cXMMexit:
 49112 00008493 F8                      	clc
 49113 00008494 07                      	pop	es
 49114 00008495 1F                      	pop	ds
 49115 00008496 5A                      	pop	dx
 49116 00008497 5B                      	pop	bx
 49117 00008498 58                      	pop	ax
 49118 00008499 C3                      	retn				; done
 49119                                  ;
 49120                                  ; set carry if XMM driver not present
 49121                                  ;
 49122                                  cXMM_no_driver:
 49123 0000849A F9                      	stc
 49124 0000849B 58                      	pop	ax
 49125 0000849C C3                      	retn

 49129                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 49130                                  ;
 49131                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 49132                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 49133                                  ;
 49134                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 49135                                  ;		   if AX =0
 49136                                  ;		      if first entry
 49137                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 49138                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 49139                                  ;		      else
 49140                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 49141                                  ;
 49142                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 49143                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES
 49144                                  ;
 49145                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 49146                                  ;
 49147                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx
 49148                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49149                                  
 49150 0000849D 00                      num_entry: db	0		; keeps track of the # of times this routine
 49151                                  				; has been called. (0 or 1)
 49152                                  
 49153                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 5.0)
 49154                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BAB7h
 49155                                  	; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 6.21)
 49156                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDA5h
 49157                                  
 49158                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (ref: PCDOS 7.1)
 49159                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D07Eh
 49160                                  
 49161                                  seg_reinit:	; proc	far
 49162 0000849E 1E                      	push	ds
 49163                                  
 49164 0000849F 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 49165                                  
 49166 000084A4 E87A00                  	call	patch_misc_segments	; patch in segments for sharer and 
 49167                                  					; other tables with seg in ES.
 49168                                  	
 49169                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49170                                  	; cx = 0
 49171 000084A7 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; 0
 49172                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 49173 000084A9 7531                    	jne	short patch_vec_seg	; patch vectors with segment in es
 49174                                  	; 23/03/2024
 49175                                  	;or	ax, ax
 49176                                  	;jnz	short patch_vec_seg
 49177                                  
 49178                                  	; 23/03/2024

 49180                                  	; 17/12/2022

 49182                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:num_entry],0	; Q: is it the first call to this
 49183 000084B0 7508                    	jne	short second_entry	; N: just patch the stub with 
 49184                                  					;    segment in ES
 49185                                  					; Y: patch the vectors with stub

 49187 000084B4 E83200                  	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch the segment of vectors
 49188 000084B7 E8A100                  	call	patch_offset		; patch the offsets of vectors
 49189                                  					; with those in the stub.
 49190                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49191                                  	; cx = 0
 49192                                  second_entry:

 49194

 49199                                  	
 49200                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49201                                  	; cx = 0
 49202                                  	;;mov	cx,9
 49203                                  	;mov	cl,9
 49204                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 49205                                  	;;;
 49206                                  	;mov	cx,8

 49208                                  	;;;

 49210 000084C2 07                      	pop	es			; es:di -> DOSINTTABLE
 49211                                  
 49212                                  dosinttabloop:
 49213                                  	;add	di,2
 49214                                  	; 19/06/2023
 49215 000084C3 47                      	inc	di
 49216 000084C4 47                      	inc	di
 49217 000084C5 AB                      	stosw
 49218 000084C6 E2FB                    	loop	dosinttabloop	
 49219                                  
 49220                                  ; For ROMDOS, this routine will only be called when the DOS wants to
 49221                                  ; use the HMA, so we don't want to check CS
 49222                                  
 49223                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS

 49225 000084CB 7214                    	jb	short sr_done		; N: done
 49226                                  ;endif

 49229                                  					; A20 toggling in the stub.

 49233                                  ; M021-

 49237                                  
 49238                                  ; 07/03/2025 (MiniDOS)				
 49239                                  %if 0					; set pointer to the routine that 
 49240                                  					; patches buggy exepacked code.
 49241                                  	;mov	[FixExePatch],offset DOSCODE:ExePatch
 49242                                  	mov	word [FixExePatch],ExePatch
 49243                                  					; M068: set pointer to the routine 
 49244                                  					; M068: that detects copy protected
 49245                                  					; M068: apps
 49246                                  	;mov	[ChkCopyProt],offset DOSCODE:IsCopyProt
 49247                                  	mov	word [ChkCopyProt],IsCopyProt
 49248                                  
 49249                                  	; 23/03/2024 - PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D0C7h
 49250                                  	;	      (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDF1h)

 49252                                  	cmp	al,1
 49253                                  	jne	short sr_done	; we need Rational Patch only on 286 systems
 49254                                  	mov	word [RationalPatchPtr],RationalPatch
 49255                                  %endif

 49257                                  	; 19/09/2023
 49258 000084DA EB05                    	jmp	short sr_done

 49261                                  patch_vec_seg:				; patch vectors with segment in es

 49264                                  					; NOTE we don't have to patch the 
 49265                                  					; offsets as they have been already

 49267                                  					; DOSINIT.
 49268                                  sr_done:

 49629                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 49630                                  ;
 49631                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 49632                                  ;
 49633                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 49634                                  ;
 49635                                  ;	Description:
 49636                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 49637                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 49638                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 49639                                  ;
 49640                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49641                                  
 49642                                  	; 04/11/2022
 49643                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BC50h
 49644                                  
 49645                                  	; 23/03/2024
 49646                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BF42h
 49647                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 49648                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D1E9h
 49649                                  
 49650                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 49651                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 49652                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 49653                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 49654                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 49655                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch
 49656                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i27patch
 49657                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i2fpatch
 49658                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:cpmpatch
 49659 000085C6 [700F]                  	dw	i0patch
 49660 000085C8 [7A0F]                  	dw	i20patch
 49661 000085CA [840F]                  	dw	i21patch
 49662 000085CC [8E0F]                  	dw	i25patch
 49663 000085CE [980F]                  	dw	i26patch
 49664 000085D0 [A20F]                  	dw	i27patch
 49665 000085D2 [AC0F]                  	dw	i2fpatch
 49666 000085D4 [B60F]                  	dw	cpmpatch
 49667                                  
 49668                                  patch_table_size equ ($-patch_table)/2
 49669                                  
 49670                                  patch_in_nops:
 49671 000085D6 50                      	push	ax
 49672 000085D7 56                      	push	si
 49673 000085D8 BE[C685]                	mov	si,patch_table
 49674 000085DB B89090                  	mov	ax,9090h ; nop, nop
 49675                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49676                                  	; cx = 0
 49677                                  	;mov	cx,8
 49678                                  	;mov	cx,patch_table_size ; 8
 49679 000085DE B108                    	mov	cl,patch_table_size ; 8
 49680                                  pin_loop:
 49681 000085E0 2E8B3C                  	mov	di,[cs:si]
 49682 000085E3 AB                      	stosw
 49683                                  	;add	si,2
 49684                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49685 000085E4 46                      	inc	si
 49686 000085E5 46                      	inc	si
 49687 000085E6 E2F8                    	loop	pin_loop
 49688 000085E8 5E                      	pop	si
 49689 000085E9 58                      	pop	ax
 49690 000085EA C3                      	retn
 49691                                  
 49692                                  ; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)

 49698                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D20Fh
 49699                                  
 49700                                  	; 05/12/2022 - temporary ; (paragraph alinment)
 49701                                  DOSCODE_END:
 49702

 49791                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49792                                  
 49793                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 49794                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole. Under 3.0, the system
 49795                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code. The process data under 2.x will
 49796                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 49797                                  ;
 49798                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 49799                                  ; describing that data item.

 49802

 49894                                  ;; 16/07/2018
 49895                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49896                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 49897                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49898                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 49899                                  ;;
 49900                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 49901                                  ;;
 49902                                  ;;	on return:
 49903                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 49904                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 49905                                  ;;
 49906                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 49907                                  ;;
 49908                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49909                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49910                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 49911                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 49912                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 49913                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 49914                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 49915                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 49916                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 49917                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 49918                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 49919                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 49920                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 49921                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 49922                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 49923                                  ;;
 49924                                  ;;***************************************************************************

 50132                                  ;============================================================================
 50133                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50134                                  ;============================================================================
 50135                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 50136                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 50137                                  
 50138                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 50139                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50140                                  
 50141                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 50142                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 50143                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 50144                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 50145                                  ;
 50146                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 50147                                  ; describing that data item.
 50148                                  
 50149                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50150                                  
 50151                                  ;
 50152                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 50153                                  ;
 50154                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 50155                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 50156                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 50157                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 50158                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 50159                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 50160                                  ;
 50161                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 50162                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 50163                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 50164                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 50165                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 50166                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 50167                                  ;   as EOF).
 50168                                  
 50169                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 50170                                  
 50171                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 50172                                  
 50173                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 50174 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 50175 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 50176                                  		;dw 5 ; 24/03/2024
 50177 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 50178                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0 ; PCDOS 7.1  ; 24/03/2024
 50179 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 50180                                  
 50181                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 50182                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 50183                                  ; console.
 50184                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 24/03/2024
 50185 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 50186 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 50187                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 50188 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 50189 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 50190                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1
 50191 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 50192 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 50193 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b ; 3	; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 50194                                  switch_character:
 50195 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 50196 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 50197 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 50198 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 50199 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name
 50200

 50202                                  ; PUSH AX to enable the critical sections

 50283 0000033E 0000                    USER_ID:	dw 0		; Machine for sharing (0 = local)

 50285 00000342 0000                    BestArena:	dw 0		; best free block found

 50409                                  ;============================================================================
 50410                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50411                                  ;============================================================================
 50412                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 50413                                  
 50414                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 50415                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 50416                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 50417                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 50418                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 50419                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 50420                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 50421                                  ; **********************************************************
 50422                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 50423                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 50424                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 50425                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 50426                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 50427                                  ; **********************************************************	
 50428                                  
 50429                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 50430                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50431                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50432                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 50433                                  
 50434                                  ; 	ORG     0
 50435                                  
 50436                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 50437                                  
 50438                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 50439                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 50440 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 50441 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 50442                                  
 50443                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 50444                                  
 50445                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 50446                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 50447 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 50448                                  RENBUF:	
 50449 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 50450                                  
 50451                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 50452                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 50453 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 50454                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 50455 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0

 50460                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.

 50465                                  
 50466                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 50467                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 50468                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 50469                                  
 50470                                  NAME1:	
 50471 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 50472                                  NAME2:

 50477                                  	;times	5  db	0

 50479                                  
 50480                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 50481

 51024                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:0CF5h
 51025                                  ; 24/03/2024
 51026                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0D6Bh
 51027                                  
 51028                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51029                                  ;
 51030                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 51031                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 51032                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 51033                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 51034                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 51035                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51036                                  ; Example:
 51037                                  
 51038                                  MAP_CASE:
 51039                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 51040                                  
 51041 00000D6B 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 51042                                  	;JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 51043                                  	;RETF
 51044                                  	; 24/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 51045                                  	;;;
 51046 00000D6D 720C                    	jb	short L_RET     ;Map no chars below 80H ever
 51047                                  	;;;
 51048                                  Map1:
 51049 00000D6F 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 51050 00000D71 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 51051 00000D72 53                      	PUSH	BX
 51052 00000D73 BB[FC0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 51053                                  FINISH:
 51054 00000D76 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 51055 00000D77 1F                      	POP	DS
 51056 00000D78 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 51057 00000D79 5B                      	POP	BX
 51058 00000D7A 1F                      	POP	DS
 51059                                  L_RET:	
 51060 00000D7B CB                      	RETF
 51061                                  
 51062                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 51063                                  
 51064                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51065

 51400                                  ;
 51401                                  ; MARK2 SHOULD NOT BE >= 0DDBH. IF SOME VARIABLE IS TO BE ADDED ABOVE DO SO
 51402                                  ; WITHOUT VIOLATING THIS AND UPDATE THE FOLL. LINE
 51403                                  ;

 51407                                  
 51408                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 51409                                  
 51410                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51411                                  ; 24/03/2024
 51412                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0DDBh
 51413                                  
 51414                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51415                                  ;
 51416                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 51417                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 51418                                  ;
 51419                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 51420                                  ;
 51421                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 51422                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 51423                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 51424                                  ;
 51425                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51426                                  
 51427                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 51428                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 51429                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 51430                                  ;ELSE
 51431                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 51432                                  ;ENDIF
 51433                                  ;ENDM
 51434

 51852                                  
 51853                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51854                                  ;
 51855                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 51856                                  ;
 51857                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 51858                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 51859                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 51860                                  ;
 51861                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 51862                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 51863                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 51864                                  ;	   4. else 
 51865                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 51866                                  ;	   6. endif
 51867                                  ;	7. else
 51868                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 51869                                  ;	9. endif
 51870                                  ;
 51871                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51872                                  
 51873                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 51874                                  
 51875                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51876                                  
 51877                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 51878                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0F9Eh
 51879                                  
 51880                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51881                                  ;
 51882                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 51883                                  ;
 51884                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51885                                  
 51886                                  ldivov:
 51887                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51888                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51889                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51890                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51891                                  i0patch:
 51892 00000F70 EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 51893                                  
 51894 00000F72 E8E200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51895                                  divov_cont:
 51896 00000F75 2EFF2E[4C0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 51897                                  
 51898                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51899                                  ;
 51900                                  ; INT 20h Handler
 51901                                  ;
 51902                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 51903                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 51904                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 51905                                  ; will be restored then.
 51906                                  ;
 51907                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51908                                  
 51909                                  lquit:
 51910                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51911                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51912                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51913                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51914                                  i20patch:
 51915 00000F7A EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 51916                                  
 51917 00000F7C E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51918                                  quit_cont:
 51919 00000F7F 2EFF2E[500F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 51920                                  
 51921                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51922                                  ;
 51923                                  ; INT 21h Handler
 51924                                  ;
 51925                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51926                                  
 51927                                  lcommand:
 51928                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51929                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51930                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51931                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51932                                  i21patch:
 51933 00000F84 EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 51934                                  
 51935 00000F86 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51936                                  command_cont:
 51937 00000F89 2EFF2E[540F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 51938                                  
 51939                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51940                                  ;
 51941                                  ; INT 25h
 51942                                  ;
 51943                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51944                                  
 51945                                  labsdrd:
 51946                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51947                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51948                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51949                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51950                                  i25patch:
 51951 00000F8E EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 51952                                  
 51953 00000F90 E8C400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51954                                  absdrd_cont:
 51955 00000F93 2EFF2E[580F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
