 52035                                  lirett:
 52036                                  	iret
 52037                                  
 52038                                  %endif
 52039                                  
 52040                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52041                                  ;
 52042                                  ; LowIntXX:
 52043                                  ;
 52044                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 52045                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 52046                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 52047                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 52048                                  ;
 52049                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 52050                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 52051                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 52052                                  ;
 52053                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 52054                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 52055                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 52056                                  ;
 52057                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52058                                  
 52059                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52060                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0FEEh
 52061                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:10DBh)
 52062                                  
 52063 00000FC0 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 52064 00000FC4 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 52065                                  
 52066                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52067                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52068                                  %if 0
 52069                                  DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 52070                                  %endif
 52071                                  
 52072                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 52073                                  LowInt23:
 52074                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52075                                  					; the stack
 52076 00000FC8 2E8F06[C00F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 52077 00000FCD 2E8F06[C20F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 52078                                  
 52079 00000FD2 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 52080                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52081                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52082                                  
 52083 00000FD4 E88000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52084                                  
 52085 00000FD7 2EFF2E[C00F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 52086                                  
 52087                                  
 52088                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 52089                                  LowInt24:
 52090                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52091                                  					; the stack
 52092 00000FDC 2E8F06[C40F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 52093 00000FE1 2E8F06[C60F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 52094                                  
 52095 00000FE6 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 52096                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52097                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52098                                  
 52099 00000FE8 E86C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52100                                  
 52101 00000FEB 2EFF2E[C40F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 52102                                  
 52103                                  
 52104                                   
 52105                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 52106                                  LowInt28:
 52107 00000FF0 CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 52108                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52109                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52110                                  
 52111 00000FF2 E86200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52112                                  
 52113 00000FF5 CB                      	retf
 52114                                  
 52115                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52116                                  
 52117                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52118                                  ;
 52119                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 52120                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 52121                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 52122                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 52123                                  ;
 52124                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 52125                                  
 52126                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52127                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1024h
 52128                                  
 52129                                  disa20_xfer:
 52130 00000FF6 E84800                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 52131                                  
 52132                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 52133                                  
 52134                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 52135                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 52136                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 52137                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 52138                                  
 52139 00000FF9 FA                      	cli
 52140 00000FFA 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 52141                                  
 52142                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52143                                  	;;;
 52144 00001000 36C606[C011]00          	mov     byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG],0
 52145                                  	;;;
 52146                                  
 52147 00001006 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 52148 00001008 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 52149 0000100A FB                      	sti
 52150                                  
 52151 0000100B 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 52152 0000100C 56                      	push	SI
 52153 0000100D 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 52154 0000100F 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 52155 00001011 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 52156 00001013 CB                      	retf
 52157                                  
 52158                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52159                                  ;
 52160                                  ; M003:
 52161                                  ;
 52162                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 52163                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 52164                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 52165                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 52166                                  ; more info.
 52167                                  ;
 52168                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 52169                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 52170                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 52171                                  ;
 52172                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52173                                  
 52174                                  disa20_iret:
 52175 00001014 E82A00                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 52176 00001017 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 52177                                  
 52178                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52179                                  	;;;
 52180 0000101B FE0E[C011]              	dec	byte [INDOS_FLAG]
 52181                                  	;;;
 52182                                  
 52183 0000101F 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 52184 00001023 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 52185 00001027 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 52186                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 52187 00001029 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 52188                                  	
 52189                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52190                                  %if 0
 52191                                  	mov	AX,[NSP]
 52192                                  	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 52193                                  	mov	AX,[NSS]
 52194                                  	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 52195                                  %else
 52196                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52197                                  	;;;
 52198                                  	;les	ax, dword ptr ds:NSS
 52199 0000102C C406[F005]              	les	ax,[NSS]
 52200 00001030 8C06[8405]              	mov	[USER_SP],es
 52201 00001034 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],ax
 52202                                  	;;;
 52203                                  %endif
 52204 00001037 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 52205 00001038 5B                      	pop	BX
 52206 00001039 59                      	pop	CX
 52207 0000103A 5A                      	pop	DX
 52208 0000103B 5E                      	pop	SI
 52209 0000103C 5F                      	pop	DI
 52210 0000103D 5D                      	pop	BP
 52211 0000103E 1F                      	pop	DS
 52212 0000103F 07                      	pop	ES
 52213                                  lirett:		; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52214 00001040 CF                      	iret
 52215                                  
 52216                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52217                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 52218                                  ;
 52219                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 52220                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52221                                  ;
 52222                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 52223                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 52224                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 52225                                  ;
 52226                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52227                                  
 52228                                  XMMDisableA20:
 52229 00001041 53                      	push	bx
 52230 00001042 50                      	push	ax
 52231                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 52232 00001043 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 52233 00001045 2EFF1E[4D10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52234 0000104A 58                      	pop	ax
 52235 0000104B 5B                      	pop	bx
 52236 0000104C C3                      	retn
 52237                                  
 52238                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 52239                                  
 52240                                  XMMcontrol:
 52241 0000104D 00000000                	dd	0
 52242                                  
 52243                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52244                                  ; 24/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52245                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:107Fh
 52246                                  ;;;
 52247 00001051 00000000                	dd	0
 52248                                  SC_STATUS:
 52249 00001055 0000                    	dw	0
 52250                                  ;;;
 52251                                  
 52252                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52253                                  ;
 52254                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 52255                                  ;
 52256                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 52257                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52258                                  ;
 52259                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 52260                                  ;
 52261                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 52262                                  ;		
 52263                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 52264                                  ;
 52265                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52266                                  
 52267                                  ; 19/09/2023
 52268                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 52269                                  ;	dw	00080h
 52270                                  ;	dw	00000h
 52271                                  ;
 52272                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 52273                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 52274                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 52275                                  
 52276                                  	; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52277                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1085h
 52278                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:116Fh)
 52279                                  
 52280                                  EnsureA20ON:
 52281 00001057 9C                      	pushf
 52282 00001058 1E                      	push    ds
 52283 00001059 06                      	push	es
 52284 0000105A 51                      	push	cx
 52285 0000105B 56                      	push	si
 52286 0000105C 57                      	push	di
 52287                                  
 52288                                  	; 19/09/2023
 52289                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 52290                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 52291                                  
 52292                                  	; 25/03/2024 
 52293                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52294                                  	;;;
 52295 0000105D 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 52296 0000105F 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 52297 00001061 4E                      	dec	si
 52298 00001062 BF9000                  	mov	di,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 52299 00001065 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
 52300 00001067 BE8000                  	mov	si,80h	; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 52301                                  	;;;	
 52302                                  
 52303 0000106A B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 52304 0000106D FC                      	cld
 52305 0000106E F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 52306                                  
 52307 00001070 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 52308                                  EA20_RET:
 52309 00001072 5F                      	pop	di
 52310 00001073 5E                      	pop	si
 52311 00001074 59                      	pop	cx
 52312 00001075 07                      	pop	es
 52313 00001076 1F                      	pop	ds
 52314 00001077 9D                      	popf
 52315 00001078 C3                      	retn
 52316                                  
 52317                                  EA20_OFF:
 52318                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 52319                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 52320                                  
 52321 00001079 53                      	push	bx
 52322 0000107A 50                      	push	ax
 52323                                  
 52324                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52325                                  %if 0
 52326                                  	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 52327                                  	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 52328                                  	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52329                                  	mov	ax,cs
 52330                                  	mov	ss,ax
 52331                                  %else
 52332                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52333                                  	;;;
 52334 0000107B 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 52335 0000107D 2E8C16[6C0F]            	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ss
 52336 00001082 2E8926[6E0F]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52337 00001087 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 52338                                  	;;;
 52339                                  %endif
 52340 00001089 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 52341                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 52342                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 52343 0000108C B405                    	mov	ah,5
 52344 0000108E 2EFF1E[4D10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52345 00001093 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 52346 00001095 740E                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 52347                                  
 52348                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 52349                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 52350                                  	;  25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52351                                  	;;;
 52352 00001097 2E8E16[6C0F]            	mov	ss,[cs:SS_Save]
 52353                                  	;;;
 52354 0000109C 2E8B26[6E0F]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 52355                                  
 52356 000010A1 58                      	pop	ax
 52357 000010A2 5B                      	pop	bx
 52358                                  
 52359 000010A3 EBCD                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 52360                                  
 52361                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 52362 000010A5 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 52363 000010A7 CD10                    	int	10h
 52364 000010A9 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 52365 000010AB 7405                    	je	short XMMcont		; Y: do not change mode
 52366                                  	;xor	ah,ah ; 0		; set video mode
 52367                                  	;mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 52368                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52369                                  	;;;
 52370 000010AD B80200                  	mov     ax,2
 52371                                  	;;;
 52372 000010B0 CD10                    	int	10h
 52373                                  XMMcont:
 52374                                  	;mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 52375                                  	;xor	al,al			; page 0
 52376                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52377                                  	;;;
 52378 000010B2 B80005                  	mov     ax,500h
 52379                                  	;;;
 52380 000010B5 CD10                    	int	10h
 52381                                  	
 52382 000010B7 BE[1911]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 52383 000010BA 0E                      	push	cs
 52384 000010BB 1F                      	pop	ds
 52385 000010BC FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 52386                                  XMMprnt:
 52387 000010BD AC                      	lodsb
 52388 000010BE 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 52389 000010C0 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh
 52390 000010C2 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 52391 000010C4 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 52392 000010C7 CD10                    	int	10h
 52393 000010C9 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 52394                                  
 52395                                  XMMStall:
 52396 000010CB FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 52397 000010CC EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End

 52570                                  ; DOSDATA:12CFh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)

 52574

 52576                                  ; DOSDATA:12CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 52577                                  
 52578                                  ; first and second DOS patches
 52579                                  ;	Non-console device read/write (system calls 3Fh and 40h)
 52580                                  ;
 52581                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 2 locations, one for read, one for write
 52582                                  ;	DVRDLP:
 52583                                  ;	DVWRTLP:
 52584                                  ;
 52585                                  ;
 52586                                  ; 036h	lds	si,SS:[????]				  ; ThisSFT
 52587                                  ;	lds	si,si+7 				  ; sf_devptr
 52588                                  ; 0E8h	call	????		<- "simulate" int28 event ; DSKSTATCHK
 52589                                  
 52590                                  DOSP1_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52591                                  DOSP1_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52592                                  DOSP1_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52593                                  
 52594                                  		db	90h, 90h
 52595                                  
 52596                                  DOSP12_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52597                                  DOSP12_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52598                                  DOSP12_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52599                                  
 52600                                  ; DOSDATA:12E3h
 52601                                  
 52602                                  ; Third/Fourth DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) from console
 52603                                  ;
 52604                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52605                                  ;	GETBUF:
 52606                                  ;
 52607                                  ; 051h	push	cx	<- begin special int28 mode
 52608                                  ;	push	es
 52609                                  ;	push	di
 52610                                  ;	mov	dx,???? ; offset dosgroup:CONBUF
 52611                                  ;	call	????	; $STD_CON_STRING_INPUT
 52612                                  ;	pop	di
 52613                                  ;	pop	es
 52614                                  ; 059h	pop	cx	<- end special int28 mode
 52615                                  
 52616                                  DOSP3_ID:	db	051h,006h,057h,0BAh
 52617                                  DOSP3_CONBUF:	db	029h,002h,0E8h
 52618                                  DOSP3_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP3_ID
 52619                                  		db	09Ah,0E3h,05Fh,007h	; ???? , pop di, pop es
 52620                                  DOSP4_ID:	db	059h			; pop cx
 52621                                  DOSP4_ID_OFF	equ	(DOSP4_ID - DOSP3_ID)
 52622                                  	
 52623                                  ; DOSDATA:12EFh
 52624                                  
 52625                                  ; Fifth DOS patch - System call 40h (Write) to console
 52626                                  ;
 52627                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52628                                  ;
 52629                                  ;		push	cx
 52630                                  ;      WRCONLP: lodsb
 52631                                  ;		cmp	al,1Ah
 52632                                  ;		jz	????
 52633                                  ;		call	????	<- "simulate" int28 event
 52634                                  ;		loop	WRCONLP
 52635                                  ;      CONEOF:	pop	ax
 52636                                  
 52637                                  DOSP5_ID:	db	051h			; push cx
 52638                                  		db	0ACh,03Ch,01Ah,074h,005h
 52639                                  		db	0E8h			; call
 52640                                  DOSP5_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP5_ID
 52641                                  
 52642                                  ; DOSDATA:12F6h
 52643                                  
 52644                                  ; Seventh DOS patch - System call entry, patch USER_ID with VMid for share
 52645                                  ;
 52646                                  ; Code in disp.asm, 1 location
 52647                                  ;
 52648                                  ;
 52649                                  ;	mov [SaveDS],ds
 52650                                  ;	mov [SaveBX],bx
 52651                                  ;	mov bx,cs
 52652                                  ;	mov ds,bx
 52653                                  ;	inc [indos]
 52654                                  ;	xor ax,ax
 52655                                  ;	mov [USER_ID],AX	<- Patch to set USER_ID to VMID
 52656                                  
 52657                                  DOSP7_ID:	db	02Eh,08Ch,01Eh
 52658                                  DOSP7_SAVEDS:	db	07Eh,05h		; mov [SaveDS],ds
 52659                                  		db	02Eh,089h,01Eh
 52660                                  DOSP7_SAVEBX:	db	07Ch,05h		; mov [SaveBX],bx
 52661                                  		db	08Ch,0CBh		; mov bx,cs
 52662                                  		db	08Eh,0DBh		; mov ds,bx
 52663                                  		db	0FEh,006h
 52664                                  DOSP7_INDOS:	db	0CFh,002h		; inc [indos]
 52665                                  		db	033h,0C0h		; xor ax,ax
 52666                                  DOSP7_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP7_ID
 52667                                  
 52668                                  ; DOSDATA:130Ah
 52669                                  
 52670                                  ; Eighth DOS patch - OWNER check in handle calls. For share, need to NOP test
 52671                                  ;
 52672                                  ; Code in handle.asm, 1 location in routine CheckOwner
 52673                                  ;
 52674                                  ;
 52675                                  ;
 52676                                  ;	push	ax
 52677                                  ;	mov	ax,ss:[USER_ID]     <- patch to XOR AX,AX to set zero
 52678                                  ;	cmp	ax,es:[di.sf_UID]   <- NOP
 52679                                  ;	pop	ax
 52680                                  ;	jz	????
 52681                                  
 52682                                  DOSP8_ID:	db	050h			; push ax
 52683                                  		db	036h,0A1h
 52684                                  DOSP8_USER_ID:	db	0EAh,002h		; mov  ax,ss:[USER_ID]
 52685                                  		db	026h,03Bh,045h		; cmp  ax,es:[di+2F]
 52686                                  DOSP8_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP8_ID
 52687                                  		db	02Fh,058h		; pop  ax
 52688                                  
 52689                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 52690                                  
 52691                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 52692                                  ;
 52693                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 52694                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 52695                                  ;
 52696                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 52697                                  ;
 52698                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 52699                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 52700                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52701                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 52702                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 52703                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 52704                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 52705                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 52706                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 52707                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 52708                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 52709                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 52710                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 52711                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 52712                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 52713                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52714                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 52715                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52716                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 52717                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52718                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 52719                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 52720                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52721                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 52722                                  ;
 52723                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 52724                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 52725                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 52726                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 52727                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 52728                                  ;
 52729                                  ;   CRDROK:
 52730                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 52731                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52732                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 52733                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 52734                                  
 52735                                  DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 52736                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52737                                  DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 52738                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52739                                  			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 52740                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52741                                  			db	0DFH,00EH
 52742                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52743                                  			db	01EH,036H,0C5H,036H,036H,005H,0E8H,0AFH,00EH
 52744                                  			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 52745                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52746                                  			db	009H,003H
 52747                                  			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 52748                                  			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 52749                                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH
 52750                                  DOSP11_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52751                                  			db	05FH
 52752                                  DOSP11_REENT_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52753                                  			db	036H,0C4H,03EH,036H,005H,0E9H,0A1H,004H
 52754                                  
 52755                                  DOSP12_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52756                                  			db	05FH,08BH,0FAH
 52757                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 52758                                  
 52759                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 52760                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 52761                                  ;
 52762                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 52763                                  ;
 52764                                  ;
 52765                                  ;	l0: lodsb		<- Setfocus here
 52766                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 52767                                  ;	    je l1
 52768                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 52769                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 52770                                  ;	    int 10h
 52771                                  ;	    jmp l0
 52772                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 52773                                  
 52774                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 52775                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 52776                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 52777                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 52778                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 52779                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 52780                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 52781                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 52782                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID

 52837                                  ;############################################################################
 52838                                  ;
 52839                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 52840                                  ;
 52841                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 52842                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 52843                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 52844                                  ;
 52845                                  ; MARK3 SHOULD NOT BE > 122AH 
 52846                                  ;
 52847                                  ; As of 9/6/90, this area is FULL!

 52852                                  
 52853                                  ; DOSDATA:122Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52854                                  
 52855                                  ; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52856                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52857                                  
 52858                                  ; 17/01/2024
 52859                                  ; MSDOS 5.0  MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52860                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52861                                  ; 09/03/2024
 52862                                  ; Windows ME    IO.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52863                                  
 52864                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 52865                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 52866                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 52867                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 52868                                  
 52869                                  ; country and code page information
 52870                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52871                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 52872 00001132 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 52873 0000113A 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 52873 00001143 53595300           
 52874                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 52875 00001147 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 52876                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52877                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 52878                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 52879                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 52880                                  ;  endif
 52881                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 52882                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 52883                                  ;  endif
 52884                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 52885                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 52886                                  ;  endif
 52887                                  ;else
 52888 0000117A B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 52889                                  ;endif
 52890                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52891 0000117C 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 52892                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_76: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 76 
 52893 0000117E 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 52894 0000117F [FA0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 52895 00001181 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52896 00001183 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 52897 00001184 [7C0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 52898 00001186 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52899 00001188 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 52900 00001189 [280D]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 52901 0000118B 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52902 0000118D 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 52903 0000118E [FE0B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 52904 00001190 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52905 00001192 07                      	db   SetDBCS	; 7		;AN000; DBCS Ev			2/12/KK
 52906 00001193 [000D]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 52907 00001195 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK
 52908 00001197 01                      	db   SetCountryInfo  ; 1	; country info type
 52909 00001198 2600                    	dw   NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE		; extended country info size
 52910                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52911                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 52912                                  ;	......
 52913                                  ;else
 52914                                  	; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52915                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1292h
 52916                                  _COUNTRY_ID:
 52917 0000119A 0100                    	dw   1				; USA country id
 52918 0000119C B501                    	dw   437			; USA system code page id
 52919                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_108: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 108	
 52920 0000119E 0000                    	dw   0 				; date format
 52921 000011A0 2400000000              	db   '$',0,0,0,0		; currency symbol
 52922 000011A5 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; thousand separator
 52923 000011A7 2E00                    	db   '.',0			; decimal separator
 52924 000011A9 2D00                    	db   '-',0			; date separator
 52925 000011AB 3A00                    	db   ':',0			; time separator
 52926 000011AD 00                      	db   0				; currency format flag
 52927 000011AE 02                      	db   2				; # of digits in currency
 52928 000011AF 00                      	db   0 				; time format
 52929 000011B0 [6B0D]                  	dw   MAP_CASE			; mono case routine entry point
 52930 000011B2 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of entry point
 52931 000011B4 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; data list separator
 52932 000011B6 000000000000000000-     	dw   0,0,0,0,0			; reserved
 52932 000011BF 00                 
 52933                                  ;endif

 52983 0000122A 01                              db 1
 52984                                  BiosDataPtr:	; 08/03/2024
 52985 0000122B 0000<rep 2h>            	times 2 dw 0
 52986 0000122F 00<rep 5h>              	times 5 db 0
 52987 00001234 0400                    	dw 4
 52988 00001236 [C011]                  	dw INDOS_FLAG
 52989 00001238 [1012]                  	dw drive_flags
 52990 0000123A [3E12]                  	dw NLS_YES	; "YN"
 52991 0000123C [4212]                  	dw unknown_zero_dd

 52994 0000123F 4E                      NLS_NO:	db 'N'

 52997                                  NLS_no2:

 53021                                  
 53022                                  ;============================================================================
 53023                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 53024                                  ;============================================================================
 53025                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 53026                                  
 53027                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 53028                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 53029                                  ;
 53030                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 53031                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 53032                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 53033                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 53034                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 53035                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 53036                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 53037                                  ; to call out here.
 53038                                  ;
 53039                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 53040                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 53041                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 53042                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 53043                                  ;
 53044                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 53045                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 53046                                  ;
 53047                                  ;Exported Functions
 53048                                  ;==================
 53049                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 53050                                  
 53051                                  ; DosData Segment
 53052                                  
 53053                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 53054                                  
 53055                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53056                                  
 53057                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 53058                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 53059                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 53060                                  ; 'patch' related.
 53061                                  
 53062                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 53063 00001246 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 53064                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53065                                  
 53066                                  ; 25/03/2024
 53067                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1340h
 53068                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:133Eh)
 53069                                  
 53070                                  ; 07/03/2025
 53071                                  %if 0
 53072                                  MagicPatch:
 53073                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 53074                                          retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 53075                                          nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 53076                                          nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 53077                                          nop             ; call far ?:?     
 53078                                          nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 53079                                          nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 53080                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 53081                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 53082                                  %endif
 53083                                  
 53084                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53085                                  
 53086                                  ;DosData Ends
 53087                                  
 53088                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:136Ah
 53089                                  ;
 53090                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 53091                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1346h
 53092                                  
 53093                                  ;; Windows ME IO.SYS
 53094                                  ;; db 12 dup(0)
 53095                                  
 53096                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:1344h)

 53120                                  
 53121                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 53122                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 53124                                  DOSDATASIZE equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
